loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter S. is 36 years old. He is married and has a little son. His wife is unemployed and she keeps the baby.

Peter graduated economy in the University of Blagoevgrad and after his graduation started to work for his father who sales heat equipment and spares for it.

They worked together for 6 years but after a quarrel between them Peter decided to do this business alone. He used the experience he gained and a year ago set his own store for heat equipment. Now he is running the business alone.

A number of new buildings are being built nearby so Peter S. has lots of orders. That is why he needs $ 1 200 loan to supply some new spares for the electricity equipment he sales.

loans.use: To supply some new spares for the electricity equipment

loans.name: Boika

texts.en:
Boika K. has been a teacher for over 30 years. She still teaches “Information Technologies” in the English Language School in Blagoevgrad. She says she likes her job very much.

At the same time Boika K. keeps a paint store on one of the main streets of the town. She is in this business because of his son. He is 33 years old and started this paint trading some years ago but soon found a new business and now Boika is responsible for the store.

Her day is divided in two – the first half she spends at school and the second half in the store. She spends her free time with her granddaughter and helps her in her lessons. She will use this $ 1 200 loan to supply 1 000 boxes of paint in new different colors.

loans.use: To supply some new colors of paint

loans.name: Valentin

texts.en:
Valentin N. is a cutter and his wife is a tailor. Valentin is 65 years old and for 30 years he had worked as a cutter in a tailor factory in Blagoevgrad. There he met his wife.

In 1990 the factory was closed and both Valentine and his wife became unemployed. Then they decided to set their own tailor atelier.

They borrowed some money from friends and used them to buy an old swing machine and an iron press. Now 16 years later their two sons help them in this little business. He still cuts, she still sews and their sons do the delivery.

Now Valentin needs a new model iron press and some sewing materials and applies for this $ 1 200 loan

loans.use: To buy a new model iron press and some sewing materials

loans.name: Elsy

texts.en:
Elsy owns a small store in her neighborhood where she sells foods such as rice, sugar and oil. Her neighbor gave her moral support to open this store because she realized there was not much competition in her sector of the community. Before opening the store she worked in a plastic factory but had to leave her children unattended at home. 5 years ago she decided to start this microenterprise because it would give her the flexibility to be with her family and would also provide for them. She is separated from her husband and is therefore a single mother of 3. She will use the loan to diversify and increase her product offerings.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a larger variety of items to sell and purchase at wholesale prices

loans.name: Toncho

texts.en:
Toncho T. lives in Pavlikeni, a small town close to Veliko Turnovo – one of the ancient capitals of Bulgaria. Pavlikeni is a town with very low economic growth and high level of unemployment. Toncho has s wife and a son, who is now studying agriculture.

Toncho and his wife are unemployed. He works as a shepherd but only during summer months.

Not long time ago they participated in a training “Encouraging the private entrepreneurship, start up and development of own business”. As a result of this training Toncho was registered as a private agricultural producer.

Now Toncho T. needs 1 200 USD to bye 10 sheep and to resell them when they grow up in s few months. This money he will use again to buy new sheep.

He wants now to increase the income of his household, because his son is growing up, that’s why he took the decision to register himself as an agricultural producer, to receive legal right to breed sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Heladeria Nieves is a small Ice Cream Shop owned by Nieves A. (appropriately, Nieves means snow in Spanish). At her shop she also sells snacks and candies. She has a good amount of business because her ice cream shop is conveniently located by a school and a children’s park. Therefore most of her clients are kids and young adults. She started this business with only $30 about four years ago. She would like to take out this loan in order to buy ice cream at larger quantities and also to continue to invest in other products that may be attractive to her young clients. She also wants to finish paying off the last $100 she owes for the freezer she stores the ice cream in.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy ice cream, candy and snacks for her ice cream shop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa Z.’s market has only been operating for 1 year. She started the business with her husband who helped her a great deal in the beginning. Unfortunately Rosa separated from him 5 months ago and has hit hard times. She finds no other option but to borrower from the loan sharks who charge a monthly 20% interest rate that barely allows her to say profits from her sales. She would like to take out the loan to replace the capital from these loan sharks. She will continue investing in basic goods such as rice, oil, chicken and meat. She fears she may lose her business if she does not find an alternative to the loan sharks.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in goods to sell at her market

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a cosmetics saleswoman. She started off in this line of work by helping her cousin whose products she would sell in order to receive a small percentage of the profits. Eventually Narcisa began buying products on her own and continue with her sales. She is in need of the loan so she may purchase her cosmetic items at wholesale prices. Particularly she will be purchasing makeup and perfumes which are the hottest selling items. This loan would be perfect before the Christmas season approaches and demand increases for these products.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy makeup, perfume and other cosmetic products to sell before the busy Christmas season

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a noodle distributor for her local neighborhood. She has been doing this for over 4 years with her daughter. Her husband as a great motivator and urged her to begin this line of business. He saved portions from his wages as a driver in a nearby factory and put put up the start-up capital for the business. She needs this loan in order to fix the floors in her storage space which were damaged during government reparations of the street and sidewalk. She needs to have somewhere where she can store her inventory safely and hygienically.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the storage facilities for her product

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Cruz and her sister opened this store about 4 years ago. There they sell all types of products to the community ranging from jewelry to office supplies. Cruz and her sister started off by putting together savings and selling just paper, pens and other school supplies. As they grew they began to invest in many different products to sell.

Although the business was going well Cruz’s sister married about a year ago and made the decisions to move to a new city. Obviously this has affected Cruz. She must now make monthly payments to her sister in order to repay for the capital she put up. Instead of having two people invest the business now it is only Cruz and even she is limited by the payments.

Cruz is now seeking this loan in order to invest in new products that will be particularly popular during the Christmas season. She is confident in her ability to sell and assures lenders that there is sufficient demand to justify an investment.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell at her store

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Mr.Cirilo H. likes to sell food, that’s why he has 4 years in this business. He prepares Mexican tacos with flour tortilla, and different kind of beef, her wife and son help him in the preparation and he sells on the streets of this city. Mr. Cirilo said: “This family business has paid all our expenses”. The kitchen equipment of Mr. Cirilo H. is failing. He is asking for a loan of $900.00 to buy a grill and the necessary kitchen equipment for the food elaboration. With this money he will be able to prepare more variety of food and obtain a better income, he is planning to repay in 12 months.

Español

El Sr. Cirilo Hernández siempre ha tenido gusto por la venta de comida, por ello lleva 4 años en este negocio. El prepara tacos de tortilla de harina con diferentes guisados, su esposa y su hijo le ayudan en la elaboración y el sale los vende en las calles de esta ciudad. El Sr. Cirilo dice: “este negocio familiar ha pagado todos nuestros gastos”. El equipo de cocina del Sr.Cirilo Hernández empieza a fallar por lo cual solicita un crédito para comprar una parrilla con quemadores y otros utensilios necesarios para la preparación de los alimentos. El solicita un crédito por $900.00 para adquirir el equipo que le hace falta. Esto facilitaría el trabajo de toda mi familia y nos permitiría aumentar la variedad de comida y como resultado tendría más venta y mejores utilidades. Este crédito planeo pagarlo en unos 12 meses.

loans.use: buy food preparation equipment

loans.name: Malinka

texts.en:
Malinka Zdrvavkova is 50 years old. 4 years ago because of the unemployment in her home village, she and her family moved to Blagoevgrad, which is one of the developed cities in Bulgaria that stands 100 km. south of the capital Sofia.

Since the time of movement the family leads a struggle for existence. It was hard for them to find a job so they decided to start own business with fruit and vegetables trading. It is a family business for Malinka, her husband and their 2 sons.

Right now before the winter Bulgarian people traditionally keep vegetables in store to use them during winter months. This reason makes Malinka Z. apply for this $1 200 loan to supply fresh vegetables – cucumbers, peppers, tomatoes and others.

loans.use: To supply fresh vegetables – cucumbers, peppers, tomatoes and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the business

loans.name: Sasho

texts.en:
Sasho S. lives in the village of Stambolovo which is 10 km. far from the small Bulgarian town Pavlikeni. Sasho’s only business is cattle breeding. He has two cows and a calf.

Sasho needs $ 1 000 to buy a new cow. This will increase his monthly income with 30 %. Callte breeding and milk selling is Sasho’s only source of income.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en:
Jordan M. has roma orogin. He and his family live in Pirdop- small town, 60 km. from Sofia city.The house, where family Jordanovi live is situated on the highway road of Pirdop, close to the Roma populated districts. There is a church built in the house yard- Orthodox Church of God. Jordan M. is also a pastor of the Church. The whole family is very religious.

Before the start of his little business Jordan and his wife work different low income jobs, like participation in the programs for employment, wooden materials supply.

3 years ago they bought a pavilion, which was situated in his yard and started retail trade with foodstuffs.

Now Jordan M. needs 1 200 loan to supply washing materials to his pavilion

loans.use: To supply washing materials to his pavilion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the computer bureau.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Improve on the implementation of his project of afforestration.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Io improve on his implementation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 43 years old; she is capable, responsible and so talented person. Lives in Tampico Tamaulipas and she started to make handmade products since 1993, at first she started to make that because she likes it and then many people looked her and appreciate the excellent job. But she was working in a private enterprise and did not have time to this job, however, one of her little sons was sick and she left her job, at the moment she does not medical insurance and the family expenses were more than before, so she started again her business with her handmade products to parties and weddings. This year she started to cook special cookies that have too much demand.

** She is requesting for a loan of $650 DLLS to purchase raw materials to her job and be prepare to Christmas season. Ofelia hopes your help and hopes to be a better woman.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

** Ofelia tiene 43 años, considerada como una persona capaz, responsable y muy talentosa. Vive en Tampico Tamaulipas y comenzó hacer manualidades desde 1993, inició esta actividad por gusto propio pero también porque la gente buscaba su gran trabajo, trabajaba en una empresa privada y no le quedaba tiempo para esta actividad, sin embargo, uno de sus tres hijos enfermo y tuvo que dejar de trabajar. Sin un seguro medico, los gastos en el hogar comenzaron a elevarse debido a la enfermedad de su hijo. Entonces comenzó su propio negocio, retomando las manualidades, hacia arreglos para fiestas y bodas principalmente. Este año comenzó a cocinar galletas de cajeta, las cuales tienen mucha aceptación.

** Ofelia requiere de $650 Dlls. para enfrentar la alta de demanda de temporada navideña y piden de tu ayuda para comprar los materiales para la producción de sus manualidades e insumos para la producción de galletas para estas épocas navideñas.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Improve on the business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is gentle, optimistic and hard working woman, with 31 years old, she lives in Altamira, Tamaulipas and married with a chemical engineer, she started her own business to help to her husband in the family expenses. She is thinking about the future of her babies, because she wants a better life for them, she started to sell shoes around her neighborhood since 4 years ago, then, she changed the way of shoes sales for school articles sales. She is doing in a small place that is in front of her house. Actually she is studying to be technic beauty and thinks to have a beauty salon. She has a stationery store that is perfectly working.

** She is requesting for a loan of $650 DLLS to purchase raw materials like pencils, pens, notebooks and more, hopes to grow up her business and satisfy the next high demand. She will be thanksful and her family too.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

** Sonia tiene 31 años, es gentil, optimista y muy trabajadora. Vive en Altamira Tamaulipas y se caso con un Ingeniero Químico, inició su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, Sonia piensa mucho en el futuro de sus bebes y desea proporcionarles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida, comenzó a vender zapatos a los alrededores de donde vive hace ya 4 años, después cambió el giro de venta por la venta de artículos escolares haciéndolo en un pequeño lugar enfrente de su casa. Actualmente esta estudiando para ser estilista y en un futuro quiere poner su propio salón de belleza.

** Sonia requiere de $650 DLLS para comprar materia prima como lápices, plumas libretas y más. Necesita de algunos artículos y materiales para su papelería con el fin de poder hacerla crecer. Ella como su familia te agradecerán la ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Material

loans.name: Guadelia

texts.en:
Guadelia is a 39 year-old from Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has 5 children, but only 3 still live with her. For the last 6 months, Ms. Z. has been completely dedicated to her business which she runs out of her home. She spends less time with her children unfortunately, but she is making great progress at work. Guadelia’s husband helps out with the kids and he drives her into town when she needs to stock up on inventory for the store. Although his income doesn’t cover the costs of the family, Guadelia is now doing her part to bring in a second source of income. She wants to give her children the best education possible and thinks that, if she can get a loan through Kiva and Mifex, she can purchase new inventory to attract customers who need more than just one or two items. She plans to grow her shop to the point that anyone can some there to find household goods of all sorts.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: if she can get a loan through Kiva and Mifex, she can purchase new inventory to attract customers who need more than just one or two items. She plans to grow her shop to the point that anyone can some there to find household goods of all sorts.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara M. owns a cosmetic and clothing shop in a part of Guayaquil called La Zona. She even makes breakfast for the children of her customers who come in to shop before they head out to work. Sara first opened her business by borrowing $100 from the chulqueros or loan sharks, and she typically works 7am-7pm. Her goal is to be a consultant for Yanbal, an Ecuadorian beauty supply company that places products in most salons across the country. She would like to use the proceeds from her loan to construct a store next to her home. She knows the fashion and cosmetics industry, so she would like to continue helping customers find the best products. Sara is a 31 year-old married mother of two who loves the business she runs. She says that the best part about her job is that she helps women feel good about themselves when they get dressed up for special occasions. Ms. M. is asking for this loan so she can purchase more Yanbal products, take a seminar in cosmetic sales, and buy a variety of clothes for her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Ms. Medina is asking for this loan so she can purchase more Yanbal products, take a seminar in cosmetic sales, and buy a variety of clothes for her store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old, she considers her self as a responsable, working and powerful woman. She lives in Altamira Tampico Tamaulipas with her husband that works as a fisherman and also they have a beautiful girl, Delia thinks to give her a education and better life, for that reason, she works so hard and always is worry for the seasons that her husband does not have a job and knows that all is difficult on the family.

** To support her family expenses in difficult times, when the fish sales are lower than other seasons, she started to sell lottery tickets and perfumes in her house. With the small incomes, she started a small grocery store around 3 years ago and now she sells lingerie clothes to support all difficult seasons. All her effort is to survive with her family in that seasons.

** Delia is requesting for a loan of $475 USD to acquire the merchandise to her business and increase her sales form the next Christmas season, she is waiting for a increase her demand and hopes your help.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

** Delia tiene 50 años de edad se considera una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y tenaz. Ella vive en Altamira Tampico Tamaulipas, con un esposo que trabaja desde hace 20 años como pescador y una hermosa niña a la cual quiere ofrecerle una educación, Delia trabaja muy duro, se preocupa por las temporadas en las que su esposo no tiene trabajo y sabe que las cosas son muy difíciles. Para apoyar con los gasto del hogar en épocas cuando las ventas son bajas de pescado, comenzó vendiendo billetes de lotería y perfumes dentro de su casa, con sus pequeñas ganancias, hace 3 años puso una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes y también vende ropa de lencería. Todo este trabajo es la base para la sobre vivencia de su familia en estas épocas difíciles.

** Delia requiere de $475 USD para adquirir el material de venta de su tienda y así aumentar sus ventas que en estas próximas fechas navideñas espera tener un gran incremento. Ella pide de tu ayuda y agradece tu caridad.

loans.use: Acquire the Merchandise

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila B. has owned her business for two years now. She sells household goods to people in the north part of Guayaquil. Teofila’s husband taught her how to operate the business and built their house on an empty piece of land. He works as a property manager, leading construction of homes on unused land. They typically work from 7am until 10 pm. Teofila is asking for this loan so that she can invest in marketing materials and rent a location in the busy bazaar where other poor families can come to buy household items. Ms. B. is 56 years old and has lived in Guayaquil her whole life. Now that her children are grown, she focuses most of her time on the business and wants nothing more but to grow into a professional property company.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Teofila is asking for this loan so that she can invest in marketing materials and rent a location in the busy bazaar where other poor families can come to buy household goods.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
It was only shortly after they married 12 years ago that Monica and her husband started this bakery. Their location on the main road of the city certainly helps them attract a steady flow of clients. They are repeat Kiva and Mifex lenders. Thanks to their first loan Monica and her husband were able to invest in the ingredients for bread and also in new products to sell from her bakery. She and her husband now sell yogurt, soda and fresh juice. She is extremely grateful for the loan she received and is now applying for a second one. With this second loan she will invest in a new industrial blender for her bakery. She is also seriously contemplating opening a new bakery under the leadership of her son at a separate location.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in an industrial blender and possibly open a second location

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is a blacksmith who owns a workshop where he and his three sons make metal doors, window frames and gates. The workshop is a family business that provides the main source of income for the household. Their mother works nearby at her small food market.

This is the second loan that Cesar is requesting from Mifex and Kiva. With the first he invested in large amounts of iron in order to produce at higher quantities. He and his sons got to work and have been able to increase their sales substantially. Cesar is happy that he has been able to provide work and money for himself and his kids. He expresses great gratitude towards Kiva because this is truly a family a business that he and his kids are dependent upon. He will use the second loan for the same purpose as his business continues to flourish and clients increase consistently.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in metal materials for his workshop where he makes gates, doors and window frames

loans.name: Sotero

texts.en:
Sotero is a tailor who works with his wife to make suits, school uniforms and other clothing articles. This family business is the main source of income for them and their 6 year old child. This is the second time Sotero is seeking a loan from Mifex and Kiva. With his first loan he was able to boost his production for the school year and saw his income increase significantly. He has made a formal agreement with a large distributor for whom he produces a pre-determined amount of clothing articles per week. He also continues to sell to the people in his community. He is now seeking a second loan with Kiva and Mifex in order to purchase a newer and better sewing machine as well as a large amount of fabric. He anticipates a very busy Christmas season and is thus preparing for a major increase in production.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Sotero will invest in a new and more powerful sewing machine as well as in fabrics

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
A year ago Juan and his mother opened this small restaurant. They mainly sell food for people on the go and they also specialize in lunch time meals. Juan has been working in this line of work since he was 14 and is now the head of the restaurant although his mother does help him quite a bit. He is 18 years old and studies commerce at a local university during the night time. He is seeking the loan in order to purchase ingredients and dining utensils for the restaurant.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Ingredients and utensils for their restaurant

loans.name: Galo

texts.en:
Baking has long been the family trade for the Santianas. As a youngster Galo helped his father at his bakery and then worked for another family member until three years ago when he decided to open his own bakery. His sister Monica, who is also a baker and a Kiva borrower, helped him out by providing the oven and finding a spot for his business. Now he and his wife work everyday from 5 am until late in the night. They are seeking a loan in order to invest in raw ingredients such as flour and baking soda. He wants to also buy the ingredients to make Christmas bread for upcoming holiday season.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Baking ingredients

loans.name: Juan Gerardo

texts.en:
Seven years ago Gerardo started his business with the grocery and meat sales, he lost his job from where he was working and that proved a very difficult time for him. He was working in a slaughter and that was the reason to start a new business. He thinks about life, that it would have to be honest and lovely, so, he is looking for a worthy life and thinks about his family all the time.

He is married and is 36 years old, he is very hard-working and has two children. His wife divides her time assisting the home and her children, as well as she supports him in the business.

Some months ago he began other small business of groceries, sometimes his niece takes care of the business. This is the reason he gave her a job because in the afternoon he takes care of the business and is motivated to gain more working capital. For this reason he requires a loan of $925 USD to purchase merchandise for his business, in order to be able to cover his demand of clients. He requests a term to pay back in 6-12 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Hace siete años Don Gerardo inició su negocio de venta de abarrotes y carnes, debido a que se quedo sin empleo al ser despedido de donde trabajaba, él trabajaba en una carnicería eso lo motivo a establecerse por su propia cuenta a fin de poder salir adelante y tener una manera digna de vivir, además de poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Él esta casado, tiene 36 años de edad, es muy trabajador y tiene dos hijos, su esposa divide su tiempo atendiendo el hogar y a sus hijos, así como también le apoya en el negocio atendiéndolo.

Hace unos meses inició otro pequeño negocio de abarrotes, el cual a ratos atiende su sobrina, a quien le ha dado trabajo, y por la tarde el lo atiende, Lo anterior motivo a que se quedara corto de capital de trabajo, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo por $ 925 USD para poder comprar mercancías y resurtir su negocio, a fin de poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita un plazo para pagar de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irma Lorena

texts.en:
Irma is a very active and hard-working woman, she is married and her husband works in the hospital of the town, they have four children, of 18, 17, 7 and 2 years old respectively. She began her business one year ago. She invested some capital and she had make it grow. Her necessity in that moment was contribute to the family economy and offer to her children a good education, the biggest young guys study the preparatory and they help in the business in their free time, also Irma’s small business offers employment to two people.

Their business requires work capital, and for that reason she is requesting for a loan of $475 USD to purchase and provide better merchandise to her clients, she promise to repay this loan in a term of 4-8 months.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Irma es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, esta casada y su esposo trabaja en el hospital del pueblo, tienen cuatro hijos, de 18, 17, 7 y 2 años respectivamente. Ella inició su negocio hace un año, invirtió un poco de capital y lo ha hecho crecer. Su necesidad en ese entonces era poder contribuir a la economía familiar y poder brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación, los dos más grandes estudian la preparatoria y ayudan en el negocio en sus ratos libres. Además su pequeño negocio brinda empleo a dos personas más.

Su negocio requiere de capital de trabajo, es por eso que solicita un préstamo por $ 475 USD para poder surtir mejor y contar con las mercancías que le solicitan sus clientes, ella espera pagarlo en un plazo de 4-8 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 42 years old, is an entrepreneur and active woman, she is a single mother of two children, one of 15 years old and other of 8 years old. Four years ago she began their small business of shoes for catalog sales with an investment of $180 USD, taking acquaintances` orders from her clients and day by day was having a bigger acceptance among her clients.

Her procedure to sell her merchandise is that she takes the order of her clients and she has to finance the payment of the shoes orders, also she allows to her clients that pay to her in comfortable payments, it is for this reason that she has a great demand.

Due to the above-mentioned she needs a loan for $475 USD to purchase merchandise and provide her orders, she is thinking to repay the loan in a term of 3 to 6 months.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Dolores una mujer emprendedora y activa de 42 años, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos, de 15 y 8 años respectivamente. Hace cuatro años inició su pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo con una inversión de $ 180 USD, tomando pedidos de sus conocidos y cada día fue teniendo una mayor aceptación entre sus clientes.

Su procedimiento para vender es que ella toma el pedido de sus clientes y tiene que financiar el pago de los pedidos de zapatos, ya que además les permite a sus clientes que le paguen en cómodos abonos, es por eso que tienen gran demanda.

Debido a lo anterior ella necesita un préstamo por $ 475 USD para la compra de zapatos y poder surtir sus pedidos, piensa pagar el crédito en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
One year ago Patricia began her business of groceries sales with a small investment of $140 USD, she started buying sodas and a little groceries, so she was known between her neighbors. She is a dynamic and collaborating woman, she`s married and her husband is working in the bread elaboration business, they have three children of 17, 15 and 12 years old respectively, all her kids are studying and when they leave their school help her in the business.

Patricia wants to begin offering fruits and vegetables to her clients, because this kind of food have been a constant orders of her clients. For this reason, she needs a loan of $275 USD to have work capital and purchase fruits and vegetables to her business, she considers that with this loan, her sales will increase and she offers to repay this loan in a term of 6-12 months.

**\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Hace un año que Patricia inició su negocio de venta de abarrotes con una pequeña inversión inicial de $140 USD, la cual destino a comprar refrescos y algo de abarrotes, fue así como se dio a conocer entre sus vecinos.

Ella es una mujer dinámica y colaboradora, esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de pan, tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años respectivamente, todos los cuales estudian y cuando salen de su escuela le ayudan en el negocio.

Patricia quiere iniciar ofreciendo frutas y verduras a sus clientes, ya que ha sido un pedido constante por parte de ellos, es por eso que necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 USD para tener capital de trabajo y poder surtir de frutas y verduras su negocio, considera que con ello se incrementarán sus ventas y podrá pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.en:
Luz is considered a tenacious, responsible, optimist and hard-working person, she is 46 years old, and always has worried for her children education, with 4 children and her husbands, her ability and pleasure for sales has taken to create her own business and offer an education and better quality of life to her children. She started at the garage of her house with a small groceries store supported by her husband, who dedicated to the sales. Luz was successful in the groceries sales business, but then she began used clothes sales business, without leaving her groceries business. Her children collaborate with the operation of the business and Luz comments that the family force makes her business continues ahead. Luz needs a loan of $925 DLLS to purchase groceries and clothes merchandise that allow her to have a better selection for the next and near Christmas season. Their family will thank your help.

**\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Luz se considera una persona tenaz, responsable, optimista y trabajadora, con 46 años de edad ella siempre esta preocupada por la educación de sus hijos, con 4 hijos y su esposos, su habilidad y gusto por las ventas la ha llevado a crear su propio negocio y así poderles brindar una educación y mejor calidad de vida. Inició en la cochera de su casa con una tienda de abarrotes ayudada principalmente por su esposo, el cual se dedica a las ventas. Luz tuvo éxito en la venta de abarrotes, poco después inició con la venta de ropa usada, sin dejar el negocio de abarrotes. Sus hijos colaboran con el funcionamiento del negocio y Luz menciona que la fuerza familiar hace que su negocio siga adelante. Luz necesita de $925 DLLS para la adquisición de abarrotes y bultos de ropa que le permitan tener un mejor surtido para la próxima y muy pronta temporada navideña. Su familia agradecerá tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old, honest, entrepreneur and very hard-working woman is as she describes her self. With 2 very young children and her husband, who works in a gas company. She has been already for some time without work and then she began to worry about the family expenses, she knew that they family expenses were many and her children education was first of all. So, 2 years ago her friendships invited her to sell products Megahealth, obtaining very good results.

Their husband helps her with some connections between his clients and now she is very motivated with the sale of these products. Hoping to support to her family, Gloria is requesting for a loan of $750 DLLS to purchase merchandise of Megahealth because she has had a lot of demand and she has not been able to cover it due to her limited resources. Gloria’s family appreciated your help.

**\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Gloria tiene 42 años, honesta, emprendedora y muy trabajadora es como Gloria se describe así misma. Con 2 hijos muy jóvenes y su esposo, el cual trabaja en una empresa de gas. Ella se quedo sin trabajo hace ya algún tiempo y entonces empezó a preocuparse por los gastos familiares, sabía que eran muchos y que la educación de sus hijos era primordial, hace 2 años sus amistades la invitaron a vender productos Megahealth, obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

Su esposo la ayudo con algunas conexiones entre sus clientes y ahora ella esta muy motivada en la venta de estos productos. Esperando apoyar a su familia y sacarla adelante, Gloria requiere de un préstamo de $750 DLLS para la adquisición de productos Megahealth ya que ha tenido mucha demanda y no ha podido cubrirla debido a sus escazos recursos. Gloria y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Concepción

texts.en:
Concepcion is a responsible, honest person and love her family, she is 46 years old, and lives in Tampico, Tamaulipas. When she left her work to give birth to her youngest daughter, she knew that her husband`s salary would not cover the necessities of the family, for that reason, in October of 1999 with her husband`s support, in a place inside her house began a small paper sales business. Her biggest concern were her daughters, so she started very motivated.

Concepcion has 7 years with her business, however, she needs of your help to purchase merchandise and cover her demand for these next months during the busy season. Concepcion appreciates your generosity and she is requestin for loan of $750 Dlls.

**\\\\\\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\\\\\"

Concepción es una persona responsable, honesta y entregada totalmente a su familia, con 46 años de edad, Concepción vive en Tampico Tamaulipas. al quedarse sin trabajo y al nacer la mas pequeña de sus hijas, sabia que el sueldo de su marido no cubriría las necesidades de la familia, por lo que en octubre de 1999 con el apoyo de su esposo, en un espacio dentro de su casa inició una pequeña papelería, su mayor preocupación eran sus hijas, por lo que comenzó muy motivada.

Concepción tiene 7 años con su negocio, sin embargo, necesita de tu ayuda para adquirir los artículos necesarios y que la papelería pueda enfrentar la demanda esperada para estas próximas fechas de mayores ventas. Concepción espera tu generosidad para un préstamo de $750 Dlls.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is an optimistic, intelligent and working woman, she is 54 years old, and living in Tampico, Tamaulipas, she is married and has two children, her husband is a construction worker with a variable income, for that reason they could not cover all the family expenses .

Long time ago she decided to start a small business, cooking Mexican food as tamales, gorditas, taquitos and more selling them between her neighbors. Years later, she learned to cook a special kind of cookies and now she complements her family income with the Stanhome products sales.

Vicenta is requesting $650 USD to buy raw materials to produce her cookies and by other hand she wants buy merchandise to offer to her clients for the next Christmas season. She knows her sales are going to increase in December. She going to repay in a term of 5-10 months.

\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Vicenta tiene 54 años, se considera una persona optimista, inteligente y trabajadora, vive en Tampico Tamaulipas y ella esta casada y tienen dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como albañil en la construcción por lo que tiene un ingreso variable y por esta razón no alcanza a cubrir todos los gastos familiares.

Hace mucho tiempo ella se decidió a iniciar un pequeño negocio, cocinando comida mexicana como tamales, gorditas, taquitos, etc. vendiéndola entre sus de donde vive. Años después ella aprendió a cocinar unas galletas especiales y ahora ella complementa el ingreso familiar con la venta también de productos Stanhome.

Vicenta requiere de $650 DLLS para la compra de materia prima y poder producir esas ricas galletas, además quiere surtir los productos Stanhome para su venta para la próxima temporada navideña. Ella esta consciente de que sus ventas se van a incrementar en Diciembre. Ella piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 5-10 meses.

loans.use: to buy raw material and home products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. has owned her business for 3 years. She sells men’s and women’s clothes door-to-door in a part of Guayaquil called Mapasingue. She originally started out with the help of her son who loaned her $200. Every day she works from 9am until 5pm selling her clothes to neighbors, friends, and shoppers near the local bazaar. Maria has a second source of income from cleaning clothes for a family two days a week. She is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex so that she can afford marketing materials and better equipment for transporting her goods in a presentable fashion. The months of November and December are particularly important because most families buy gifts during the holidays and prepare for the new year. This 41 year-old from Manabi, Ecuador has three children and is married to a loving husband who helps out with the business. 

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex so that she can afford marketing materials and better equipment for transporting her goods in a presentable fashion.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on stock to alarger scale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose owns a fish stand at a local market near his home. He has been working in the seafood industry since he was young when he helped his father. When he married his current wife he already had this business which has always helped him support his family. He wakes up everyday at 5 in the morning to buy the freshest fish and take it to his stand. His wife helps him on the weekends which are always busier at these markets.

He needs this loan in order to fix up his stand. He will also buy much larger quantities of fish at discount prices. He believes that this will help him increase his revenue and profit. With the increased money from the loans he plans to also fix up the run down walls and floor of his home. He is also planning on converting the rooms where his kids lived to an apartment he can rent out for a complimentary source of income.

Jose is 56 years old, is married and has three children. His wife has been his right hand for the business as she has always had the capacity to take lead as well as assist. He has three college aged kids who have jobs but who he still helps financially.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Make improvements to his stand at the local market and buy fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanquita owns a business selling soft drinks and homemade ice cream. Three years ago she began making bolos, a type of home made Popsicle made from water and flavored mix. Every other day she will produce about 200-300 bolos by using bags in order to shape and store these popsicles. She sells these consistently to children are on their way home from school for 5 cents each. They are a big hit in the community because of the hot and humid weather of Guayaquil.

She will use the loan in order to purchase bags, mix, cups and more soda. She is seeking the loan because she also wants to begin making other types of ice cream that are dairy based and have fruit.

Blanca is 55 years old and has three children from her first marriage who are all independent. She now lives with her second husband who has a stand selling snow cones nearby. She focuses on this as her main business but always has side jobs because of her work as a seamstress.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Continue making her homemade ice cream

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a mechanic who operates his shop out of his home. He’s been working on cars for 20 years since he graduated highschool. He worked in someone else’s shop while he slowly saved his money and gradually bought his own tools. He set up his business right out of his home which is conveniently located on a corner street with a steady amount of traffic. He is known in the community for his quality work and his industriousness. He has 2 assistants and also employs another mechanic. He will use the loan to buy tools and make replacement parts

Luis is 42 years old, is married and has 2 children. When he first started his business his house was built from wood, but he has now been able to improve it with cement. He has been steadily improving his home and his business and is hoping he can continue. His dream is to see his kids grow up healthy and get through college.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Materials for his mechanics shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock and agriculture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply Milk storage cans and assorted veterinary products to peasant farmers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
K. is a young newly married man and the sole provider for his younger sister and brother who stay with him. He has never had any formal employment and started his pay phone business in the year 2005 with a loan of U.S $ 280 from Eb-F. He used the loan amount to hire small premises in town, to stock 6 community payphones and cell phones accessories. 
The venture proved successful and K. has since been able to repay his loan in full. He uses the income from the business to provide for himself and his younger siblings who are now able to attend school.
Because of his superior marketing skills he has been contracted to supply pay phones to rural women groups.
The women groups will use the pay phones as income generation activities. In Kenyan rural areas communication is limited by lack of telephone hand sets. The women will place the pay phones at strategic points in rural centers where the general public can make and receive calls at a fee. K. will provide the groups with after sale maintenance services. 
K. is requesting for a loan of U.S $ 450.He Will use the amount to purchase 10 community pay phones and 5 repair kits. This will in turn enable him to be supplying 5 pay phones per month earning him enough income to see his brother and sister through high school.
He is able to handle the loan and repay without a problem.

loans.use: Supplying Community Payphones to women groups in rural areas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock and also purchase some bulls for cultivation.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married and caring for 10 children. She is running a business of fish selling and she has been doing this business for 3 years.

She first started by being a broker thus some one who coordinates business people who could buy in retail from wholesalers. Out of her wages she also started buying from wholesalers and could sell in retail.

Thereafter she was also able to buy from the fisher men at the lakes and then comes and sells in retail. This business has been of great help to her and her family.

Currently she is having a problem in capital thus her capital is low and yet she wishes to buy from manufacturers and comes to sell in wholesale.

This is why she is requesting for a loan of $1300 to enable her add on what she has so as to also buy from manufacturers and come and sell in wholesale than retail.

Retail selling is not bad, but only that delays if you have got much stock, so that is why she wishes to sell in wholesale.

Any assistance given will be appreciated. She is a capable woman and will be able to pay.

loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Difas

texts.en:
Difas is married having 4 children and caring for 3 other. He is operating a retail shop and started it August this year.

He is facing a challenge of capital he start with $150 and currently having $200 as capital. His business is strategic and there are many customers around where he sells.

He is requesting for a loan of $1000 to help him improve on his stock by stocking variety of goods and this will help him get more profits hence improve on the standard of his business.

Any help given will be of great help to him and his family. He is capable of paying back promptly.

loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on Business

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and a single mother. She has one child who stays with her mother because Josephine has been unemployed and could not be able to provide for the child.
She recently started a business of selling chicken to local hotels and individual buyers at the Municipal Market. She learnt the art of chicken dressing from her grand father who use to trade at the same market before retiring.
She started her business by stocking chicken given to her on credit by her mother’s friends. She sells the chicken then pays the creditors leaving some income for her. Sometimes she is unable to get the birds on credit and sometimes the Friends do not have the birds. On such occasions she is unable to supply the hotels and therefore earns no income.
Josephine is requesting a loan of US $ 675 to buy a stock of 300 birds. This will enable her meet the demand from her customers without depending so much on her mother’s friends.
The income that she will earn will enable her take her son from her mother and provide for him herself. She will be able to take him to school and to meet her own up keep.
She will employ one other person to help her with the chicken dressing while she concentrates on marketing.
She has enough customers and she will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase Chicken from Farmers and re sell to local hotels.

loans.name: Difas

texts.en:
Difas is married having 4 children and caring for 3 other. He is operating a retail shop and started it August this year.

He is facing a challenge of capital he start with $150 and currently having $200 as capital. His business is strategic and there are many customers around where he sells.

He is requesting for a loan of $1000 to help him improve on his stock by stocking variety of goods and this will help him get more profits hence improve on the standard of his business.

Any help given will be of great help to him and his family. He is capable of paying back promptly.

loans.name: Maliat

texts.en:
Maliat is a single mother having 3 children. She dropped out of school in 1986 and became a mother in 1995. life has been so hard that even maintaining her family has not been easy.

In 2000 she started to do some business that has been helping her though there has been some changes on the business types.

At the moment she is running mobile business of buying some produce in village markets and thereafter takes to the boarding markets thus at the boarder of Kenya and Uganda.

She is dealing in G/nut buying and selling and this business has helped her educated her elder son.

However, at time she faces exchange rate problems thus when the exchange rates fall you find that there are losses incurred, yet the capital is also small.

So this is why she is requesting for a loan of $1400 to enable her increase her stock and this will her realize some profits when the stock is big.

Any assistance awarded is highly appreciated.

loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a single mother having 2 children and caring for 2 others. She a very courageous lady and active.

She has dealt in this business since 1996 and it has enabled her educate her children and even the ones she is caring for, these children have finished their education and these is out the profits she could get from her business.

She is dealing in selling of Textile and assorted goods and this business has been so helpful to her.

She is currently having too much demand and yet the stock is low. This is why she is applying for a loan to help her increase on her stock.

She is requesting for a loan of $1500 to hellp her improve on the business. She is a very capable woman and will be able to pay back promptly.

loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Dr Beatrice B. an Obstetrician gynecologist is one of the senior member and a consultant to the other junior network members of the KMET Network. She has applied for the loan to purchase a modern X-Ray machines costing US $ 10,418. She is ready to top up the balance from her savings to purchase this very essential equipment to improve the quality Reproductive health services at her facility.

loans.use: To purchase an ultrasound machine

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is a nurse/midwife who runs a private clinic in Nakuru town Rift Valley. Her facility that serves a slum community was voted as one of the best in the town. She has applied for  US $ 2,778 loan to enable her to renovate, create and equip two more rooms to create more space for her clients towards quality improvement.

loans.use: To purchase the clinic supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a community health based distrubutor who has been trained by KMET as a volunteer to improve contraceptive access to underserved women. She has applied for a loan to improve her poultry stock, chickens feeds and medicine/vaccines.

loans.use: To increase chicken stock, purchase feeds and medicine

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a nurse midwife who serves a community living within the Kakamega forest in western Kenya. She has been trained in comprehensive Reproductive health services. As a community based service provider she intends to improve the quality of the services offered through integration of laboratory services. She has applied for a loan to enable her purchase the necessary equipment and supplies for the laboratory services.

loans.use: To purchase Laboratory equipment

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe A. is a community based Nurse/Midwife who offers preventive and maternity services in a rural health facility in Siaya District, Western Kenya. She has applied for the loan to improve her stock of drugs at the facility to ensure that all clients leave the facility with drugs. At the moment she gives them a prescription to buy drugs at a commercial pharmacy in town but many don\'t buy the right dosage resulting into re- infection or drug resistance.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for her communty pharmacy

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 26 years old and lives with his mother and sister in Nakuru town. He is a high school graduate and is currently enrolled for a computer application course at a local college. He attends classes in the evening. Her mother is employed as a secretary in a local school while his sister is in primary school.
Gilbert was very close to his late grandmother who used to sell fruits and vegetables at the local market. When she passed on, Gilbert requested the family to allow him to continue the business at the market. He has been operating the business for 12 months now and has managed to double the sales. He is using the income from the business to supplement his mother’s earnings in providing for the family.
Because of his entrepreneurship drive Eb-F has assisted him win a tender to supply fruits and vegetables to a Tourist Hotel based in Nakuru.
Gilbert requests a loan of US $ 300 to purchase 25 bags of assorted fruits and vegetables. He will use the income to pay for his college fee and to help his mother buy a piece of land to build a family home.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura has a small stand near a local school where she sells lunch and snacks to the students. She started the business with just $100 that a close friend lent her and now she is seeking to expand her activities. Currently she just sells sandwiches and other fast food items to the children, but she now wants to expand her business and sell to the teachers. Therefore she will invest in a tables and chairs and she will also need to make different types of foods. She and her husband have two children. Their dream is to send their kids to college and to improve their home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Expand her food small stand into an area where people can sit

loans.name: Carmita

texts.en:
Carmita is a clothes sales woman. She sells clothes from her home and also goes around selling to her friends and acquaintances. She started by using just $150 of her husbands savings to buy clothes and slowly she established a faithful customer base. She is seeking this loan in order to buy clothes at wholesale prices. She also wants to improve her home and make it better fit to display the clothes she buys. She is originally from Manabi and traveled to Guayaquil to seek opportunities and work. Her goal is to improve her home where she, her husband and their two children live.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy her merechandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Yanina

texts.en:
Yanina has a store where she sells a variety of ítems. Mainly she sells basic foods and household necessities such as oil and soap. She also generates a good amount of revenue from her clothing sales. She buys from distributors who purchase their products in Peru for much lower prices. This allows her to offer her products at affordable prices to her clients. She hopes that before the holiday season approaches she can invest in a significant amount of merchandise. Yanin is 43 and is a single mother of one daughter.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in more affordable merchandise for her clients

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba has a store in her home where she sells basic groceries such as oil and rice. She started off very small when she bought the goods off another market that was going out of business and her business has steadily grown since. She now also sells gas tanks to the local community, which always provides a steady flow of business. She is looking to invest in fresh fruits and vegetables to sell with the loan from Kiva and Mifex. Her goal is to eventually operate her store separately from her home. She takes care of one daughter by herself and aspires to send her to college.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell at her market

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel owns a bakery where he works from 6 in the morning to 8 at night. He is fully dedicated to the success of this business because it is the main source of income for his family. He learned the trade from his parents who were also in this line of business. He started the business by saving until he had enough to buy an oven. Although his business is doing well he is in need of a glass display case for his bread. With the loan he hopes to buy this case and the raw materials necessary to increase production. With the extra profit he hopes to fix up his home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a display case for his bread

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Anita owns a beauty salon where she cuts hair and gives manicures and pedicures. She has been into cosmetology since she was young and her husband always supported her in her efforts to start her business. Three years ago he helped her find and fix up the location for her beauty shop and inspired her to start the business.

Anita needs the loan in order to improve the appearance of her salon and make necessary investments like a special chair, hair products and a special sink.

She is 40 years and has 4 children, two of which are already grown and contribute to the family income with their jobs. She will keep making improvements to her home and her business with the extra income earned. She also wants to formally employ one of her daughters at her business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the appearance of her salon and buy cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel runs a small stand where she sells poultry. She learned the business from her mother in law who taught her how to prepare the chicken for sale and how to run the stand efficiently. She works from 6 AM to 2 PM everyday which allows her to contribute to her family income and also spend time with her young children.

She currently works with the local loan sharks in order to invest in poultry but has realized that they are taking most of her profits because of their 20% monthly interest rates. She wants the loan in order to free herself from the dependency on informal lenders. She will use the money to buy chicken in larger quantities and store it in the freezer of her home.

Her husband works in another market and has a stand where he sells seafood. They are a close knit family and work to provide the best living they can for their two children. After ten years of living with their parents this couple has finally bought a humble home. They are in the process of fixing it up and will use the extra income generated for this purpose.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy poultry at wholesale prices and quantities

loans.name: Lusitania

texts.en:
Lusitania has a cart where she sells grilled meats (mostly carne asada). She has a pretty good amount of sales during the day, but she also must sell uncooked rice to her neighbors in order to make ends meet. She is seeking the loan in order to make significant improvements to her cart. Mainly she wants to build a roof on top of it in order to shield her from the sun and heat. She will also buy meat and rice at larger wholesale quantities and cheaper prices.

Lusitania is 28 years old and has two children. Her husband works in construction and has built the majority of their home. They have two young children who go to school. /

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the small cart she sells her products from

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella sells glasses and doing eye exams in Guayaquil. After working at an optometrist’s office for some time Estrella saved enough money to start her own business. She had to make a $480 investment in the glasses kit that she uses to take people’s measurements. After she takes the measurements and her clients chose the frames she sends the glasses in to get the correct lens put in. She mostly sells in her community, but also travels to colleges, churches and hospitals selling her products. She is very popular because there are not any optometrists that will go to their clients, especially in these marginalized communities.

She is currently separated from her husband and has the responsibility of providing for herself and her 15 year old child while he finished high school. Her dream is to finish her studies at the university so she can be a certified optometrist. She eventually wants to open her own office. She will invest the money in new frames and a second display case.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new glasses frames to sell to her clients

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. owns a small shop selling clothes. Her daughter helps out by keeping track of the money. When she started her business several years ago, Martha borrowed $200 from the loan sharks, costing her nearly 20% a month. Ms. A.’s daughters are artisans who make bracelets, earrings, anc necklaces. With their goods combined in one shop, they would have an advantage over most other stores. Martha is applying for this loan so she can put up a storefront in her house so she can show off all of her clothes and jewelry. With the proceeds of the loan she is hoping to improve the standard of living of her daughters and save up to send them to private school. This 35 year-old entrepreneur from Guayaquil is married and has six children. 
 
Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Martha is applying for this loan so she can put up a storefront in her house so she can show off all of her clothes and jewelry.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
G. Victoria owns a small shop selling household items. She was able to open her business thanks to a loan from her husband who sent $300 from Italy where he works. Every day from 7am until 9pm Ms. G. runs her store, which happens to be located in her house. Victoria is applying for this loan so she can purchase marketing material that is going to highlight her product specials and exhibit any goods she might be featuring. With the proceeds of the loan she is hoping to improve the standard of living of her children and save up to pay for their education. She says it is hard living as a single mother, but she has no desire to move to Italy. This 32 year-old entrepreneur who lives in Provincia de los Rios wants nothing more than to succeed in business and give her kids a better life than she had growing up.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Victoria is applying for this loan so she can purchase marketing material that is going to highlight her product specials and exhibit any goods she might be featuring.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa owns a small restaurant where she sells typical Ecuadorian foods. The restaurant is located at the front of her home and is open from lunch time until about 7pm. She has been in the restaurant business for her whole life because her mother also ran a similar operation when she was young. Narcisa started this business shortly after she married when she realized that the income her husband was brining in would not be enough for her and their two children.

She needs this loan in order to make structural improvements to the restaurant and to also buy tables and chairs. Her goal is to grow her operation and add new items to the menu in order to attract new clients.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the appearance of her restaurant and buy more tables and chairs

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel runs a small shop out of the home of her sister. Twelve years ago she started working in her fathers store who ran a very similar operation. Once she saved up enough money she opened her own shop near her father’s but had to close it down because he did not appreciate the competition. She now works with her sister who has always helped her business aspirations. She sells all types of items ranging from diapers to popular snacks.

She needs the loan in order to invest in a greater amount of products. She is planning to move the location to her mother’s home where she believes she can generate more business. Her parents are separated and Raquel is not married.

.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her store, and potentially relocate it to her mothers house.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma has a small store where she sells snacks and soft drinks. She owned a store similar to this one for about 8 years with her husband but she had to close it down when they got a divorce. The store she runs now is only 8 months old but is doing well. She has a steady flow of clients and she is looking to invest in candies, cookies and chocolates. She has already spent all of her savings to start up the store and therefore requires a loan in order to make further investments.

Norma has five children who are all grown up and have microenterprises of their own. She is a divorcee who is hoping to get reestablished and be a successful business woman on her own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products for her small market

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Madam Adjoa A. is a baker of 40 year old. She is living alone with her two (02) children and four (04) other children whom she cares for. Abandoned by her husband who has been living clandestinely in Europe for more than 5 years, Madam Adjoa BLEVI courageously manages to support all her family expenditures. Having dropped out of primary school very early, she started bread selling along roads and streets. Very ingenious, she has early understood that to better succeed in life, she must be her own mistress. That is why she underwent the training in bread making. Also enterprising and very courageous, she didn’t hesitate, from her first credit to build a hard packed oven for bread making and selling. Thanks to the quality of her breads, she is more and more solicited but she is very limited by her means and cannot satisfy her clients who are getting more and more numerous. Madam Adjoa A. really induces trust through the quality of her products and especially the good management of her two credits of $ 450 and $ 650 respectively. She promptly paid reimbursed. The new credit of $ 850 in request will serve to buy the wheat flour and sugar in order to assure availability in stock as in the period of Christmas and New Year those stuffs become scarce and expensive. Surely, this credit will have a positive impact on Madam Adjoa A., because it will help her to increase her production and income to improve her socio-economic living conditions.

Madame A. Adjoa est boulangère âgée de 40 ans. Elle vit seule avec ses deux de ses propres enfants et quatre (04) personnes à sa charge. Abandonnée par son mari qui vit en clandestinité en Europe depuis plus de 05 ans, Madame A. Adjoa prend son courage à deux mains et se débrouille pas mal pour supporter toutes ces charges familiales. N’ayant pas eu la chance de terminer au moins le cours primaire, elle s’était lancé dans la vente de pain au bord des rues. Très ingénieuse, elle a compris très tôt que pour mieux réussir sa vie, il faut être maîtresse de soi-même. C’est ainsi qu’elle s’est lancée dans l’apprentissage de la fabrication du pain à l’échelle manuel. Aussi entreprenante et très courageuse qu’elle soit, elle n’a pas tardé, par son premier crédit à construire un four en terre battue pour la fabrication et la vente du pain. Aujourd’hui, de par la qualité de ses pains, elle est de plus en plus sollicitée mais ses moyens se trouvent très limités pour satisfaire sa clientèle qui, sans cesse, ne fait qu’augmenter. Madame A. Adjoa nourrit réellement confiance à travers la qualité de ses produits et surtout la bonne gestion faite de ses deux premiers respectifs de $450 et $650 obtenus et promptement remboursés. Le nouveau crédit de $850 sollicités servirons à acheter de farine de blé et du sucre afin d’assurer le stock de sécurité car en période des fêtes de noël, ces denrées deviennent très rares et très coûteux. Ce crédit aura a coup sûr un impact positif sur Madame A. Adjoa, car il lui permettra d’augmenter sa production et de facto ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie socio-économiques.

loans.use: to buy the wheat flour and sugar in order to assure availability in stock

loans.name: Aralama

texts.en:
Aged 49, and living with six (06) dependants, Madam Aralama T. almost exclusively deals in haberdashery products. Her husband is a retired security officer overwhelmed with family problems and stepped aside from his responsibilities of household provider and every thing is left to Madam Aralama alone who is in charge of all expenses including accommodation for he can no longer continue to pay the rent. The haberdashery activity generally demands much resource due to the diversity of the products and regular change of models, but Madam Aralama T. has not the adequate financial resources. She has been managing this activity for three (03) years and has always showed good morality and capacity of efficient management of her activity and of the credits granted. Madam Aralama T. lives on the income from this trade and she needs a credit of $ 650 which will help buy the different haberdashery items in order to increase the growth and a yield more substantial profits thereby providing financial security to her and her family.

Agée de 49 ans avec 6 enfants à sa charge, Madame T. Aralama fait presque exclusivement le commerce des produits de la mercerie. Agent de sécurité admis à la retraite, son mari, accablé par les soucis familiaux, a presque démissionné de ses responsabilités de père de famille et tout se repose sur Aralama seule qui le loge car ne pouvant plus payer le loyer. Or cette activité de mercerie demande généralement beaucoup de moyens à cause de la diversité de ces produits et du changement très fréquent des modèles, lesquels moyens ne disposent pas Madame T. Aralama. Elle gère cette activité depuis plus de trois (03) ans et a toujours fait preuve d’une bonne moralité et d’une capacité de gestion efficiente de son activité démontrés lors de ses crédits antérieurs obtenus. Madame T. Aralama vit de ce commerce et il faut un crédit de $ 650 qui serviront les divers articles de mercerie afin de renforcer la croissance et une meilleure rentabilité de son activité et d’assurer son mieux-être et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy the haberdashery items

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Madam Essi A., about 42 years old, is a mother of three (03) children. Her husband, bricklayer by trade and with stable job, is virtually absent and all the charges of the family are let on her. Her main activity is the grilled fish trading which provide for her a substantial income. In view of her very limited means, she was buying only a small carton of fish of $ 25. Her activities have started to increase from her first credit of $ 49. Her third credit of $ 145. Though she is illiterate, she has the sense of a good manager and know very well how to make the accounts. She respects well the sections of the repayments and has showed the proof of her honesty and good faith. What constitutes a positive sign of her credibility in her environment. Today, she needs $ 550 in view to increase the number of carton according to the need on the market and especially add to big fish (Akpala) small fish obtaining from Ghana more adapted to the majority of the locality produces exchanges and well appreciated by the local population.

Madame A. Essi, âgée de 42 ans environ, est mère de trois (03) enfants. Son mari, maçon de formation et sans emploi fixe, est virtuellement absent et toutes les charges du foyer reposent sur la femme. Son activité principale est le commerce de poisson grillé qui lui procure un revenu substantiel. Eu égard à ses moyens très limités, elle se contentait d’un petit carton de poisson de $25. Ses activités ont commencé par prendre un d’ampleur à partir de son premier crédit de $ 49. Son troisième crédit de $ 145. Bien qu\'elle soit analphabète, elle a le sens d’une bonne gestionnaire et sait très bien faire les calculs.
