Elle respecte bien les échéances des remboursements et fait preuve de son honnêteté et sa bonne foi. Ce qui constitue un signe positif de sa crédibilité dans son entourage. Elle a besoin aujourd’hui de $550 en vue d’augmenter le nombre de carton selon les besoins sur le marché et surtout ajouter aux gros poissons (Akpala), de petits poissons provenant du Ghana plus adaptés à la plupart des bourses de la localité et très appréciés par la population locale

loans.use: to buy small fish obtaining from Ghana

loans.name: Jérôme Kossi

texts.en:
Mr Jérôme Kossi A., is a young welder aged 26. He is married and father of one (01) child and is in charge of his. Very dynamic, modest and very motivated, he has created his own workshop for just one year now, but he has at his disposal ten (10) active apprentices. His serious, good work and timeliness make his reputation and he is more and more solicited. This considerably increased the number of his clients. But he is confronted with the insufficiency of equipment and supply to better respond to needs of clients. His small school training allows him to hold accountancy for the good management of his workshop. He was able to reimburse without incident, his first credit of $ 300. Mr Jérôme Kossi A. can well manage the credit of $ 550 which he is requesting to finance the sheets for the production of the wheelbarrows, moulds, doors, metal gates, etc.

Monsieur A. Kossi Jérôme, est un jeune soudeur âgé de 26 ans. Il est marié père d’un (01) enfant et à sa mère en charge. Très dynamique, modeste et très motivé, il a crée son propre atelier il y a juste un an, mais il a déjà à son actif dix (10) appentis. Son sérieux et son travail bien fait et livré à temps fait sa réputation et est de plus en plus sollicité. Ce qui augmente considérablement sa clientèle et au même moment, fait face à l’insuffisance de moyens matériels pour mieux répondre aux besoins des demandes qui lui sont soumises. Sa petite formation scolaire lui permet de tenir une petite comptabilité pour la bonne gestion de son atelier. Ce qui a été constaté dans le remboursement sans incident de son premier crédit de $ 300 obtenus Monsieur A. Kossi Jérôme peut bien gérer le crédit de $550 qu’il sollicite pour acheter des tôles servant à la fabrication des brouettes, des moules, des portes, des grilles de protection, etc.

loans.use: to finance the sheets for the production of the wheelbarrows, moulds, doors, metal gates,

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.en:
Miss Afiwa S. was born on 8th December 1967 at Kovié in the district of Zio. She is single with two (02) children. As a qualified hairdresser, Miss S. is know as a hard worker, she is sincere, kind and has a good sense of management. Mistress of a hairdressing shop in Lomé, she does a very good job, and gets more and more customers. On request from her customers, Miss S. began the sale of cosmetic and beauty products in her shop, which provides her additional income. She perfectly masters her job and correctly used the credit of $ 300 she obtained. She realized that to meet the demand that comes her way, she must imperatively have a more efficacious equipment and an important stock of cosmetic products. And this new project requires a large amount of money she does not have. Therefore, she requested a credit of $ 800 to buy modern driers and have funds to buy and sell cosmetic products.

Mlle S. Afiwa est née le 08 décembre 1967 à Kovié dans la préfecture du Zio. A ce jour, elle est célibataire avec deux enfants. Coiffeuse de formation, Mlle S. est connue pour son efficacité au travail, sa sincérité, sa générosité et son sens aigu de gestion. Maîtresse d’un salon de coiffure à Lomé, elle fait un travail très apprécié, ce qui lui attire une clientèle de plus en plus importante et exigeante. Ainsi, à la demande de sa clientèle, Mlle S. a commencé la vente des produits cosmétiques et de beauté dans son salon de coiffure ; ce qui lui procure des revenus complémentaires. Elle a une parfaite maîtrise de sa profession et a bien géré le crédit de $300 obtenu. Aujourd’hui, elle s’est rendue compte que pour être à la hauteur de l’importante demande qui s’offre à elle et répondre aux exigences qu’impose la profession actuellement, elle doit impérativement avoir un matériel plus performant et avoir un stock important de produits cosmétiques. Et ce nouveau projet fait appel à un coût aussi important qu’elle ne dispose pas. C’est à cet effet qu’elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $800 pour acquérir deux séchoirs modernes et disposer d’un fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la vente des produits cosmétiques

loans.use: to buy modern driers andcosmetic products

loans.name: Bether

texts.en:
Madam Bether A. is a dynamic and imposing young woman. She was born in Tsévié (district of Zio) in 1966. She is married does not have any child yet, because of reproductive health problems. But she raises her elder sister’s two (02) children. Coming from a very poor family, she had many problems because of the lack of support from her parents. But with eagerness to get out of her miserable situation, she never stopped struggling. In spite of her illiteracy, she is amazingly skillful, and owing to her many efforts, she succeeded in earning a little amount of money and begun a little clothing and other products business (toilet roll, can, generic products, etc.). After a hard beginning, she invested all of her energy and expertise in her activity. That is why she has a little place at the market of Nukafu where she sells to make some money for her survival. Her burning desire is to increase her sale and her source of income so that she can come out of her poverty. The credit of $ 850 she requested will help her buy cloths and essential products (soap, can, milk, etc.) which products are easily marketed in this festive end of year period.

Madame A. Bether est une jeune femme dynamique et imposante née à Tsévié (Préfecture de Zio) en 1966. Elle est mariée mais n’a pas encore d’enfant pour problème de conception. Elle a par contre à sa charge deux (02) enfants de sa grande sœur. Issue d’une famille très pauvre, elle a connu beaucoup de difficultés à cause du manque de soutien de la part de ses parents. Mais voulant à tout prix sortir de sa situation misérable, elle n’a jamais cessé de se battre. Malgré son analphabétisme, elle dispose d’une habileté étonnante, et grâce à ses multiples efforts, elle réussit à gagner un peu d’argent et commença avec $ 55 un petit commerce de pagne et de produits divers (papier hygiénique, boîte de conserve, produits générique etc.). Après un début pénible, elle met toute son énergie et tout son savoir-faire au service de son activité, ce qui lui permet de disposer aujourd’hui d’un petit emplacement au marché de N’kafu où elle exerce son petit commerce pour sa survie. Son désir le plus ardent à ce jour est de pouvoir élargir son commerce et augmenter sa source de revenu afin de sortir de son état de pauvreté. Le crédit de $850 qu’elle sollicite va servir à acheter des pagnes et des produits de première nécessité (savon, boîte de conserve, lait, etc.) lesquels produits s’écoulent facilement en cette période des fêtes de fin d’année.

loans.use: To buy cloths and essential products (soap, can, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Mr Felix A. was born in 1981 at Dagbati in the district of Vo. He failed to go to school because of his family’s extreme poverty. He learnt to take charge of himself very early, but in pitiful conditions. As an illiterate, he took a wife very early and now, he is father of five (05) children, which made his situation and that of his family difficult and increased the poverty. Clairvoyant and full of initiative, he is involved in the sale of cheap medicines from Nigeria (a West African country). They are obviously not the best kind of medicines available, but very appreciated by the majority of the population, because they are cheap as compared to pharmaceutical products of good quality but expensive for poor people. Advised and directed to cheap generic products, Mr Felix A. did his test with his first credit of $ 200 that was well paid back. Health being life, Mr Felix A. understood the need of a more adequate storage location for medical security. That is why he would like to have this credit of $850 which will help him rent a little store and improve the quality of his stock by the supply of generic products conform with international standards and help save human lives.

Monsieur A. Félix est né en 1981 à Dagbati dans la préfecture de Vo. Il n’a pas pu aller à l’école à cause de l’état avancé de la pauvreté de sa famille. Il apprit à se prendre en charge très tôt mais dans des conditions pitoyables. Analphabète, il se marie très précocement et est aujourd’hui père de cinq (05) enfants. Ce qui a rendu très lourdes les charges du ménage et accentué la pauvreté. Clairvoyant et plein d’initiative, il entreprend la vente des médicaments à moindre coût venant du Nigéria (un pays de la sous région ouest africaine). Ce sont des médicaments frelatés et d’origine douteuse mais très appréciés par la majorité de la population car étant moins chers par rapport aux produits des pharmacies d’Etat et Privées de meilleure qualité mais difficile d’accès pour les populations pauvres. Conseillé et orienté vers les produits génériques à bas prix, Monsieur A. Félix a fait son expérience avec son premier crédit de $200 bien remboursés. La santé étant la vie, Monsieur A. a compris aujourd’hui qu’il faut une structure mieux adaptée à la sécurité sanitaire d’où la demande de ce crédit d’un montant de $850 lui permettant de louer un petit magasin et d’améliorer la qualité de son stock par l’approvisionnement en produits génériques fabriqués sur la base des normes internationales en vue de contribuer ainsi à la sauvegarde des vies humaines.

loans.use: To rent a little store and buy the generic products

loans.name: Amonigan François

texts.en:
Mr Amonigan François A. is a young contractor aged 27. Coming from a large family, he got his High School Certificate (business option). He didn’t continue his studies because of the lack of financial means. He chose to create his own activities by opening a little restaurant in his area. The activity which became profitable brings him regular income. He got married and has two (02) children now. He manages his activity very well, and it brings him a substantial income which helps him take care of his family. He is often helped by his wife in his activities, mainly during crowded periods. He lacks means to meet the need of his customers who are getting more and more numerous, and his cooker is no more useful, because it is decayed and is regularly breaks down. For this reason, Mr A. would like to have a credit of $ 850 to buy a new cooker and have a permanent stock of food products. The present project will increase his income thereby contributing to the improvement of A.’s family life.

Monsieur A. Amonigan François est un jeune entrepreneur âgé de 27 ans. Issu d’une famille nombreuse, il a réussi à avoir son baccalauréat G3 (série commerciale). Faute de soutien, il n’a pas pu continuer ses études supérieures. Face à son destin, il a opté pour la création de ses propres activités par d’ouvrir un petit restaurant dans sa localité. Cette activité qui devient très vite rentable lui permet de disposer d’un revenu régulier. Il se marie alors et est à ce jour père de deux (02) enfants. Il gère très bien son activité qui lui procure un revenu substantiel pour faire face aux besoins élémentaires de sa famille. Il est souvent aidé par sa femme dans ses activités surtout pendant les périodes de grande affluence. A ce jour, il manque de moyens pour satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle qui augmente de jour en jour. Or, la cuisinière qu’il utilise ne répond plus car elle est vétuste et tombe régulièrement en panne. Pour ce faire, Monsieur A. sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $850 pour acquérir une nouvelle cuisinière et faire un stock permanent de denrées alimentaires. Le présent projet, s’il a pu être financé, augmentera davantage ses revenus pour contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille A.

loans.use: to buy a new cooker and have a permanent stock of food products

loans.name: Maxime Olassimbo

texts.en:
Mr Maxime Olassimbo K. was born on 30th April 1972 at Sakété in Benin. After his primary studies in his native village, he left his parents and came to Togo in 1986 to live with an uncle who is a vulcanizing professional in the quarter of Hanoukopé. After his training as vulcanizing professional, he decided to live in his own and open a workshop. But he lacked financial means, mainly materials to begin his activities. He had his first credit of $150 which he paid back. His second credit of $ 350 allowed him to rent a larger shop, proof of considerable growth of his activities. Now, he wants to extend his activities to the sale of used tyres and inner tubes, for these items are in strong demand. This needs more financial means that Mr K. does not have; he is married and father of three (03) children. The credit of $750 he applied for will be spent on buying a compressor pump, tyres and inner tubes in extension of Mr K. activities in order to have materials at the same place to satisfy his customers who are more and more demanding. This will help him increase market share and his income in order to take a good care of his family.

Monsieur K. Olassimbo Maxime est né le 30 avril 1972 à Sakété au Bénin. Après ses études primaires dans son village natal, il a du quitté ses parents pour venir au Togo en 1986 pour habiter chez un oncle, vulgarisateur dans le quartier Hanoukopé. Après sa formation de vulgarisateur, il décida de s’installer en son propre compte mais il manquait des moyens surtout matériels pour démarrer ses activités. Il reçut alors son premier crédit de $150 qu’il avait bien remboursé. Son second crédit de $350 lui a permis de louer un emplacement plus grand, preuve de la croissance considérable de ses activités. Il veut aujourd’hui étendre ses activités à la vente des pneus d’occasion et des chambres à air, une des fortes demandes de sa clientèle. Ce qui nécessite des moyens financiers plus consistants qu’il ne dispose pas. Monsieur KOSSOBO Maxime est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Le crédit de $750 actuellement sollicité servira à acheter une pompe à compresseur, des pneus et des chambres à air en extension des activités de KOSSOBO en vue de disposer les matériels sur place pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeante. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter sa part de marché et ses revenus pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: buying a compressor pump, tyres and inner tubes

loans.name: Zinsou

texts.en:
Mr Zinsou M. is a young tailor born in 1961. His very poor parents can’t take care of a large family. He was obliged to stop his studies early at primary school level. Thanks to an uncle who took him as an apprentice tailor, he became a skilful worker and quickly gained experience, and obtained his diploma of tailor embroiderer after four (04) years of apprenticeship. His socio-economical situation did not allow him to quickly be on his own. It took him a long time to get married; today he has three (03) children and has five (05) apprentices in his charge. His life is getting better since he received his first credit of $ 300 which he smoothly paid back. His second credit of $ 550 brought him success and his workshop receives prospects everyday. With his dynamism, perseverance, rigor in the management of his workshop and his well done work, Mr M. is more and more needed, but he doesn’t succeed in satisfying his customers in due time because of the lack of sewing machines. These festive period in which there are increasing demands, constitute a nightmare for him. This credit of $ 850 will help him buy a more performing embroidery machine so that he can be quicker in his activities and mainly improve the quality of his services. The realization of this project will considerably improve his income and his economical and financial potential which will make a change in his social and family environment.

Monsieur M. Zinsou est un jeune couturier né en 1961. Ses parents très pauvres n’arrivant plus à subvenir aux besoins d’une famille pléthoriques, il a dû abandonner tôt ses études déjà aux cours primaires. Il doit son salut à un oncle qui le recueille comme apprenti tailleur. Très assidu dans ce métier, il gagna rapidement en expérience et obtint son diplôme de tailleur brodeur après quatre (04) ans d’apprentissage. Sa situation socio économique ne lui permettant pas de se prendre rapidement en charge, il mis du temps pour se marier et a aujourd’hui trois (03 enfants et a à sa charge cinq (05) apprentis. Sa situation tend à s’améliorer depuis que Monsieur M. a reçu son premier crédit de $300 qu’il avait d’ailleurs bien remboursé. Son second crédit de $550 l’a totalement relancé et son atelier très fréquenté. Avec son dynamisme, sa persévérance, sa rigueur dans la gestion de son atelier et son travail bien fait, Monsieur M. est de plus en plus sollicité, mais il n’arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle à temps à cause de l’insuffisance des machines. L’approche des fêtes de fin d’année ci où les demandes sont sans cesse croissantes, constitue un cauchemar pour lui. Ce crédit de $850 sollicité lui permettra d’acheter une machine de broderie plus performante qui lui manque pour rapidité de ses activités et surtout pour améliorer la qualité de ses services. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera sensiblement son rendement et par conséquent son potentiel économique et financier qui rejaillerons sur son environnement familial et social.

loans.use: To buy a more performing embroidery machine

loans.name: Lolonyo

texts.en:
Mr. A. K. Lolonyo was born in July 1963; he is the eldest son of a family of twelve (12) children. As his parents died, he had to drop out of school in order to work and feed his brothers and sisters. Despite his courage and boldness, he early got worn out by still rudimentary agriculture. Later he got a job as a salesman in a Lomé shop. Thanks to his little savings and chiefly to the support of his wife, he opened a little cement and hardware shop. But as he does not have enough of financial resources, he is obliged to get supplied at retailers’, which does not allow him to make profits large enough to take care of his wife and five (05) children and some of his brothers and sisters who still depend on him. As he has no adequate capital, he often finds himself in shortage and temporarily closes the shop while demand remains permanent. To stabilize his business and meet market needs, Mr. A. needs a credit of $850 to directly order his goods from the production plant and constantly have a sufficient amount of goods..

Né en Juillet 1963, Monsieur A. K. Lolonyo est le fils aîné d’une famille de douze (12) enfants. A la mort de ses parents, il a dû abandonner les études pour travailler et nourrir ses frères et sœurs. Malgré son courage et sa bravoure, il est très vite épuisé par une agriculture encore rudimentaire. Il s’est fait engager dans une boutique à Lomé et plus tard, grâce à sa petite économie et surtout avec le soutien de sa femme, il ouvre lui-même une boutique de vente de ciment et des produits de quincaillerie. Mais ne disposant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers, il est obligé à chaque fois de s’approvisionner chez les détaillants. Ce qui ne lui laisse pas une marge bénéficiaire suffisante lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de ses cinq (05) enfants en plus de certains de ses frères et sœurs qui dépendent toujours de lui. Faute de fonds de commerce adéquat, il est régulièrement en rupture de stock et obligé de fermer momentanément la boutique pendant que la demande reste permanente. Pour stabiliser son commerce et répondre au besoin de son marché, Monsieur A. a besoin d’un crédit de $850 pour passer directement ses commandes à l’usine de fabrication du ciment et de disposer constamment et suffisamment de stock sécurité.

loans.use: To buy cement directly from the production plant

loans.name: Essiadolé

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Adolé is 45 years old and is the second wife of her polygamous husband. She had seven (07) children with her spouse before he got seriously sick and remained in bed. As she is well aware of the serious nature of the situation of the family, courageous and enterprising Mrs. A. Adolé started a food item shop. As she has no adequate capital, she often turns to usurers for loans at huge interest rates (over 200%), which ruins her further. Despite her determination to shelter her children from misery, she failed: her first two daughters dropped out of school to help her in her activities. She received a credit of $300, which she correctly paid back. Her third credit of $550 boosted her and with the help of her two children who dropped out of school she managed to meet the basic needs of her family. As the end of year festive period of intense business activities is getting closer and closer Madam A. Adolé requested a credit of $850 to buy, stock and market foodstuff (rice, oil, sugar, milk, tomato, etc.) This will allow her to increase activities and boost revenues to meet family needs.

Madame A. Adolé est âgée de 45 ans et est la seconde femme d’un mari polygame. Elle eu sept (07) enfants avec son époux avant que ce dernier ne tombe gravement malade et complètement alité. Consciente de la gravité des charges familiales qui lui incombent, Madame A. Adolé, très courageuse et entreprenante, a commencé par développer son commerce d’alimentation générale. Ne disposant pas d’un capital adéquat, elle a souvent recours aux usuriers pour contracter des emprunts à des taux exorbitants (plus de 200%), ce qui la ruine davantage. Malgré sa bonne volonté de mettre à tout prix ses enfants à l’abri de la misère, elle n’a pas pu atteindre ses objectifs et ses 2 premières filles ont dû abandonner l’école pour l’aider dans ses activités. Elle bénéficia alors d’un crédit de $300 qu’elle avait bien remboursé. Son troisième crédit de $550 l’a relancé et avec l’aide de ses deux enfants déscolarisés, elle est arrivée tant que mal à subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de sa famille. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, période d’intenses activités commerciales, Madame A. Adolé sollicite un crédit de $850 pour faire l’achat, le stockage et la revente des produits d’alimentation générale (riz, huile, sucre, lait, tomate, etc.). Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses activités et d’accroître ses revenus pour les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy, stock and market foodstuff (rice, oil, sugar, milk, tomato, etc.)

loans.name: Klouyibo Ayawavi

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Klouyibo Ayawavi was born on 28th December 1972 in Sotouboua. She is married and has three children (03); she is in charge of three other children belonging to relatives. She is illiterate but very intelligent and started the trade of loincloth and plates very early. With the revenue from her small business she significantly contributes to meeting the needs of her home for the income of her husband is insufficient and too irregular to meet the needs of the family. As a skilful salesperson, she often calls on prospects to present new cloth ranges. The strategy works very well as evidenced by the growth of the activity over the past two years; however she lacks financial resources to meet the demand from her customers. As at now, the demand remains high thanks to the approaching end of year festive period. She therefore requested a new credit to meet the needs of her clients. The amount requested is $850. It will allow her to build up a sufficient stock of loincloth for the end of year festive period. Mrs. A. Klouyibo Ayawavi has enough experience and talent to successfully run this activity.

Madame A. Klouyibo Ayawavi est née le 28 Décembre 1972 à Sotouboua. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle prend en charge 3 autres enfants de proches parents. Analphabète mais très ingénieuse, elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce de pagne et d’assiette. Avec les revenus de son petit commerce de pagne, elle contribue énormément au besoin du ménage car le revenu est non seulement très insuffisant mais irrégulier pour couvrir les charges du foyer. Très commerciale, elle va souvent vers sa clientèle pour lui proposer les nouvelles gammes de pagnes. Cette dernière stratégie fonctionne bien car l’activité a pris de l’ampleur ces 2 dernières années, mais les moyens financiers lui font défaut pour répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle. Actuellement, la demande est encore très forte car les fêtes de fin d’année s’approchent. Ce qui l’amène à solliciter un nouveau crédit pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Le montant de $850 sollicité servira à constituer un stock suffisant de pagnes pour les fêtes de fin d’année. Madame A. Klouyibo Ayawavi dispose de beaucoup d’expérience et de talent pour mener à bien cette activité.

loans.use: To buy loincloth

loans.name: Afi Lawoè

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Afi Lawoè who was born in 1965 in Tabligbo is married and mother of six (06) children. Her husband lost his job early and up to now the burden of taking care of the family has been on her shoulder. She became head of the family owing to the turn of events she started the trade of generic products from Nigeria in order to make ends meet. As she was advised on the dangerous nature of those products, she decided to undergo a training in Chinese pharmacy in 1999. She is a courageous and hardworking woman; she manages her business very well and meets the basic needs of her family despite the difficulties. She has a significant experience in the management of credits as she received three credits of $100, $250 and $550 respectively. She reimbursed promptly with no incident. Mrs. A. Afi Lawoè requested a new credit of $850 to start a rural drug store where she will sell generic product and Chinese drugs. This will allow her to increase revenue and improve the living conditions of her entire family. The demand for such products does exist on the market.

Née en 1965 à Tabligbo, Madame A. Afi Lawoè est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Très tôt, son mari perd jusqu’à ce jour son travail et toutes les charges du foyer reposaient sur elle. Devenue chef de famille par la force des choses, elle se lança dans le commerce des produits génériques provenant du Nigeria afin de joindre les deux bouts. Conseillée des méfaits nuisibles de ces produits sur la santé humaine, elle décida alors de se faire formée en pharmacologie chinoise en 1999. Femme très courageuse et travaillant avec endurance et abnégation, elle a su bien maîtriser et gérer son commerce par lequel, elle arrive tant bien que mal à subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de sa famille. Madame A. Afi Lawoè a une large expérience dans la gestion des crédits après ses trois crédits respectifs de $100, $250 et $550 obtenus et remboursés promptement sans incident. Madame A. Afi Lawoè sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $850 pour ouvrir une pharmacie villageoise pour vendre les produits génériques et les produits chinois. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille. La demande existe pour ce marché.

loans.use: to start a rural drug store

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Elisabeth was born in 1972 in Assoukondji. She is a dynamic, sincere and rigorous woman when it comes to work. She is married and mother of four (04). She is a seamstress by profession. She managed with a lot of difficulties to open her workshop. But the revenue she derives from this job is not enough to meet the needs of her family for her husband has no good job. As a result, poverty constantly dwells in her household. Having observed life in her area, she noticed that the inhabitants do not accede to basic foodstuff in the quarter. She thus decided to start a small foodstuff business with an amount of $ 65 saved up. This provides her, additional revenues apart from her seamstress job. Having realized that the little trade is profitable, she decided to expand it. To meet the target, she requested and obtained a credit of $350 which she easily managed and paid back. As the end of year festive period is approaching, Mrs. A. Elisabeth requested a new credit of $850 to purchase and sell essential foodstuff (rice, soap, sugar, milk, tomato, sardine, etc.). Supporting her financially is contributing to improving her living conditions and those of her family.

Née en 1972 à Assoukondji dans la préfecture de Yoto, Madame A. Elisabeth est une femme dynamique, sincère et rigoureuse au travail. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle est couturière de formation. Elle est parvenue difficilement à ouvrir un atelier de couture. Mais le revenu qu’elle tire de ce métier n’est guère suffisant pour la famille car son mari n’a pas aussi un travail consistant. Ce qui a pour conséquence la persistance de la pauvreté dans le ménage. A la suite d’une observation dans son quartier, elle a constaté que les habitants ne trouvent pas sur place des produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Elle décida alors d’initier un petit commerce de vente des denrées alimentaires avec $65 d’économie réalisée. Ce qui lui procure un revenu complémentaire en dehors de sa couture. Elle se rend compte que ce petit commerce est rentable et veut l’élargir. Pour cela, elle a sollicité et obtenu un crédit d’un montant de $350 qu’elle a bien géré et remboursé sans difficulté. A l’approche de ces fêtes de fin d’année, Madame A. Elisabeth sollicite un nouveau crédit de $ 850 pour servir à l’achat et à la revente des produits alimentaires de première nécessité (riz, savon, sucre, lait, tomate, sardine, etc.). Lui accorder des concours financiers, c’est contribuer à améliorer les conditions de vie de Madame A. Elisabeth et sa famille.

loans.use: to purchase and sell essential foodstuff (rice, soap, sugar, milk, tomato, sardine, etc.)

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Pauline was born in 1957 in Vogan ville (district of Vo). She is married and mother of (05) five with five (05) other children depending on her. She also takes care of her husband. She is clear in complexion, medium-sized, very discrete but hardworking. She was enjoying a peaceful life with her husband till a bush fire devastated the palm oil farm of Mr. A. (the husband), who lost all hope and turned to alcohol thereby becoming a drunkard. That is how misery struck the household. But Mrs. A. Pauline being a very courageous, dynamic and respectful woman, she was able to get a credit of $20 dollars to start the door-to-door trade of products like traditional soap, palm nut oil, mangoes, guava, vegetables. With her sense of good management, she was able to pay back in due time and obtain a second credit of $200 dollars which allowed her to expand her activity. Looking at the span and the way she mastered the business, she wants to make it a professional activity in order to have a more reasonable source of revenue. Therefore she requested a credit of $ 850 which will help purchase and sell essential products.

Madame A. Pauline est née en 1957 à Vogan ville (P/Vo). Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants avec cinq (05) autres personnes à charge dont le mari. De teint clair, taille moyenne, très discrète et réservée mais travailleuse, elle vivait très bien avec son mari jusqu’au jour où un feu de brousse avait complètement dévasté le champ de palmier à huile et d’ignames de Monsieur A. (le mari), qui a perdu tout espoir à la vie et s’est confié à l’alcool, le mauvais maître. C’est alors que commença la misère du foyer. Mais Madame A. Pauline étant une femme très courageuse, dynamique et respectueuse a pu bénéficier d’un crédit de $ 20 pour démarrer la vente, porte à porte, des produits comme le savon traditionnel, d’huile rouge, des mangues, des goyaves, des légumes. Avec son sens de bonne gestionnaire, elle a su rembourser à temps et bénéficier à nouveau, d’un second crédit de $ 200 qui lui a permis d’élargir son activité. Compte tenu de l’ampleur et de la maîtrise de ce commerce, elle veut en faire une activité professionnelle en vue d’avoir une source de revenu plus raisonnable. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $ 850 qui va servir à l’achat et à la revente des produits de première nécessité.

loans.use: To purchase and sell essential products (.traditional soap, palm nut oil, mangoes, guava, vegetables)

loans.name: Kloussè

texts.en:
Mr. H. Kloussè was born in Togoville on 4th April 1966. Owing to the acute poverty of his parents, he early dropped out of school and went in for technical training. But during his woodwork training, his parents supported him only for (06) months. Courageous and enterprising, he took care of himself thanks to household tasks he performed at various homes after training sessions. He successfully finished his training but it took him a long time to open his own workshop because he did not have the required resources. The modest workshop he is currently running thanks to a first credit of $350 is not well equipped and this leads to frequent delays in delivering of ordered products. His clients however did not quit because of the quality of his furniture. Mr. H. is married with a seamstress and they have no children yet. His wife is also facing financial hardship and cannot open a workshop. Mr. H. however tries not to let his poverty show; he manages his workshop and his household very well. The credit of $850 he requested will allow him to acquire a little machine for his woodwork and build up a wood stock for sale for there is shortage in the area. The project will allow him to increase revenues and take a better care of his wife and two nieces he is in charge of.

Monsieur H. Kloussè est né à Togoville (Préfecture de Vo) le 04 avril 1966. Du fait de l’état de pauvreté avancé de ses parents, il a été très vite éjecté du système scolaire et mis en apprentissage. Le soutien de ses parents au cours de sa formation de menuiserie ne dura que six (06) mois. Courageux et entreprenant, il s’est pris en charge lui-même grâce aux travaux domestiques qu’il exerçait en dehors des heures de formation. Il termina avec succès son apprentissage mais mit assez de temps pour ouvrir un atelier, faute de moyens. Le modeste atelier qu’il tient aujourd’hui grâce à un premier crédit de $350 n’est pas bien équipé, ce qui explique les nombreux retards dans les livraisons à ses clients qui ont du mal à le quitter à cause de la qualité de ses meubles. Marié sans enfant avec une couturière qui, elle aussi, éprouve d’énormes difficultés financières pour s’installer, Monsieur H. Kloussè essaie de tout faire pour ne pas exposer sa pauvreté. Il sait bien gérer son atelier et son foyer Le crédit de $850 que sollicite Kloussè va servir à acquérir une petite machine pour sa menuiserie et à faire un stock de bois pour sa revente car il en manque sérieusement dans le quartier. Ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour mieux s’occuper de sa femme et ses deux nièces à leur charge.

loans.use: to acquire a little machine and build up a wood stock for sale

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Madam Yawa T. was born in 1963 at Dadoavé in the prefecture of Zio. She is married and mother of five (05) children. After primary studies in her village, she went to Lomé where she put up with her aunt, a great storekeeper at “Grand Marché” of Lomé. Her aunt trained her very well in trade activities, and she started to show her interest in such activities and in setting up her own business. She thus opened a small restaurant bar which she started with $95. Through that activity, she provides at least at 80 % of her family needs, as her husband continually unemployed for 10 years, does not fulfil his family responsibilities. All the children are cared for by the Madam Yawa T. who is constantly fighting for their education and success in life. With rigor and good management skills, she succeeded in managing the two first credits of $200 and $400 respectively before the end of the loan term. Which increased credibility and trustworthiness for any other application. The credit request of $ 850 will serve to buy one freezer and a stock of supplies with views to strengthening her restaurant bar. The expansion of her activities through the marketing of fruit juice and ice block will allow her to increase her income and consequently to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Madame T. Yawa est née en 1963 à Dalavé dans la préfecture du Zio. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Après ses études primaires au village, elle est arrivée à Lomé chez sa tante, une commerçante au grand marché de Lomé. Sa tante l’a entraînée dans les activités commerciales et de là, elle en a pris goût et a décidé de s’installer en son propre compte par l’ouverture d’un petit bar restaurant qu’elle avait commencé avec $95. A travers cette activité, elle subvient à au moins 80% des besoins de son foyer car, le mari, en chômage continu depuis plus de 10 ans, n’arrive pas à remplir ses responsabilités familiales. Tous les enfants sont presque à la charge de Madame T. Yawa qui se bat comme un diable pour leur éducation et devenir. Très rigoureuse et ayant la qualité d’une bonne gestionnaire, elle avait su, non seulement gérer les deux premiers crédits obtenus respectivement de $200 et $400, mais et surtout à temps. Ce qui augmente sa crédibilité et donne confiance pour tout concours financier à lui accorder. Le crédit de $850 sollicités va lui permettre d’acheter un congélateur et de faire un stock de vivres en vue de renforcer son bar restaurant. Cette extension de ses activités par la vente de jus de fruits et de la glace lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et par ricochet, améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy one freezer and a stock of supplies

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Mr Charles N. was born in February 14, 1966 at N’GUGO IKEDURU in the Republic of Nigeria. He is married and father of one (01) child. He lives at Hédzranawoé Lomé. He is very sympathetic and highly appreciated by his neighbours. Mr. Charles N. has been a good second-hand shoes trader for fifteen (15) years. Very clever and ingenious, he undertook to buy the shoes of low prices which he reprocesses and polishes to make them beautiful and solid. He sells them both from office to office and in a fix location, therefore gaining significant profit. But his fund is very insufficient to allow him to respond to the development needs of activities. He has already benefited from three (03) credits $200, $300 and $450 respectively, which he had well paid back without incident. The very positive increase of his activities obliges Mr Charles N. to request at least $ 850 to buy shoes of all categories for end of year festive period business.

Monsieur N. Charles est né le 14 février 1966 à N’GUGO IKEDURU en République du Nigeria. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il habite le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il est très sympa et est bien aimé par son entourage. Monsieur N. Charles est un grand commerçant de chaussures d’occasion depuis 15 ans. Très intelligent et ingénieux, il achète les chaussures de dernières qualités à moindre coût qu’il retraite et cire pour en donner toutes les garanties de très belles chaussures. Il les vend exposés et de bureau en bureau, ce qui lui fait faire de bonnes affaires. Mais son capital est très insuffisant pour lui permettre de répondre aux impératives qui se posent à lui pour un meilleur développement de ses activités. Il avait déjà bénéficié de trois crédits respectivement de $200, $300 et $450 qu’il avait bien remboursés et sans incident. L’évolution très positive de ses activités oblige Monsieur N. Charles à avoir au moins un crédit de $850 pour acheter les chaussures de toute gamme pour en faire un stock pour les fêtes de fin d’année.

loans.use: to buy shoes of all categories for end of year festive period business.

loans.name: Abla Elise

texts.en:
Madam Abla Elise A., is 52 years old. Her main activity is cereal and yam trading. She is married and in charge of six (06) children and contributes at least 75 % of household expenses as the meager pension of her husband which is paid with months of delay is very insufficient to cover the needs of the family. Very dynamic, she substitutes with that trade, the selling of cooked yams which she sells in the market of Adidogomé. Though, she is illiterate, she has a rigorous sense of management. Her first credits were paid promptly paid back and without any incident; this makes her a woman deserving of trust. So, the credit of $ 850 she requested will allow her to travel to the production areas and make important storage of maize, beans, yam, etc. Granting her financial support is contributing to increasing the volume and profitability of the activities thereby improving her living condition and that of her family.

Madame A. Elise Abla, est âgée de 52 ans. Elle fait du commerce céréales et l’igname, son activité principale. Mariée et mère de famille, elle a 06 enfants à sa charge et contribue à au moins 75% des besoins du foyer car la maigre pension de retraie du mari qui se paie d’ailleurs avec des mois de retard, est très insuffisante pour couvrir les besoins de la famille. Très dynamique, elle substitue à ce commerce, la vente de l’igname frite qu’elle vend dans le marché d’Adidogomé. Bien qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a un sens rigoureux de la gestion de ses activités. Ses premiers crédits obtenus et remboursés promptement et sans incident font d’elle une femme de confiance pour tout concours financier. Ainsi, le crédit de $850 sollicité lui permettra de se rendre dans les zones de production pour faire un stock important de maïs, niébé, igame, etc. Lui accordé des facilités financières, c’est contribuer à accroître le volume et la rentabilité des activités en vue d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: to travel to the production areas and make important storage of maize, beans, yam, etc.

loans.name: Koudjo

texts.en:
Mr. K. AGBAK. was born in 1970 at Gati, district of Zio. Married and father of two (02) children, his main activity is engine oil marketing. The beginning of this activity was not easy owing to lack of financial resources. But with courage and determination, Mr. AGBA managed to overcome difficulties and provide for his family’s needs. With the increasing use of motorbikes by the population of Togo, mainly in the capital city, the demand for engine oil is on the rise, and Mr AGBA fails to meet the needs of engine oil. He therefore wants to increase the volume of his stock of engine oil so that he can meet his customers’ needs, and have a source of income for the welfare of his family. The financing of $ 650 he requested will help him keep his stock of engine oil, constantly renewed.

Monsieur AGBA K. est né en 1970 à Gati dans la préfecture du Zio. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il a pour activité principale le commerce d’huile à moteur. Les débuts de cette activité n’ont pas été faciles à cause du manque des moyens surtout financiers. Mais grâce à son courage et à sa détermination, Monsieur AGBA est arrivé à surmonter certaines difficultés et parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Aujourd’hui, avec l’utilisation sans cesse croissante des moto pour les togolais, surtout dans la capitale, Monsieur AGBA a une demande de plus en plus forte en huile à moteur qu’il n’arrive pas couvrir. Il veut donc augmenter sa capacité en matière de stock d’huile à moteur et pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. Ce qui lui permettra d’avoir une source de revenu pour le bien-être de sa famille. Le financement de qu’il sollicite servira à s’approvisionner régulièrement et en quantité en huile à moteur.

loans.use: To buy, stock and sell engine oil

loans.name: Assaba

texts.en:
Born on 4th May, 1952 in Kara, North of Togo, Madam Assaba O. early begun retail sale to supply her own needs. Married and mother of one (01) child, she showed skill in the activity she has done for the past 20 years with good management practices. Madam Assaba O. began her activities in very hard conditions with an initial capital of $30. But thanks to her capacity of management and mainly to her good sense of business, her business took a very encouraging step which needs supporting funds. Her honesty and good will have been proved when she paid her first credit back without problem. This trustworthiness can lead to other financing so that she can increase her business and income, and improve her living conditions. Therefore, the credit of $ 550 will help her buy plastic items (cups, bowls, buckets etc.) for sale during this Christmas period.

Née le 04 Mai 1952 à Kara dans le Nord du Togo, Madame O. Assaba s’est très tôt lancée dans le petit commerce pour pouvoir survivre. Mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant, elle a fait preuve de la maîtrise de son activité qu’elle gère depuis plus de 20 ans avec toute la rigueur d’une gestion responsable. Madame O. Assaba a débuté ses activités dans des conditions très difficiles avec un capital initial de $30. Mais, grâce à sa capacité de gestion et surtout son sens d’affaires, son commerce a pris une ampleur très encourageante qui nécessite des financements d’appoint. Son honnêteté et sa bonne foi ont été démontrées lors de son premier crédit remboursé sans difficulté. Cette confiance peut lui valoir d’autres financements pour augmenter ses affaires afin d’accroître ses revenus et d’améliorer des conditions de vie. Ainsi, le crédit de $550 va servir à acheter des objets en plastiques (gobelet, bassine, seau…) pour leur revente en cette période des fêtes de noël.

loans.use: buy plastic items (cups, bowls, buckets etc.) for sale during this Christmas period.

loans.name: Akoua Abotsi

texts.en:
Madam Akoua Abotsi K., a woman of 42 years old is a widower with seven (07) dependants of whom three (03) of her own children respectively 9 years old, 12 years old and 15 years old. Her main activity is dressmaking and her secondary activity is the trading of haberdashery items and clothes for women. The second activity tends to override the first one. Very courageous, she plays very well her role of household manager and takes care of her orphan children all in school. The expansion of her activities to new products needs a substantial capital which she does not have. From her experience, she has a high entrepreneurial capacity which allows her to take innovative initiatives and very ambitious steps to develop at her businesses. Her attitude of a honest and trustworthy woman are among others positive features for an efficient management of her businesses. In fact she conducted a good management and prompt payment of her first credits of $ 100, $ 200 and $ 450. This allows her to secure her children’s education and greater welfare for the family. The new credit of $ 750 she requested will help purchase loincloth and haberdashery items; financing madam K. Abotsi Akoua would not only an economic action but also a humanitarian one in favour of the orphans.

Madame K. Abotsi Akoua, âgée de 42 ans est veuve avec sept (07) personnes à sa charge dont trois de ses enfants âgés respectivement de 9 ans, de 12 et 15 ans. Elle exerce comme activité principale, la couture et comme activité secondaire, le commerce des articles de mercerie et des pagnes pour femme qui risque d’ailleurs de supplanter la première. Très courageuse, elle assume tant que mal sa responsabilité de mère de famille et survient aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins tous des élèves. L’extension de ses activités à ces deux nouveaux produits nécessitent la disponibilité d’un fonds de commerce assez consistant dont elle ne dispose pas. De par son expérience, elle a une forte capacité entrepreneuriale qui lui permet de prendre des initiatives innovatrices et très ambitieuses pour développer au mieux ses affaires. Son attitude d’une femme honnête et de confiance sont autant des atouts non négligeables pour une gestion efficace de ses affaires. La preuve en est la bonne gestion et le prompt remboursement de ses trois premiers crédits respectivement de $ 100, $200 et de $450 obtenus. Ce qui lui a permis de mieux assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et du mieux-être de la famille. Le crédit actuel de $ 750 sollicité servira à acheter des pagnes et les articles de mercerie. Financer Madame K. Abotsi Akoua serait non seulement un acte économique mais aussi humanitaire en faveur des orphelins.

loans.use: To purchase loincloth and haberdashery items

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Miss Essi W. is 23 years old and single without children. She has some high school education (the final class of high school, Business option). She was born to a polygamous father with 4 wives and 09 children. Abandoned by her husband, she became a high blood pressure patient struggling to meet the primary needs of the family. Having no more the support, Miss Essi W. had to drop out of school to start in the ready-to-wear trading. She started her activity thanks to the support of a good woman who made for her, dresses which she paid for after selling. Conscious that she was nearly exclusively working for the woman for an insignificant profit margin which she paid to her, Miss Essi W. with her meager income of $ 45, has started her own business. With her general background, she would have better succeeded if she had gotten a substantial working capital. With her first credit of $ 350 paid back without any incident, she has shown the proof of all the good things we thought about her. The new financial assistance she requested will help her avoid the traps of searching for an easy life, including STD/AIDS. The credit will also give her means to work and take care of her brothers and sick mother. So, the credit of $ 700 she requested will help to buy, shoes, basins (cloths of high quality) ties, etc. with views to increasing stock an evidence of growth of her activity and in order to increase her income for improved living conditions.

Mademoiselle W. Essi est âgée de 23 ans et célibataire sans enfant. Elle a le niveau de la classe de Terminale G3 (série commerciale) et est née d’un père polygame de 4 femmes avec 9 enfants. Abandonnée par le mari, la maman par soucis est devenue hypertendue et assure difficilement les besoins élémentaires à ses enfants tous laissés à seule charge. N’ayant plus de support, Mlle W. Essi a dû abandonner les classes pour se lancer dans le commerce de prêt-à-porter. Elle a commencé ses activités par l’appui d’une bonne femme qui lui finissait des habits à crédit qu’elle rembourse après vente. S’apercevant qu’elle travaillait presque exclusivement pour la femme à raison de la marge bénéficiaire insignifiante qui lui revenait, Mlle W. Essi, avec son maigre revenu de $45, a débuté ses propres affaires. Avec tout son bagage intellectuel, elle aurait pu mieux réussir si elle avait un fonds de commerce conséquent. Avec son premier crédit de $350 remboursé sans incident, elle a fait preuve de tous les biens qu’on attendait d’elle. Lui accorder aujourd’hui des concours financiers, c’est contribuer à lui éviter les pièges des gains faciles avec toutes ses conséquences comme les MST/SIDA, et encore donner les moyens à pouvoir s’occuper de sa maman malade et de ses frères Ainsi, le crédit de $ 700 sollicité servira à acheter les habits tout cousus, les chaussures, basins, cravates, etc. en vue d’augmenter son stock, signe de croissance de son activité et de ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: to buy, shoes, basins (cloths of high quality) ties, etc.

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.en:
Miss Nathalie K. was born on 20th December 1973 in Kara at the North of Togo. After her training in dressmaking, in difficult conditions, she managed to open a workshop with the help of good-will people. Honest, strict and serious at work, she manages her workshop with efficacy. She is single and raises her two (02) children live with her. Having known that there is no haberdasher’s shop in her quarter and that dressmakers of the area have to go a long distance to have dressmaking materials. Miss K. expressed the desire to open a haberdashery in her workshop and sell all those products to other dressmakers of the quarter; this will be an additional source of income. The credit of $750 she would like to have will help her have the required material to start the haberdashery, and have adequate funds to run this activity.

Mlle K. Nathalie est née le 20 décembre 1973 à Kara dans le nord Togo. Après sa formation en couture dans des conditions pénibles, elle a réussi à ouvrir un atelier avec le concours des personnes de bonne volonté. Honnête, rigoureuse et sérieuse au travail, elle gère son atelier avec efficacité. Elle est célibataire et survient entièrement aux besoins de deux (02) enfants qu’elle a pris chez elle. Ayant constaté qu’il n’existe aucune boutique de mercerie dans son quartier et que tous les couturiers de cette zone se déplacent sur de longues distances pour s’approvisionner en matériels de couture, Mlle K. a manifesté le désir d’ouvrir une mercerie dans son atelier et vendre tous ces produits aux autres couturiers et couturières du quartier. Ce qui va constituer pour elle une source de revenu supplémentaire. Le crédit de $750 qu’elle sollicite va servir à acquérir le matériel nécessaire pour l’ouverture de la mercerie et à disposer d’un fonds de commerce adéquat pour le succès de cette activité.

loans.use: To have the required material to start the haberdashery

loans.name: Beatriz Eugenia

texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old, she has two children of 11 and 13 years which are studying middle school and for them, she works hard every day. Beatriz`s husband works as an employee and his salary is not enough to cover the family expense, especially the education of their children, for this reason Beatriz decided to start her own business of selling fresh chicken 3 years ago. Through the time Beatriz began to have more clients and they started to request for another type of products like meat and vegetables. With their small incomes, she invested in increasing her business capacity, but she had some problems. She had to decide between her family expenses like her kids education or to invest in her business.

** Beatriz requires a loan of $375Dlls to purchase products like meat, chicken and greenness to increase her sales, because in these Christmas season she hopes a bigger increment of her demand. Beatriz and her children thank your support.

** ** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

** Beatriz tiene 34 años, con dos niños de 11 y 13 años los cuales se encuentran estudiando la secundaria y por los que trabaja duro todos los días. El esposo de Beatriz trabaja como empleado de una refaccionaría y su sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de la familia, especialmente la educación de sus hijos, por lo que Beatriz se lleno de valor e inicio su propio negocio vendiendo pollo fresco; hace ya 3 años. A través del tiempo Beatriz comenzó a tener más clientes y empezaron a pedirle otro tipo de productos como carne y verduras. Con sus pocos ingresos invirtió en aumentar su capacidad, pero se enfrento con algunos problemas. Tuvo que decidir entre los gastos del hogar como la educación de sus pequeños o invertir en el negocio.

** Beatriz requiere de un préstamo de $375Dlls para comprar más producto como la carne, pollo y verdura para aumentar sus ventas, ya que en estas épocas navideñas espera un mayor incremento de su demanda. Beatriz y sus hijos agradecen tu ayuda.

**

loans.use: purchase products like meat, chicken and greenness

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a young, kind, hard-working and enthusiastic woman. Her business began one year ago selling different types of Mexican food on the weekends. Little by little, she started to have more acceptance by the community and her clients demanded her foods for important events. However, Lilian does not have the production capacity to assist the great demand she currently has, and also her sales are limited. She is married to Carlos, who is a commercial store employer, and his income only allows them to cover the home basic necessities. However, this is not enough to cover the education expenses of their small children of 10 and 8 years old.

Lilian Requires a loan of $375 to purchase the necessary materials to increase her production capacity and to increase her food sales. With a term of 6 months she will be able to repay the loan. Lilian and her children thank you for your generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Lilian es una mujer joven, amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, comenzó su negocio hace ya más de un año vendiendo diferentes tipos de comida mexicana los fines de semana, poco a poco empezó a tener mayor aceptación y sus clientes demandaban sus comidas para eventos importantes. Sin embargo, Lilian no cuenta con la capacidad de producción para atender la gran demanda que tiene, por lo que sus ventas son limitadas. Casada con Carlos, quien trabaja como empleado de una tienda comercial, el salario de Carlos solo les permite cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar, como el alimento. Sin embargo esto no es suficiente como para la educación de sus pequeños hijos de 10 y 8 años.

Lilian Requiere de un préstamo de $375 para comprar los materiales necesarios para aumentar su capacidad de producción y poder aumentar las ventas de comidas. Lilian y sus niños agradecerán tu generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase the necessary materials

loans.name: Wobolo

texts.en:
Madam Wobolo A. was born in 1972 at Tsèkpo in the district of Yoto. Married and mother of six (06) children, she lived in an incredible poverty, because of the carelessness of an irresponsible husband who spends most of his time in drinking alcohol. Basic household expenses have become a true burden to the wife who struggles everyday. As a qualified, very dynamic, courageous and hard-working baker, she had $ 150 as credit and begun her activity of salted and sugared bread which is very appreciated in the local population and inhabitants of neighboring villages. She had three credits of $200, $ 350 and $ 550 respectively; which she paid back without any problem. Now, she has more than eleven (11) apprentice-bakers from different regions to acquire her expertise. The development of her business shows that she needs more financing. To satisfy more and more needs of bread, Madam A. would like to have a credit of $ 800 which will help her buy: wheat flour, salt, sugar, brewer’s yeast and have a permanent stock; it will also help her increase her production and her income in order to better meet her basic needs and take care of her children at school.

Madame A. Wobolo est née en 1972 à Tsèkpo dans la préfecture de Yoto. Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, elle a vécu dans une misère indescriptible à cause de la négligence d’un mari irresponsable qui passe l’essentiel de son temps à boire de l’alcool. Les charges du ménage sont devenus un véritable poids pour la femme qui se bat au quotidien. Boulangère de formation, très dynamique, courageuse et assidue au travail, elle a bénéficié de $150 comme crédit et commença son activité de fabrication de pain salé et sucré très apprécié par la population locale et les habitants des villages environnants. Elle a bénéficié par la suite de trois crédits respectifs de $ 200, $350 et $ 550 qu’elle avait bien remboursé sans incident. Aujourd’hui, elle a plus de onze (11) apprenties boulangères venues de différentes régions pour acquérir son savoir-faire. Vu le développement de son affaire, elle a besoin des financements plus consitants. Aussi, pour satisfaire les demandes de pain de plus en plus croissantes, Madame A. sollicite-t-elle un crédit d’un montant de $800 qui servira à l’achat des intrants (farine de blé, sel, sucre, levure de bière) pour assurer un stock permanent. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter sa production et par conséquent ses revenus afin d’améliorer ses besoins élémentaires et de s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, salt, sugar, brewer’s yeast and have a permanent stock

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 53 years old, described as a strong and very hard-working woman. She began her business when her husband`s income was not enough for her daughter`s education. Her husband works as a fisherman and his income is not fixed. Elena decided to start to cook her favorite foods and sell them. Her clients were their same neighbors, but her business began to have too many clients and the size of her house’s kitchen and tools to cook, do not allow her to increase her sales and earnings.

Today Elena and their family request your help to receive a loan of $375 because she wants to purchase raw materials and tools and increase her sales. She plans to return the loan in a term of 6 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Elena tiene 53 años, descR. como una señora luchadora y muy trabajadora, ella inicio su negocio al ver que el salario de su esposo no era suficiente para la educación de su hija, ya que el señor trabaja como pescador y su salario es inestable, Elena decidió comenzar a cocinar sus comidas favoritas, sus clientes eran sus mismos vecinos, pero su negocio comenzó a tener mas clientela y el tamaño de la cocina de su casa además de las herramientas, no le permite aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.

Hoy Elena y su familia piden tu ayuda para recibir un préstamo de $375 Dlls y poder abastecerse de insumos y aumentar su capacidad en comidas, Ella planea retornarlo en un plazo de 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and tools and increase her sales

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a great artisan, she has more than 25 years working in that area , which consists on the elaboration and sale of jars and handmade decorations. Francisca is helped by one of her children, for this reason, Francisca`s business has been made with a family enviroment. She is married with Armando who receives one of the lowest incomes, she worries about the well being and development of her family, she is motivate to collaborate with the family economy, and also, to subsist and to offer a better life quality to her children.

** She is 49 years old and she needs a loan of $750 DllS to purchase raw materials and also to buy an industrial polisher that saves and improves the quality of Francisca`s products.

** ** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

** Francisca es una gran artesana, tiene más de 25 años dedicándose a su trabajo, el cual consiste en la elaboración y venta de jarrones y adornos artesanales. Francisca es ayudada por uno de sus hijos, por lo que el negocio de francisca se ha hecho con un total ambiente familiar. Casada con Armando, quien recibe uno de los salarios más bajos, ella se preocupa por el bienestar y desarrollo de la familia motivándola a colaborar con la economía familiar y así poder subsistir y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

** Ella tiene 49 años y necesita un préstamo de $750 DllS para poder abastecerse de material y comprar una pulidora industrial que ahorra y mejora la calidad del trabajo de Francisca.

**

loans.use: Raw materials and also to buy an industrial polisher

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 55 years old, she lives in Mérida Yucatán and she has 3 children, one of them helps her in the business. Norma is working in the clothes sales around her house and small markets, with much acceptance because she has more than 4 years in her business. The reason for which she started to work, was that her husband works with making and selling ropes, so he has an unstable and very low income, Norma knows that her husban`s income can not cover all the family expenses, so she decided to begin her own business. Now she contributes with the home expenses and she also gives employment to one of her children.

Norma requires a loan of $475 Dlls to repair and maintenance of her old car, which is useful to her in transportation and helps her to have a better efficiency with her clothes sales business. She thanks your help and understanding.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Norma tiene 55 años, vive en Mérida Yucatán y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos es quien le ayuda en su negocio. Norma se dedica a la venta de ropa a los alrededores de su casa y tianguis, con mucha aceptación debido a que ya tiene más de 4 años en su trabajo. El motivo por el que la llevo a trabajar, fue que su esposo se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sogas, por lo que el señor cuenta con un salario inestable y muy bajo, Norma sabia que no alcanzaba con los gastos de la familia y el salario tan pequeño de su esposo, por lo que decidió empezar su propio negocio. Ahora contribuye con los gastos del hogar y también le da empleo a uno de sus hijos.

Norma requiere de un préstamo de $475 Dlls para la reparación y mantenimiento de su viejo vehículo, el cual le sirve para trasportarse y tener una mejor eficiencia en la venta de ropa. Ella agradece tu ayuda y comprensión.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of her old  car

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is an artisan with 10 years of experience, he manufactures all type of crafts with wood, from furniture until wooden decorations. José was working in a cooperative of artisans people, however, Jose could not support his family expenses, for this reason, he decided to start his own business in the same line of work, Jose does not have capital to increase his product and his sales. Jose has 3 children, 2 young women and a adult male who helps him in his business.

**. He and his son need are requesting for a loan of $375 Dlls to purchase of tools and raw materials, because the tools that they are using are very rudimentary and they cannot supply the great demand that they have. With a new capital they hope to increase the production, saving time and improving the quality of their products. Jose and his family thanks your support.

** ** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

** José es un artesano con 10 años de experiencia, fabrica todo tipo de artesanías con la madera, desde muebles, hasta adornos de madera. José estaba trabajando en una cooperativa de personas artesanas, sin embargo, José no alcanzaba para los gastos familiares, por lo que decido emprender su propio negocio del mismo género, sin embargo, José carece de capital para producir y poder incrementar el producto y sus ventas. José tiene 3 hijos, 2 mujeres jovencitas y un varón adulto, quien le ayuda en su taller.

** El como su hijo necesitan de un préstamo de $375 Dlls para comprar herramienta y materia prima, debido que la herramienta con la que hoy trabajan es muy rudimentaria y no pueden abastecer la gran demanda que tienen. Con un nuevo capital esperan aumentar la producción ahorrando tiempo y mejorando la calidad de sus productos. José su familia agradecen tu apoyo.

**

loans.use: Purchase of tools and raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a hair salon business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his pay phone business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her fodder supply business.

loans.name: Tekuis

texts.en:
Tekuis owns a cabinet business in Guayaquil, and she manages the sales and collections while her husband works the machinery. They started the shop with wood bought on credit. Tekuis’ husband is talented at what he does, and he produces some of the nicest tables, shelves, and desks, given the materials he has been working with. His vision is to grow the business and create jobs for other skilled workers. Together Tekuis and her husband would like to take out a loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to buy different types of wood. Ms. T. is a 36 year-old mother of three whose goal it is to build a new house made of cement, instead of wood.  

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Together Tekuis and her husband would like to take out a loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to buy different types of wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Wants to build 3 permanent rental rooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate would like to rear 50 laying birds,buy feeds and an incubator

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a widow with one grown up son and several grand children. She is an active member of Queen Esther Group and has benefited a lot from the group through loans she has been getting. Her first loan from KIVA of USD 300 enabled her to install electricity in her rental rooms. This lead to increment of monthly charges from USD 7 to USD10. She was also able to install power in her house which made a significant change in her life. Her family was touched by the loan because since she got married she had not seen electricity in her house. The whole family was touched by the loan and their living standard changed abit. Her grandchildren work as a team and they grow varieties of vegetables for sale and they help her in loan repayment. She supports the children with the income she get from rental rooms and she has housed them. She believes knowledge is power, thus it’s her responsibility to pay fees for her grandchildren as their father is not bothered. She finished paying her last loan payments in the last group meeting and she feels the next loan will not strain her much.This will enable her grand daughter to report to school on the opening date rather than staying for 2 weeks waiting for the tenants to make their monthly repayments. After paying the school fees for one year Lucy makes her monthly loan installments through Queen Esther women group. Lucy finds these arrangements very convenient for her family, her tenants and the school where her daughter studies from.

loans.use: Lucy wants to pay school fees for her granddaughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy wants to buy iron sheets,nails,timber,cement,metal doors,and house paints

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Regina wants to buy more nails,iron sheet,paints,timber,water pipes,and cnstruction bricks

loans.name: Enabulele

texts.en: Mrs. D. Enabulele, a 42 years old caterer in one of the ancient streets in Benin City, specializes in providing special food for people in her environment. She planned to improve her business with food ingredients for preparing food for sale to the public.

loans.use:
To buy food ingredients for preparing food 
for sale to the public

loans.name: Amah

texts.en:
Mr. S. Amah was born on 30th January 1966 in Aneho. He is a welding professional with 5 years of unsatisfactory practice owing to harsh competition from welding shops in a very saturated area. As he has no money to go and settle in another town, he decided to start market gardening for welding did not allow him to yield any revenue. After a 3 month training, he started the market gardening activity along the lagoon of the area. He specialized in the growing of okra a highly appreciated and widely consumed vegetable of Togo. The activity is very profitable for it is an out of season crop. However, the small size of the surface exploited and the lack of modern tools do not allow him to increase production and make revenues large enough to meet the needs of his wife and ten (10) children. He therefore took a first credit of $ 250 to expand his surface and purchase input. Demand is still on the rise and his current production fails to match it. The market is then far from being saturated, chiefly in the dry season that has started and where there is an acute shortage of okra on all markets. The credit of $ 850 requested by M. S. Amah will help acquire a motor-pump, four (04) watering cans, input, fertilizers and herbicides products. The project has a great advantage: it is located by a lagoon and at the seaside.

Monsieur S. Amah est né le 30 Janvier 1966 à Aného. Soudeur de formation, il a exercé le métier pendant 5 ans sans rendement satisfaisant à cause des multiples ateliers de soudure installés dans un milieu très saturé. N’ayant des moyens pour aller s’installer dans une autre ville, il décida alors de se lancer dans le maraîchage car avec la soudure, il n’avait pratiquement plus de revenu. Après une formation de 3 mois, il commença l’activité de maraîchage au bord de la lagune de la localité. Il se spécialisa dans la culture du gombo, condiment bien apprécié et très consommé au Togo. Cette activité lui est très rentable car c’est une culture de contre saison. Toutefois, la petitesse de la superficie exploitée et le manque d’outil moderne ne lui permettent pas d’accroître sa production et dégager un revenu adéquat aux besoins de sa femme et de ses dix (10) enfants. Il pris alors son premier crédit de $ 250 pour agrandir sa surface et acheter les intrants. Les demandes sont sans cesse croissantes que la production actuelle n’arrive pas à couvrir, ce qui prouve l’existence de ce marché qui est loin d’être saturé, surtout en saison sèche qui s’annonce où on constate une grande pénurie du gombo sur tous les marchés. Le crédit de $850 sollicité par Monsieur S. Amah servira acquérir une motopompe, 04 arrosoirs, des intrants et les produits phytosanitaires. Le projet bénéficie d’un grand atout qui est sa situation en bordure de la lagune et de la mer.

loans.use: To acquire a motor-pump, 04 watering cans, input, fertilizers and herbicides products

payments.comment:
Madam Amah SOSSOUVI-ATAYI thanks sincerely KIVA and all those who have contributed to her project funding which allows her today to increase her activities and automatically her incomes to her proper living conditions improvement and those of her family. May Almighty and Merciful God bless you, and rendered it to you everlastingly!!!

The credit is repaying normally and without any incident at this moment.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is 39 years old, a trader who deals on sales of beverages, food items and drinks. A business she has been doing since 8 years. She is a dedicated LAPO client and also she needs $500 to improve her business.

loans.use:
To buy more beverages, food stuffs and 
drinks for sale

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: A trained fashion designer. Mrs. Dora O. a 55 years old dedicated woman and a leader of one LAPO groups in Nigeria. She has 10 years experience in fashion design. She is looking forward to having the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and clothes for sale

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en:
Dimitar G. is 36 years old. He lives in Blagoevgrad and he has graduated Economy in the Blagoevgrad University.

Dimitar has worked as a chief manager in a sartorial factory owned by Greeks in Blagoevgrad for 2 years. 5 years ago the factory was closed and Dimitar had to start his own business. So he found his own sartorial workshop.

Now his wife and 3 other tailors work in that workshop. Because of his fluent Greek Dimitar has very good contacts with Greek partners which gives him very good work and market opportunities.

Now Dimitar G. needs a $1 200 loan to buy a new ironing press for his business.

loans.use: To buy a new ironing press

loans.name: Petko

texts.en:
Petko V. is a 48 years old ex-military officer. Being a military officer he has graduated a Transport school.

He has three kids of two marriages. Now he lives with his second wife in Blagoevgrad.

After he discharged from the army 6 years ago he rented a premises and started a tyre and automobile spares trade.

Petko Velikov will spend this $ 2 000 loan in buying an equipment for tyre mounting and dismounting.

loans.use: To buy an equipment for tyre mounting and dismounting

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: A LAPO group leader; Mrs. Roseline O. is 52.  She started her business in1981. She is a popular yam and plantain seller in her quarters in Nigeria. She planned to improve her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more yams and plantains for sale

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani T. is 28 years old. She lives with his husband in Blagoevgrad. She is a third year student in the city university and studies fashion design.

Ani is a hairdresser and 3 years ago found her own beauty studio. Her husband is unemployed. Ani separates her day between the studio and studies in the University.

She needs this money to buy a new hairdresser’s chair.

loans.use: To buy a new hairdresser’s chair

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika G. – Blagoevgrad 

Marika G. is 43 years old and keeps a little grocery in Blagoevgrad. This is a family business. Marika is a seller in the grocery and her husband makes the delivery. When she is not engaged in the grocery Marika has an extra business as an accountant consultant. Marika and her husband need a new professional refrigerator for their grocery and thet is the reason they apply for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: For a new professional refrigerator for the grocery

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. sells yam, fish and other food items. A business she started 8 years ago. She is 40 years old. She emphasized the impact of LAPO loan in her business and is willing to expand her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs (yam and fish) for sale

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana D. is 33 years old. She is married and has a boy. She has graduated marketing and she has worked as a marketing specialist in the Forest Economy Directorate in Blagoevgrad.

A year ago she was discharged from work and started her own business. She is a sales representative of a Perfumery Catalogue Trade Company.

Svetlana needs $ 2 000 loan to equip the office she rented for her business

loans.use: To equip her office

loans.name: Evdokia

texts.en:
Evdokia T. is 41 years old. She lives with her family in Blagoevgrad. Her two children are students and her husband is unemployed.

She graduated mathematics and worked in The City Computing Center but 6 years ago she lost her job. Then she started a second hand books trade.

Evdokia T. wants to rent and equip one more book shop and to expand her business and that is why she needs an $ 800 loan.

loans.use: To rent and equip one more book shop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: A 43 years old experience traders, Mrs. Helen I. makes beverages available for people in her environment. To meet the demand of her customers, she needs $500.

loans.use: To buy more Beverages for sale

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena V. is 39 years old and keeps a little coffee shop in Blagoevgrad. Many years she and her husband were unemployed.

Two years ago their friend borrowed them some money and they found this coffee shop. Now both Elena and her husband work in it and the coffee shop is the only income resource for the family.

Elena and her husband need a new coffee making machine so they apply for this $ 700 loan

loans.use: For a new coffee making machine

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience E. specializes on sales of life chicken (a business she started 12 years ago) to a semi-urban dwellers at Uwelu Quarters in Edo State, Nigeria. She is eager to invest more money in business for expansion. So, she is counting on the above amount to boost her business

loans.use: To buy more chicken for sale

loans.name: Judith
