texts.en: Mrs. Judith E., a LAPO Client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loan and the poor in Nigeria. Especially the impact of LAPO loan in her life and family for the past 8 years, she bent on loyalty to LAPO and ensure her repayment is 100%. She request for the above amount to increase her goods.

loans.use:
To buy more plastics for sale (plates, cups, 
Basins, coolers, etc.

loans.name: Joy Amen Nedozi

texts.en: A 35 years old, Mrs. Joy N. specializes on sales of shoes and bags since 2000. A business or trade she learnt for        2 years. She plans to improve her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for sales

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget O. is 30 years old and a 4 years old dedicated LAPO client. She specializes on sales of clothes and tailoring materials to people in her environment.  She needs the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. a 30 years old started her foodstuffs business 8 years ago. She joined LAPO two years after she started her business with her little saving. According to her LAPO came to rescue her when her business was at the point of collapsing as a result of inadequate running capital. She is eager to get the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sales

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: A foodstuffs seller. Mrs. Rose I. at Uwelu Quarters (a semi-urban area in Nigeria) is a dedicated and credit worthy poor woman. She plays major roles in her family up- keeping and proud to be a LAPO client because LAPO made her what she is today. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. O. had her 3 years fashion design training from 1996 to 1998 and has practiced her profession for 8 years. She is optimistic that her business will improve more than what it is now if given the above amount.

loans.use:
To buy sewing machines and clothes for making
Dresses for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: A 40 years old. Mrs. Joy U. sells yams to people in her environment at Uwasota Quarters,( a semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria). High Patronage by customers gives her joy. She planned to boost her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Albena

texts.en:
Albena T. is 29 years old. She is single and still lives in her parents’ apartment.

Albena is trained digital specialist. After graduation she has worked as a technical assistant in the Vratza brunch of Bulgarian Telecommunication Company. Three years later she quits starting her own business.

Albena T. runs a communication center in Vratza in which she supplies internet, internet phone calls services, copying and printing services and so on.

The $ 1100 loan she will use to buy a new color copying machine for her communication center.

loans.use: To buy a new color copying machine

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Mrs. Beauty O., the owner of Beauty Plastic Store is a dedicated client of LAPO. Her outstanding performance reflected in her 100% repayment of LAPO loan. She pledged to expand her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more plastics for sale

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia M. is 42 years old. She was born in the town of Biala Slatina but after she graduated the Specialized Technical School in Vratza she decided to stay in the city.

After graduation Evgenia has worked as a support manager in a technical company but it was closed so 10 years ago she found her little shop in which she sells spares for electric appliances.

Her husband also has a business. He is an aeromechanic and has his own garage. She and her husband have a daughter who is a student.

Evgenia M. needs to supply some extra spares for electric appliances so she needs a $ 1200 loan.

loans.use: To supply some extra spares for electric appliances

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Mrs. Faith O. is 35 years old. A specialist in sales of foodstuffs, a business she learnt from her mother. She has proved her credit worthiness for the past three (3) years she has been benefiting from LAPO loan. She needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Foodstuffs is a quick turnover business says a 34 years old Mrs. Joy E.. She is eager to get more money to buy foodstuff in order to meet her customer’s demands.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: A trained hairdresser. Mrs. Rebecca O. is 42 years old. She operates her saloon business at the urban center (Benin City) in Nigeria. She needs the sum of $500 to expand her business

loans.use: To buy driers for her business

loans.name: Success

texts.en: One of LAPO group leaders, Mrs. Success E.. A trained fashion designer is 28 years old. She is energetic, zealous and optimistic in all her dealings. She needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines

loans.name: María

texts.en:
For 15 years Maria had made ends meet with her job as a seamstress but about 8 months ago she decided to venture into a new line of business. Maria saw a great opportunity in her community to open a phone center, where the locals could go to her phone booths and make calls. This is a particularly good business in these sectors of Guayaquil because people cannot afford to install phone lines in their homes. Therefore, these phone call centers are very popular throughout Guayaquil, especially because they also offer the ability to make international calls to family members who are overseas which can be very expensive, even for those who do have phone lines.

Maria’s husband has been extremely supportive in this new venture. They slowly accumulated their savings in order to buy the substantial start up investments necessary to launch this business. Maria now wants to put in two computers that have internet connections. Before she can do this she has to add a gate to her entrance and put in an alarm system in order to deter criminals from robbing her.

Maria has four children, one of which works at the business at night. Their family ties are very strong and they all do their part to help the business. Maria’s goals include continuing to improve her house which she always tries to keep up.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in security for her phone call center and possibly put in a computer with internet access

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel sells household items from her home. She owned a store for about five years that was very successful until her mother became ill. In order to pay for some of the hospital bills Raquel began selling off many of the items at her business and eventually she found herself closing it down. Raquel has faced extremely difficult challenges since then. Her mother eventually passed away, her husband left her and she was left with no source of income.

Two months ago she decided she needed to get back on her feet by reopening her business from her home. She sells towels, sheets, decorations and has also found success in selling fresh milk. She is seeking the loan in order to invest in new items to sell so she may slowly start to rebuild her business. She has two children who she cares for her on her own and who inspire her to make her business succeed.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Raquel will use the loan to buy new products to sell

loans.name: Luís

texts.en:
Luis is a fruit vendor who sells his product from his tricycle cart. He found that there was too much competition in the local fruit markets and preferred to take his fruits directly to the homes of his clients. He has had success because it is more convenient for people to buy fruits when Luis passes by rather than going to the market. Two days a week he also sells ties, belts and other clothing accessories. He is seeking a loan in order to fix his cart that was damaged when it got hit by a car recently.

Luis is 46 years old and has one son. He and his wife have been able to buy and fix up their home through hard work and savings. He tells us that his wife and son are his inspiration to go out and work hard from 5 in the morning into the evening.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Fix the tricycle cart he sells his fruit from

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is a shoemaker looking for investment capital for his business. He started working in this activity about 6 years ago when he was hired by a Chilean man. Eventually his boss returned to Chile and left Hilario with all the machines and clients. Since then Hilarios has been working diligently to make the business a success, but he has been restrained because he does not have the capital the previous owner had.

He is now seeking a loan in order to buy his raw materials such as leather and soles. He is looking to significantly increase his production for the upcoming holiday season. Hilario works with his brother and two other employees at his business. He lives in his home with his mother and has four children who live with his ex-wife.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy leather and raw materials necessary for his shoe making operation

loans.name: José

texts.en:
Jose is a fruit and vegetable distributor who sells to the small stores and markets in Guayaquil. He borrows his cousin’s truck for $10 a day in order to be able to pick up the fruit he buys from wholesalers. His father and his uncle taught him how and where to buy the fruit at the best prices. When he was young he would often go along with his uncle when he bought these products and also when he sold them from his tricycle cart. When he was 15 he felt the need to contribute to his family’s income and took up the same line of his work as is father and uncle.

He travels to the wholesale markets every morning at 5 AM in order to buy the fruits that are in season. Right now he is buying mostly mangoes, watermelons, oranges, tomatoes and avocadoes. He borrows from the loan sharks in order to buy the fruit he distributes. He is seeking this loan in order to avoid borrowing from them at extremely high interest rates. His long term goal is to buy a home for his wife and two kids. Right now they all live at Jose’s mother in law’s home and he is saving up for a home of his own.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: In Guayaquil not many people can afford to buy their own video game consoles like the Playstation or Xbox, yet the kids love to play the games just as they do in the rest of the world. Businesses like Barbara’s have emerged where they rent out playing time on video game consoles from their home. Barbara has three TVs and three Playstations with a variety of games that the kids can choose to play. She saved up $500 from her part time job in a travel agency to buy the used the consoles and the televisions. Barbara also sells ice cream and soft drinks to the video game players and kids from a nearby school. She is seeking a loan in order to buy another console and make improvements to her home/business.

loans.use: Continue investing in clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Tanya

texts.en:
Tanya sells cosmetic products and does manicures from her parent’s home. Although she is only 19 she has a strong entrepreneurial spirit and hopes one day she can own a full fledged beauty salon. She started working in this line of business when she was 15 years old as she would give manicures to her friends and neighbors. Slowly she built a customer base and decided to start this business.

She uses the money from her business for her personal expenses and to help her stay in school. She attends class in the morning and opens her business from 2 to 8 in the afternoon. She usually finances the cosmetic products from the vendors but has realized that they charge very high interest rates. She is seeking this loan in order to be able to buy products at wholesale prices and to hire someone to work in the mornings. She comes from a household of 5 brothers and sisters and still lives with her parents. Her father works in a factory and her mother is unemployed.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in cosmetic products to sell and hire a new employee

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has been making sandals for years now, and she works very hard to bring in income for her family. This entrepreneur sells her sandals in Guayaquil but also travels outside the city to market her items. She works every day from 9am until 6pm and hopes that she can earn enough to open a professional looking shop in the front of her house. Rosa believes that if she can exhibit the items better and allow people to window shop, she will make more sales and earn higher profits.  Ms. C. is 46 years old and has two children. Her family lives in a very poor part of town and their house is made of bamboo canes. Rosa’s wish is to earn enough money so that she can provide a decent home for her family and educate her children. 

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Rosa believes that if she can exhibit the items better and allow people to window shop, she will make more sales and earn higher profits.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns a small shop where she sells sports apparel and clothes. Luckily her business is located along one of the major streets in the north side of Guayaquil, so there is plenty of traffic that passes by her shop. She originally started out with the help of her sister, and they both work together from 9am until 10pm Monday through Sunday. Maria is asking for this loan so that she can buy a wider selection of shoes, jerseys, and soccer gear. This 39 year-old woman is from Empalme, Ecuador and has one child who is grown up now. She hopes that by taking out a loan from Kiva, she will be able to pay for her son’s school clothes and help him buy a house in a few years. 

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Maria is asking for this loan so that she can buy a wider selection of shoes, jerseys, and soccer gear.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio B. owns a shop in Guayaquil, Ecuador selling meat. He started the business by borrowing some money from his brother, and he has been growing it consistently ever since. Every day Julio works from 7am until 11pm and makes most of his money by selling at the big market near his house. He also supplies some smaller stores with meat. Mr. B. and his wife want to invest in a new grill for filleting the steaks, which he does most often. Julio is 45 years old and was born in Santa Elena. He has one young son, and his family lives in a modest cement house. Julio is hoping that he can generate enough revenue to save up for a car to start doing deliveries to all the stores that purchase meat from him.  

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Mr. Bustamante and his wife want to invest in a new grill for filleting the steaks

loans.name: Quenis

texts.en:
Quenis Z. owns an auto body shop in the middle of Guayaquil. He learned how to fix up and restore cars from a friend when they were 15 years old. Now that he is 45 he has tons of experience and can repair just about anything on the car. Slowly, Quenis bought tools and machines in order to do the repairs and opened a garage next to his house where clients bring their cars. He works every day from 8am until 4pm and continues to teach young apprentices how to do the job just like he was taught many years ago. With this loan Quenis plans to buy machinery and raw materials such as metal scraps, bumpers, and tools in order to fix a wider variety of cars. Mr. Z. has been a dedicated worker for years now and has been able to make enough money to buy his house and send his young child to school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: With this loan Quenis plans to buy machinery and raw materials such as metal scraps, bumpers, and tools in order to fix a wider variety of cars.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
She is engaged in the production and selling of local clothing and textiles for the West Africa sub-region. Her products attracts a lot of tourist to her shop. 

She has been trained by Kraban Support Foundation staff in basic book and records keeping and sales and marketing skills. She has also developed small business plan. This is based on the skills acquired from the TEACH lending strategy of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION.

She wants to expands her business and therefore needs about $650 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: Fabric moulding and designing equipment

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
She is the owner of a medium-sized wood carving firm. The firm produces local wood carvings for citizens in the country. The carvings have high demand as they are purchased and used for ceremonial activties such as traditional festivals and other social engagements including marriage ceremonies.

She has acquired skills in business planning and keeps simple records of her business operations.She has been a very good participant in our TEACH lending sessions and a good applicant of the skills learnt.

loans.use: WOOD CARVING AND MOULDING MACHINE

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: She trades in dried pepperand other farm spices. She purchases pepper and other perishable farm produce from farmers. She dries them and then sell them to institutions including hospitals, clinics and schools. Her activities are very helpful to the farmers as she assist to address the post harvest losses of her client farmers by given them prompt incomes and also support the chain of distribution as a key link between the farmers who are the producers and the institutions who are the consumers.She therefore has a ready and availble market and constant cash flow in her business. Rebecca has also participated in the TEACH lending skills programme and has developed a simple marketing plan that enables her to market her wares easily.She therefore needs KIVA loan funds to further improve her business.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Krum

texts.en:
Krum N. is 36 years old. Over 15 years he has worked as a police officer in Vratza. Krum N. is married and has two children. His wife does not work at the moment. She is keeping their 2 months baby.

Krum runs his own business because of his father in law. He opens a coffee and soft drinks shop on one of the main streets of the city and later Krum inherits and develops this business.

Now Krum N. needs $ 2 000 to buy a new professional coffee making machine and a refrigerator for soft drinks for his shop.

loans.use: To buy a new professional coffee making machine and a refrigerator for soft drinks

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris J. is 55 years old. He has worked as a mechanic in a machinery-construction plant for over 25 years.

After the plant was closed Boris started an own business. He found a machine repair workshop. Four years later Boris J. bought a hall which he set as a grocery and this became his main business. The grocery is situated right to the city bus station. Boris’s wife has own business. She runs an accounting office.

For full equipment of his grocery Boris J. needs two professional refrigerators and air-conditioning. The loan amount is $ 2 000

loans.use: To buy two professional refrigerators and air-conditioning

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: A popular agricultural produce seller in her community. She sells farm produce including eggs, tomatoes,garden eggs, green pepper among other organic produce to the community members with a population of 5,000 inhabitants. The proximity of the community to Accra, the National capital also gives her added advantage as she supplies fresh farm produce to the local markets and workers in Accra who live and work in the community. She is a valued client of Kraban Support Foundtaion. She has acquired skills in agribusiness records keeping and has developed a simple but smart business plan. She needs working capital to purchase more farm produce to sell to her numerous customers.

loans.use: WORKING CAIPTAL

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan T. is 42 years old, married with three children. Ivan has over 20 years experience in trading. He has been a supplier in the ex-state company “BulgarFruit”.

After the failure of the company he found himself unemployed and had to start own business. So he found a coffee, tea and soft drinks stall. Now Ivan T. keeps a refreshment stall near the cooperative market of Vratza.

He and his wife have a rich experience in trading. His wife has been a store seller for over 20 years.

Ivan T. will spend this $ 1 000 loan in buying a grill for “djuner kebap” (it is a traditional Turkish meal) and two pancake toasters.

loans.use: To buy a grill and two pancake toasters

loans.name: Vasko

texts.en:
Vasko V. is a photographer. He is 32 years old and lives in Vratza. He graduated a professional photographic school and had worked in his father’s company for 8 years. His father is also a photographer.

Two years ago Vasko and his father separated their business and he found his own photographic studio. He managed to achieve good image and to win lots of customers.

Vasko V. needs a new professional camera and photographic materials and he applies for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: To buy a new professional camera and photographic materials

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina N. is 38 years old. She is divorced and has two children who are students now.

After her divorce she specialized “Hairdressing and Cosmetics” and started to work for a friend of hers who is one of the famous hairdressers in the city. She had worked in her friend’s studio for 10 years and had got a rich experience.

One year ago she opened her own studio. Now she needs some equipment for this studio – a professional chair, hair-drier and materials. She needs $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a professional chair, hair-drier and materials

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta C., a 61-year-old widow, native of the District of Matutuine, in the south of the province of Maputo, has 8 children and 6 grandchildren, grew up in the Swiss Mission church and was not able to attend school due to the differences between the colonial government and the church.

After the death of her husband, who was a fisherman, 6 years ago from an illness, she has gone through many difficulties because the reserve of savings was used to take care of the hospital expenses of her late husband.

After the death of her husband, with a group of 12 members under her care, she had no choice but to continue the work her late husband did, even though the equipment was in a precarious state and the sea was polluted by the Greek petroleum ship, Katina P.

Even with these problems, she met the challenge, and with her youngest son who, at the time was 14, started the work up again, with him as captain of the ship.

In 2001, she found out about the Microfinance Institution called Hluvuku-Adsema, which operated around 45 km from where she was, so she went there and requested a loan to acquire and rehabilitate fishing equipment. This was accepted and she also benefitted from training on business management. With this loan, she was able to revitalize the microbusiness, and several others followed to maintain and expand the business, totalling 6 loans in all. Given her low level of schooling, she has received continuous monitoring from the Hluvuku-Adsema staff in order to generate more business and ensure the repayment of the loans. This work won her 3rd place in the Global Micro-Businessperson Contest held in Mozambique in 2004, during the commemorations of the International Year of Microcredit.

She currently has a motor boat and 8 permanent workers. With a loan of 20,000 meticais, she plans to buy more fishing nets in order to increase her production capacity, create more jobs - it should be 4 more seasonal workers - as well as buy a freezer with 270 L capacity to be able to better preserve the fishing products.

Her activity has a greater impact on the life of the community because, in addition to generating more jobs for the people who work directly with fishing, she creates more jobs for the people who acquire the product to later resell it. She also contributes to a continuous supply of a range of seafood to the city of Maputo, greatly contributing to improve the population\'s diet.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Catembe, Maputo, Moçambique Cliente: Marta C. Sector de Actividade Pesca Valor de Empréstimo: 20.000,00 Mtn (769 US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: compra de redes pesca e sistema de frio( congelador) Inicio - 14/11/2006 Fim – 06/05/2008 Marta C., viúva de 61 anos de idade, natural do Distrito de Matutuine, sul da província de Maputo tem 8 filhos e 6 netos, cresceu na igreja da Missão –Suiça e não conseguiu frequentar a escola divido as divergência entre o governo colonial e a igreja.

Depois da morte do Marido que era pescador à 6 anos vítima de doença atravessou muitas dificuldades porque a reserva das economias foram usadas para custear as despesas de hospitalares do falecido.

Desde a morte do marido e com um agregado de 12 membros sob a sua responsabilidade, não tinha alternativa para a continuidade da actividade que o falecido marido exercia uma vez que para alem do estado precário em os equipamento se encontravam, o mar estava poluído pelo petroleiro grego “Katina P”.

Mesmo com estas dificuldades desafiou a situação e com o filho mais novo que na altura tinha 14 anos reiniciaram a actividade, este como capitão da embarcação.

No ano de 2001, teve informações da existência de uma instituição Micro-financeira denominada Hluvuku-Adsema, que operava a cerca de 45km da sua localidade tendo se deslocado para lá e solicitou um empréstimo para aquisição e reabilitação de equipamento de pesca, o qual foi aceite e também beneficiou-se de formação sobre gestão de negócio. Com este empréstimo conseguiu revitalizar a micro empresa tendo seguindo vários outros para a ampliação do negócio e sua manutenção totalizado 6 empréstimos desembolsados. Dado o seu baixo nível de escolarização tem recebido um acompanhamento contínuo de monitorização por parte do pessoal da Hluvuku- Adsema de forma a gerir melhor o seu negocio e garantir os reembolsos dos empréstimos, este trabalho garantiu-lhe a conquista do 3º lugar no Concurso Global de Micro – Empresário realizado em Moçambique no ano 2004 no âmbito das comemorações do ano internacional de micro crédito.

Actualmente conta com um barco a motor e 8 trabalhadores efectivos, com empréstimo de 20.000, 00 mtn, pretende comprar mais redes de pesca de forma a aumentar a sua capacidade de produção, criar mais postos de trabalho pelo que conta contratar mais 4 trabalhadores sazonais assim como comprar um congelador com capacidade de 270 L de forma a poder conservar melhor os produtos de pesca.

A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na vida da comunidade porque para além de gerar mais posto de trabalho para o pessoal que trabalha directamente com a pesca cria mais posto de trabalho para o pessoal que adquirir o produto para uma posterior revenda e por outro lado permite um abastecimento contínuo em diversos mariscos à cidade de Maputo contribuindo grandemente para melhor dieta alimentar da população.

loans.use: Buying nets and refrigater

loans.name: Rumen

texts.en:
Rumen H. has rich experience inn restaurant business. For over 17 years he had worked as a warehouse manager in the ex-state catering company. The company was closed and he decided to start a business.

He rents premises and makes it a restaurant. This restaurant works more then 10 years. It is situated on a trade center of the city.

Rumen H. is married and has two sons. They all work in the restaurant. His wife is a cook and the boys are waiters.

Now Rumen wants to make some repairs in his restaurant nad needs $ 1 600.

loans.use: For repairs and equipment of the restaurant

loans.name: Nikola

texts.en:
Nikola I. is 66 years old. He is retired now but has 37 years length of service as a miner. He is married and has two daughters and two grandsons. His wife is also retired and she had been a kindergarten mistress.

Nikola I. started his business because of necessity. One of his grandsons felt ill with a rare joint decease that needed a surgical intervention. They made this intervention in France but the medical treatment needed great resources. So Nikola I. and his wife start trading.

First they rented a stall on one of the trading streets of the city and later they received a municipal license for a shop in which they sell children’s clothes.

Now it is getting colder and Nikola wants to supply winter clothes for his shop. This costs him $ 800.

loans.use: To supply winter children clothes

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: She is a Hawker. A very ingenous cooked food seller who plies her trade in 16 villages daily. She cooks yam, rice, fufu(pounded cassava mixed with plantain), banku(steamed corn meal. With the support of an assistant they trek and sell their cooked food to members of these 16 communities. Abla has been involved in this business for the past 27 years. She would like to have a permanent structure in place where she can sell her cooked food. After participating in TEACH lending sessions she has developed a business plan with a 5-year perspective and she has the firm conviction that if she  is able to receive a bigger loan she will locate and expand her business which would be strategic due to the fact that her community is located on  a major highway which will attract clients including haulage carriers and other long distance passengers in addition to the 16 communities she is already providing her serves.

loans.use: PERMANENT BUSINESS PREMISES

loans.name: Yesutor

texts.en: Yesutor Y. operates a small construction business popularly called \\\'JESUS IS THE ANSWER SERVICES\\\'. She runs a sand, stone and chippings business - a rural housing and cottage industry. Her business supplies stones,sand, chippings and water to building contractors in the village she resides and surrounding communities. In her market analysis during the TEACH lending Business Planning session, she indicated that she has assisted in providing 21 affordable rural houses for her clients mostly the middle income earners who stay in the community and commute to 3 urban centres in the neighbourhood. She believes that if assisted with KIVA loans, she would be able to purchase a mini truck which would facilitate the conveyance of her raw materials - sand,stone,chippings,water,etc to the various project sites. With this she hopes to expand her affordable houses built from 21 to about 70 units annually

loans.use: MINI TRUCK CONVEYER

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agnes lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with nine children.Four are in primary school and  two are in Secondary school.Agnes keeps Chicken both broilers and layers.She supplies chicken meet and eggs to different private hospitals in Temeke district of Dar es Salaam.She has six years in this business.Limited with  capital Agnes fails to meet demand from her customers. The additional capital of USD 750 will help her suffice this requirement.The expansion strategy will help her  increase income .Next year her third born will join secondary school the extra income will facilitate for school fees.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha lives in Yombo area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with four children.Asha runs a vegetables and fruits stall in Tandika market.She buys these items directly from farmers.She has been in this business for more than four years.Recently she had secured another stall within the same maket but on the other side.She is planning to open it soon after getting additional funding.Her sister will be incharge for this new stall.To facilitate the opening of this new stall Asha needs  USD 550.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Veronca

texts.en:
The propritor of VMENS LINX is accredited by the Local Authority in her area for the immense contribtion to the district for providing quality but cheap and affordable clothing to inhabitants of communities in the district she operates. Using the TEACH Lending model techniques, she has taught her staff to adhere strictly to the 7 principles of basic hygiene. They have applied these basic principles which have enabled the firm to increase their sales turnover within the last 6 months.

Mrs M. is requesting $1050 KIVA loan. If provided this sh would purchase a second washing and drying machine to support thr expansion of her operations

loans.use: WASHING & DRYING EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Isack

texts.en: Isack lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.He is married and has six children. Two of his sons are in secondary school.Isack keeps chickens and cows.Alongside keeping animals,Isack grows vegetables.He uses manures from animals for vegetables growing.He has been in this business for five years now.Isack is worried in this coming rain season.Animals and vegetables are frequently attacked by deseases during rains.He need a sufficient stock of insectcides.He couldn’t managed  buying by himself because he recently paid school fees for his elder son.Isack is in need of USD 400 to have enough stock of insecticides

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.He is married with one child.Issa sells used cloth at Tandika market. The market is well known and famous in selling used cloths.There are a lot of competitors to Issa’s business.The profit margin has been declining.Through his experience Issa learnt that it is better to switch to selling of used shoes which have a better profit margin.The switching strategy demand more working

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu owns a shop in the community called Oterkpolu. She trades in General merchandising. Her services has been of immense benefit to the community she resides with about a population of 3000 people.Salamatu sells all items in her shop which includes stationary, fabrics, soft drinks,alcoholic beverages, etc. Community members therefore have easy access to whatever item they would have purchased from the urban towns at the cost of transportation and thier time. Madam I. has participated in the TEACH Lending programme and has prepared a small business plan. 
Her request for KIVA loans if granted would be used to expand her business

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Omari

texts.en: Omari lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.He is married with two children.He owns a retail shop near his residence.The shop sells different consumable items especially food items,rice in particular. Rice is one of staple food in Tanzania.Jafari plans to increase the stock of rice.There is an expectation of rice price rise.Having enough stock now will help him make more money later.The extra stock demands more funding.Through his savings he managed to contribute 20% of the required stocking.The strategy will help him increase income.The aim being to sustain the family and pay for school fees for his children. To implement his plans Omari needs USD 550 as a working capital.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack lives in Kitunda area in Dar es Salaam.He is married and has five children.Two in primary school and another two in secondary school.
Isack keeps layers and broilers nearby his residence.He is in a plan of adding the flock of chickens from 300 he usually kept to 500.Isack has to employ one person in his business to take charge of the increased stock. The expansion strategy need some additional funding as more chicks are to be added and a stock of poultry  feed.The expansion  plan will enable Isack pay for school fees for his secondary school children and increase income for his family. To implement his growth plan he need additional capital of  USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married and has two children.She lives in Tandika in Dar es Salaam.Rehema had a training in tailoring offered by a Baptist Church in Dar es Salaam.She runs a tailoring business,specialised in women and children clothes.She had employed one assistant in her business.She is planning to expand her business by adding two sewing machines and one more assistant.
Rehema also sells eggs as a subsidiary business.She buys eggs from poultry keepers and resell them in retail.She also need to improve this business by adding trays for carrying eggs. To facilitate her two businesses, Rehema is in need of USD 550

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Rajabu

texts.en: Rajabu lives in Yombo, Temeke District of Dar es Salaam.He is married with three children. Rajabu sell used clothes . He buys these clothes from wholesales, amend them in his tailoring workshop at home and resell them in retail. Most used clothes need some modification before resell, some are undersized ,some are oversized, some are torn. Rajabu owns one old sewing machine. He needs two modern sewing machines. The new machines will increase the speed of repairing the clothes. He is also in a plan to employ one assistant to facilitate his mission, To make his plan work Rajabu is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Salum

texts.en:
Salum is married with one child. He lives in Vituka in Temeke District of Dar es salam. Salum sells maize in retail. He buys the maize in large quantities from nearby regions, stock them and resell them in retail. Salum is planning to improve his business by having enough stock of maize especially in this starting rain season. Because roads to up country are not easily passable during rain seasons,it si better to have enough stock now.
  Extra stock demands some more packaging materials, carriage costs and storage costs.
To make his plan work Salum is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Angel Osiris

texts.en:
Mr. Benavides has 3 years making toy packages for children. He buy the toys in large quantities and sticks the toys in a carton panel and sells in grocery stores. \"I initiated this business because there are some children that the parents don’t have the opportunitie to buy expensive toys, and I sell cheaper ones , in addition this is a game system surprise. This method is new and it pleases much to them to the children. Now that approaches the end of the year, I need to provide many orders but I dont have enough merchandise, reason why I need a credit 1.500 dollars to buy toys and to provide all the orders that have done to me. This will increase my business and will allow that many children have a toy for christmas.\" I will repay in a term of 12 months.

Español

El Sr. Benavides tiene tres años dedicándose a la fabricación de paquetes de juguetes para niños. Compra por mayoreo y pega los juguetes empaquetados en exhibidores de cartón, y los vende en la tiendas de abarrotes. “Inicié este negocio porque se que hay niños a los cuales sus padres no les pueden comprar juguetes caros, y los juguetes que yo vendo son muy económicos, además que los niños los compran mediante un sistema de juego sorpresa. Este método es nuevo y les agrada mucho a los niños. Ahora que se acerca el fin de año necesito surtir muchos pedidos pero no cuento con suficiente mercancías, por lo que necesito un crédito de 1,500 dólares para comprar juguetes y surtir todos los pedidos que me han hecho. Esto aumentará mi negocio y permitirá que muchos niños tengan un juguete este fin de año.” Pienso pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy cheap toys and games for kids

loans.name: Erika Rocio

texts.en:
Mrs. T. has a small business of food located in a market. She has 8 years dedicating to this business. \"I love to cook and I prepare Mexican food. My clients said that my food is delicius and they frequent my business many times. Nevertheless my work equipment has broken down because the hard work they had been exposed to and that causes delays in the elaboration of the food. I Also need some furniture in order to give a better service to my clients. I´m asking for a loan of 1.500 dollars to cover these needs and to improve my business. I consider myself as a hard working person with high expectations, with your support I´m sure i will make it.\"

Español

La Sra. T. tiene un pequeño negocio de comida ubicado en un mercado muy concurrido. Tiene 8 años dedicándose a este negocio. “Me gusta cocinar y preparo comida Mexicana con mucho esmero. Mis clientes dicen que la comida es muy sabrosa y frecuentan mi negocio repetidas veces. Sin embargo mi equipo de trabajo se ha acabado porque lo uso a diario, y eso me ocasiona que tarde más en la elaboración. También me hacen falta algunas mesas y sillas para acomodar a mis clientes y darles un mejor servicio. Quisiera un apoyo de un crédito de 1,500 dólares para cubrir estas necesidades y mejorar mi negocio. Me considero una persona con ganas de superarme y creo que con este apoyo lo lograré.”

loans.use: buy chairs,tables and supplies

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Mrs. M. has been a retailer for 22 years and in spite of its age, she wishes to be a success retailer. This business is my only source of income, since, I live alone. \"I would like to see my business growing and obtaining the necessary resources for my medical and personal expenses\". I´m very kind with my clients, that´s why they still coming to buy. Three months ago I initiated the sale of toys and it has gone to me very well. The end of the year is coming, and I would like to sell season merchandise, that´s the reason why I´m asking for a loan of $1300.00 dllrs. I want to repay in 12 months.

ESPAÑOL

La Sra.M. ha sido comerciante desde hace 22 años y a pesar de su edad desea ser una comerciante de éxito. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos ya que vive sola. \"Tengo muchos deseos de que mi negocio prospere y me aporte los recursos necesarios para mis gastos médicos y personales. Siempre atiendo a mis clientes con amabilidad para que sigan acudiendo a comprar. Hace tres meses inicié la venta de juguetes y me ha ido bien, ahora que esta cerca el fin de año quiero vender mas articulos de temporada, por lo que les solicito un crédito de 1,300 dólares para surtir estas mercancías.\" me gustaria pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: Comprar juguetes y articulos de temporada navideña.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a very optimistic person, after he left the alcoholism since more than 16 years ago, Ismael promised never return to the addictions again, and also he wants to demonstrate to his family that is an useful and very hard-working person. He started his own business since 15 years ago and he is working to the production of metal pieces business, which are used for the production of quarry figures. Ismael has demonstrated his complete recovery from the addictions and he continues demonstrating his great love for his family.

He requires a loan of $475 USD. to purchase raw materials, which helped him to increase the production of metallic pieces, his job has increased constantly, but he comments that he does not have the capacity to cover his demand. He wants to continue demonstrating the love for his family and for the life, he requests your help and also he thanks your support.

** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Ismael es una persona muy tenaz y optimistas, después de haber dejado el alcoholismo hace ya más de 16 años, Ismael prometió que jamás volvería a regresar a las adicciones y quiere demostrar a su familia que es una persona útil y muy trabajadora. Comenzó su propio negocio hace 15 años y se dedica a la fabricación de piezas de metal, las cuales se utilizan para la producción de figuras de cantera. Ismael ha demostrado su completa recuperación de las adicciones y sigue demostrando su gran amor a la familia.

El requiere de un préstamo de $475 USD. para comprar insumos que le ayudaran a aumentar la producción de piezas metálicas, su trabajo ha aumentado constantemente pero no tiene la capacidad para atender el incremento de su demanda. El quiere seguir demostrando el amor por su familia y por la vida, pide de tu ayuda y agradece tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a person that since he was a boy, worked to help with the family expenses, he started his own business very young, because he had to finance his basic school studies because his family has limited resources. With 45 years old and 3 children, he works so hard every day, Luis wants that his small kids have a better opportunity to study.

Luis requires a loan of $475 USD to purchase raw material, because his job consists on buy - sale of seeds like frijol, corn, chickpea, sorghum, etc. He is going to repay the loan in a term of 6 to 12 months. Luis and their children need your help.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Luis es una persona que desde niño trabajaba para ayudar en los gastos de la familia, inicio su propio negocio muy joven, esto con el motivo de financiar sus estudios básicos ya que su familia es de recursos limitados. Con 45 años de edad y 3 hijos por los que todos los días trabaja muy duro, Luis desea que sus pequeños tengan una mejor oportunidad para estudiar.

Luis requiere de un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar materia prima, ya que su trabajo consiste en la compra - venta de semillas como fríjol, maíz, garbanzo, sorgo, etc. Se compromete a apagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Luis y sus hijos requieren de tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuelita has 3 very young sons; they are studying and in their free time help in the family business. Manuelita every day has to work to support in the family expenses. Their husband is a tractor driver and 5 years ago he had an accident that took him out from his job a lot of time, He receives a salary that reaches only for the home basic necessities, for that reason, Manuelita started her own business since more than 4 years ago, selling car spare parts, her business is growing up but now she needs your support.

She is requesting for a loan of $925 USD to purchase more spare parts and continues to sell them. Now she has a small warehouse where keeps her product, from that way, she has a bigger variety of car spare parts to increase her sales. In a term of 6 months Manuelita wants to return the loan.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Manuelita tiene 3 hijos muy jóvenes, ellos se encuentran estudiando y en sus ratos libres ayudan a su mama al negocio familiar. Manuelita todos los días tiene que trabajar para ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Su esposo trabaja con conductor de tractores y hace 5 años tuvo un accidente que le impidió trabajar mucho tiempo, el señor recibe un sueldo que solamente alcanza para las necesidades básicas en el hogar, por esa razón Manuelita empezó su propio negocio hace ya más de 4 años, vendiendo refacciones para auto, su negocio va creciendo pero ahora necesita de tu apoyo.

Ella requiere de un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar más refacciones y continuar vendiendo. Ahora tiene una pequeña bodega donde almacena su producto y esto le permite tener una mayor variedad de refacciones y aumentar sus ventas. En un plazo de 6 meses Manuelita desea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.en:
Mauricio lives in Pedro Escobedo Queretaro, with 20 years old, he is married and has a small son who loves with all his heart. Mauricio worked as employee from a Car Wash and learned that working and making good decisions are the success to be better every day. For this reason and for the love to his family, Mauricio offered the services from Car Wash to different companies and he had great success. Now he has a small place for his particular cars wash and his wife is the female leader. He has 4 employees and plans to improve their small business.

He requires a loan of $475 USD. To purchase car washed materials, Mauricio says that the new material will help to save time in his business, and also makes easy, simple and faster the job to his employees. For that reason, they will be increase the washed cars quantity. Mauricio and his beautiful family thank your support.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Mauricio vive en Pedro Escobedo Querétaro, con 20 años D. edad esta casado y tiene un pequeño hijo al que ama con todo su corazón. Mauricio trabajo como empleado D. un lavado D. automóviles y aprendió que el trabajo y la disciplina es el éxito para ser mejor cada día. Por esta razón y por el amor a su familia, Mauricio ofreció los servicios D. lavado D. autos a diferentes empresas y tuvo gran éxito. Ahora tiene un pequeño local para el lavado D. autos particulares y su esposa es la supervisora. Tiene 4 trabajadores y tiene planes para mejorar su pequeño negocio.

El requiere D. un préstamo D. $475 USD. para la compra D. equipo D. auto lavado, Mauricio dice que este nuevo equipo ayudara a ahorrar tiempo en el lavado D. un carro, además D. facilitar el trabajo a sus empleados. D. esta manera podrán aumentar la cantidad D. autos lavados. Mauricio y su hermosa familia agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase car washed materials

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 30 years old; he has 2 children, 7 and 3 years old respectively. Oscar is a very lovely person with his family and he works very hard to give them the best from his self. When he was a boy, he was related with the area of freight and transporting because his father was working in this business. When the smallest of his children was born, Oscar knew that his children will need a good education and a better quality of life, so, he started his own business with an old truck that his father gave him. With 8 years working in his own business, Oscar has just an old truck that provides to his family food, clothes and education.

Oscar requires a loan of $475 USD. to maintenance his unique truck; he works daily with the old tuck and proved the necessary thing to his family. In a term of 6 months, Oscar wants to return the loan. He and his family thank your generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Oscar tiene 30 años de edad, padre de 3 pequeñitos, 7 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Oscar es una persona muy entregada a su familia y trabaja muy duro para darles lo mejor de si mismo. Desde niño se relaciono con el ramo de fletes y acarreos debido a que su papa también tenía el mismo oficio. Cuando nació el más pequeño de sus hijos, Oscar sabia que tenía que proporcionales una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida, inició su negocio con un viejo camión que su papa le regalo. Con 8 años trabajando su propio negocio, Oscar tiene solo un viejo camión que proporciona a su familia alimento, ropa y educación.

Oscar requiere un préstamo de $475 USD. para el mantenimiento de su único camión, con el que trabaja diariamente y provee lo necesario a su familia. En un plazo de 6 meses, Oscar desea devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 6 meses. El y su familia agradecen tu generosidad.

loans.use: Maintenance his unique truck

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo is working in a small tacos sales business, he is 44 years of age and he is married, Arnulfo is a very hard-working person. He has two young boys, who help in the family business in their free time. He worked as worker in a private company, and then he was fired and with his retirement pay he started his small business, the main idea was from his wife because her family knows all about the food sales.

Arnulfo is requesting for a loan of $475 USD. To purchase of raw materials as tortillas, oil, meat and more for the elaboration of his delicious tacos, which have had too much acceptance and every day his demand increases. In a term of 6 months he wants to repay the loan. He and his beautiful family require your help and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Arnulfo se dedica a vender “Tacos”, con 44 años de edad y casado, Don Arnulfo es una persona tenaz y muy trabajadora. Tiene dos jóvenes los cuales ayudan en el negocio familiar en su tiempo libre. El trabajaba como obrero en una empresa privada, fue despedido y con lo de su retiro inició su pequeño negocio, la idea la tuvo su esposa porque su familia esta muy relacionada con la venta de comidas.

Don Arnulfo y su familia requieren un préstamo de $475 USD. para comprar materia prima como tortilla, aceite, carne y mucho más para la elaboración de sus exquisitos tacos, los cuales han tenido mucha aceptación y cada vez aumenta la demanda de don Arnulfo. En un término de 6 meses el desea devolver el préstamo. El y su hermosa familia requieren de tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials as tortillas, oil and meat.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a responsible, optimist and very hard-working woman; she is widow and has 4 children. She started her business when her husband was no with them, she knew that her children would need an education, support and food. Her house is in a commercial area where there are a lot people traffic, for that reason she bought some school articles and offer them out of her house to the people, she saw a great success and bought more school articles; having a better demand. Ruth began her new business and now her children collaborate with her when she needs.

Ruth is requesting for a loan of $925 USD to purchase school articles and sell them in her small business. She and her family hope this Christmas season her sales will increase more than another season. They require of your support and they thank your understanding.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Ruth es una mujer responsable, optimista y muy trabajadora, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos. Ella inicio su negocio al sentir que su esposo ya no estaba con la familia, sabía que sus hijos necesitarían de una educación, sustento y comida. Su casa esta en un área comercial donde transita mucha gente, por lo que a Ruth se le ocurrió comprar algunos artículos escolares y ofrecerlos afuera de su casa a la gente que pasaba, ella vio una gran respuesta por parte de las personas y compro mas útiles escolares; teniendo un mayor éxito. Ruth empezó su nuevo negocio y ahora sus hijos colaboran cuando se necesita.

Ruth y sus hijos requieren un préstamo de $925 USD para la compra de artículos escolares y poderlos vender en su negocio. Ella y su familia esperan que esta temporada navideña las ventas de Ruth se incrementen al doble. Ellos requieren de tu apoyo y agradecen tu comprensión.

loans.use: Purchase school articles

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 45 years old, he has 3 very young children and they are studying. His family is the most important thing in his life, for that reason, every day he works very hard to offer them an education and a home. Alberto wants to build a house where his children can live, at the moment his family lives in a very small room and their resources are limited. He and his family live in Pedro Escobedo Querétaro and together with his wife; they work to cover their family expenses. Alberto was born in Acapulco Guerrero and he started his small business selling special sea food like fish and shellfish.

He requires a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise, as fresh fish, shellfish and shrimp. Alberto and his family require of your help to continue working and continue building their house. In a term of 6 months Alberto plans to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Alberto tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos muy jóvenes y se encuentran estudiando. Su familia es lo más importante en su vida, por lo que todos los días trabaja muy duro para ofrecerles una educación y un hogar. Alberto quiere construir una casa donde sus hijos puedan vivir, actualmente vive toda su familia en un cuarto muy pequeño y sus recursos son muy limitados. El y su familia viven en Pedro Escobedo Querétaro y junto con su esposa, trabajan para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Alberto nació en Acapulco Guerrero e inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo platillos de la costa, como los son los mariscos.

El requiere un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar insumos, como pescado fresco, mariscos y camarón. Alberto y su familia requieren de tu ayuda para seguir trabajando y continuar construyendo su casa. En un término de 6 meses Alberto planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, as fresh fish, shellfish and shrimp.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has three children and they at the moment are studying their basic and university studies; he lives in Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Since he was younger, Samuel has worked to commercialization of leather products (sale of belts, wallets and buckles). In 1994, one of his clients made a fraud to him and that is the way how he felt the necessity to get a job and somebody gives him an opportunity to acquire a space in a small market in his town, he used his own capital obtained with sales of his own articles of his home.

After many years of efforts and with support of his wife and children, Samuel has been to maintain his business. For that reason, he has been working to give them and cover their necessities, like a quality education to his children. To make grow up his business Samuel needs a loan of $475 USD in order to increase his sales in this Christmas season. Help him to grow up in his business and continue sustaining his lovely family and be a successful man.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Samuel M. Barón, es padre de tres hijos, quienes actualmente realizan sus estudios básicos y universitarios, él vive en Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro. Desde su juventud Samuel se ha dedicado a la comercialización de productos de piel (venta de cinturones, carteras y hebillas) . Pero fue en 1994, después de un desfalco que le provocó uno de sus principales clientes, cuando sobrevino la necesidad y le brindan la oportunidad de adquirir un espacio en el tianguis de la localidad, capitalizándose con la venta de pertenencias propias de su hogar.

Después de años de esfuerzo y con el apoyo de su esposa e hijos, Samuel a logrado mantener su negocio y de ésta manera ha podido dar todo lo necesario a su familia, y una educación de calidad para sus hijos. Para poder hacer crecer su negocio Samuel necesita un crédito de $475 DLLS y así poder incrementar sus ventas en la época navideña que se aproxima. Ayúdalo a crecer en su negiocio y continuar sosteniendo su familia.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: María

texts.en:
In Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, Maria lives with three sons. Ten years ago her husband died, before this situation, she needed to make something to do to take cares her sons. With her brother’s help and her effort, she started a small barbecue cart, so she could pay her family expenses and and be stronger to the widowhood that she was living.

The strength and the necessity prevented something happened to Maria, thinking about the terrible situation that she was living; Maria stood up and fought from his sons and her. A woman as she needs your support. She requires a loan of $475 USD, it will allow her a bigger access to merchandise for the elaboration of her product, because, she wants increase her sales. You can Support her!!

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

En la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, vive María, madre de tres hijos. Hace diez años enfrentó la difícil muerte de sus esposo, ante ésta situación ella tenía que hacer algo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, con la ayuda de sus hermanos y con mucho esfuerzo María Guadalupe emprendió un pequeño puesto de barbacoa, de esta forma pudo mantener a sus hijos y enfrentar la viudez que estaba viviendo.

La fortaleza y la necesidad impidieron que Maria Guadalupe se derrumbara, y pesar de la terrible situación por la que atravesaba, se puso de pie y luchó por sus hijos y por ella misma. Una mujer como ella merece y necesita tu apoyo, ella requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS, mismo que le permitirá un mayor acceso a mercancía para la elaboración de sus producto y así poder incrementar sus ventas. Apóyala!!

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the elaboration of her products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Rosalina M. is married, 41 years old, a native of Chimonhama district of Magude, and has 3 stepchildren. She met her husband, who is a fisherman, 8 years ago, and according to her, he started his work in 1976, worked with a motor boat, and that point, the volume of capture was satisfactory and he was able to pay the expenses resulting from the business.

The partnership with the Microfinance Institution started out of the need to change the wooden boat for a fiberglass boat that would be more appropriate for getting a higher volume of fish.

So, with the money he had, he approached the Institution to get help for the amount still needed to be able to move forward with his project.

Maria does not have training in managing credit, and her level of schooling is low, having completed basic education. Up to now, she has made 2 loan requests. The loan request made is of 20,000 meticais for the acquisition of an engine with greater capacity in order to travel further to where the level of production (capture) is quite high.

The activity developed is extremely important since, on the one hand, it helps populations with seafood as an alternative in their diet, and on the other hand, it contributes to the reduction of unemployment rates. She currently employs more than eight (8) permanent workers and an additional five (5) seasonal workers.

The product resulting from the capture is sold to consumers and resellers from Catembe and the City of Maputo.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro Chali-Catembe→Maputo-Moçambique Cliente: Maria Rosalina M. Sector de actividade: Pesca Valor de empréstimo: 20,000.00MTN (769.00 US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de motor de barco Início: 14/11/2006 Fim: 13/11/2007 Maria Rosalina M., é casada maritalmente tem 41 anos de idade, natural de Chimonhama distrito de Magude e tem 3 enteados. Conheceu o seu marido que é pescador a 8 anos e segundo ela este iniciara sua actividade em 1976 e trabalhava com barco a motor e nessa altura o trabalho e o nível de captura era satisfatório e conseguia pagar as despesas decorrentes da actividade.

A parceria com a Instituição microfinanceira inicia da necessidade de mudar o barco de madeira e comprar outro de fibra mais ajustado a realidade por forma a conseguir mais rendimentos de pesca. Assim, com parte do dinheiro que tinha aproximou-se da Instituição para ter auxílio do valor em falta por forma a dar cobro ao seu projecto.

Ela não tem formação em gestão de crédito e o nível de escolarização é baixo tendo concluido o nível básico, até ao dado momento fez 2 pedidos de empréstimo.

O pedido de empréstimo que fê-lo é de 20,000.00MTN para aquisição dum motor com maior capacidade por forma chegar a milhas mais distantes onde o nível de produção(captura) é bastante elevado. A actividade desenvolvida por esta é de extrema importância pois por um lado ajuda as populações com mariscos como alternativa na dieta alimentar e por outro contribuir na redução dos índices de desemprego. Emprega actualmente mais de oito (8) trabalhadores efectivos e outros cinco (5) sazonais.

O produto resultado da captura vende-o aos consumidores e revendedeiras da Catembe e Cidade de Maputo.

loans.use: Buying boat motor

loans.name: Joane

texts.en:
Joana Luis M., age 48, native of the District of Manhiça, a province of Maputo, did not have the opportunity to study during her childhood. After she met her husband, she came to live in the neighborhood of Guachene in the Municipal District of Catembe. They had six children.

She never had any training in terms of business management, and only attended the first year of elementary school.

Before starting her fishing activity, she worked with the sale of seafood for two years, buying from the fishermen and reselling in Catembe and the city of Maputo. Her husband worked at the Cigarette Factory and when the company closed, he received severance pay. With the money, he bought a boat and 5 heads of cattle, and having arranged a second wife, he went to live in a neighboring area with his new wife. Joana was then living only with her youngest child.

With the boat, she started to develop the fishing activity, having created two (2) jobs but it was difficult to get money together for the replacement of fishing nets and repair of the boat itself. Through some people in her area, she found out about HLUVUKU-ADSEMA and went there to request financing of 12,000.00 meticais for the purchase of fishing materials (nets and other consumables), which improved the work and production conditions to some extent. With the credit paid off in seven months, rather than the sixteen months that were anticipated, she currently has a 5 meter boat. To expand, through this financing, she would like to increase production and create three (3) more jobs through the purchase of nets and painting the boat. She personally sells some of the fish in Catembe at a stand she acquired for that purpose, and the other part she sells to resellers. In addition to having generated jobs, her activity has a greater impact on providing seafood to improve the diet in her community (Catembe) and generates indirect jobs for the resellers who buy her fish and resell in the city of Maputo.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro Guachene Catembe, Maputo, Moçambique Cliente: Joana Luis M. Sector de Actividade: Pesca Valor de Empréstimo :16.385,00 Mtn (630.00 US$) Aplicação do montante de Empréstimo: Compra de materiais de pesca e reparação de barco Início: 13/11/2006 Fim: 12/11/2007

Joana Luis M., de 48 anos de idade, natural do Distrito de Manhiça, província do Maputo, durante a sua infáncia não teve possebilidade de estudar depois que se juntou com seu marido, veio morar no bairro de guachene no Distrito municipal da Catembe. tiveram seis filhos. Ela nunca teve nenhuma formação em matéria de gestão de negócios, estando a frequentar o primeiro ano de Alfabetização. Antes de iniciar a actividade pesqueira, dedicava-se à venda de mariscos a dois anos, comprava nos pescadores e revendia na catembe e na cidade do Maputo. Seu marido, trabalhava na Fábrica de Cigarros tendo a Empresa fechado, foi indenimizado e com o dinheiro comprou um barco e 5 cabeças de Gado Bovino tendo aranjado a segunda Esposa, passou a viver num outro bairro vizinho com a nova esposa. Ela passou a viver só com o filho mais novo. Já com barco começou desenvolver a actividade pesqueira tendo criado dois (2) postos de trabalho mas, era difícil juntar dinheiro para a reposição de redes de pesca e reparação da própria Embarcação. Através de algumas pessoas da zona ficou a saber da existência da HLUVUKU -ADSEMA tendo lá se dirigido para solicitar um financiamento de 12.000,00Mtn para compra de materiais de pesca ( redes e outros consumíveis ) o que dum certo modo veio a melhorar as condiçoês de trabalho e da produção tendo pago o crédito em sete meses contra os dezasseis que estavam previstos, actualmente possui um barco de 5 metros de comprimento e, para imprimir maior dinâmica, através deste financiamento deseja aumentar a produção e criar mais três (3) postos de trabalho através de compra de redes e pintura de barco. Uma parte do pescado vende pessoalmente na catembe numa barraca que adiquiriu para o efeito e outra parte vende para as revendedoras. Além de ter gerado postos de trabalho, a sua actividade tem um maior impacto por fornecer marríscos para o melhoramento da dieta alimentar na sua comunidade(Catembe) e gera postos de trabalhos indirectos para as revendedeiras que compram o seu pescado e revendem na cidade de maputo.

loans.use: Buying nets and motor boat repairing

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge João C., born in the Matutuine district, age 29, is married and is responsible for 2 people. He is a bookkeeper, having completed the basic level. His desire to overcome obstacles in life started 2 years ago, when his grandfather lost his life and left a mini-grocery without anyone to look after it. Jorge felt responsible for continuing his grandfather's work, and so he approached HLUVUKU-ADSEMA in order to obtain financing, since at that point, there was not enough capital to run the business and supply it with a range of products.

The loan request of 27,000 meticais will enable the purchase of basic products for sale in the outskirts of the community of Chali in the municipal district of Catembe. This community with 1,200 inhabitants has only this small store to supply basic goods.

This small business enterprise is of the utmost importance, because it reduces the distances that people travel (over 5 km) to buy various products.

Through this enterprise, three jobs have been created, including Jorge's own job.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro Chali, Catembe – Maputo - Moçambique Cliente: Jorge João C. Sector de actividade: Comércio Valor de empréstimo:27,000.00MTN (1,039.00 US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de produtos da 1ª necessidade Início: 13/11/2006 Fim: 06/05/2008 Jorge João C., nascido no distrito de Matutuíne a 29 anos, é casado e tem sob sua responsabilidade 2 pessoas, é técnico de contas tendo concluido o nível básico. A vontade de superar os obstáculos da vida começa á 2 anos quando o seu avô perde a vida e deixara uma mini mercearia sem ninguém para cuidar e ele viu-se na obrigação de dar continuidade ao trabalho e é nisto que aproxima-se da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA por forma a obter financiamento, pois nessa altura não tinha capital suficiente para potenciar ainda mais o negócio e apetrechar com uma gama de produtos. O pedido de empréstimo de 27.000,00MTN servirão para a compra de produtos da 1ª necessidade para venda nos arredores da comunidade de Chali no distrito municipal de Catembe. Esta comunidade com 1,200 habitantes apenas dispõe desta pequena loja para abastecimento em produtos da 1ª necessidade. Este pequeno empreendimento de negócio reveste de capital importância porque reduz as distâncias que as populações percorriam (mais de 5Km) para a compra de produtos diversos. Através deste empreendimento criou três postos de trabalho efectivos, incluindo o próprio proponente.

loans.use: Selling Food

loans.name: Vieira

texts.en:
Vieira José Manuel A., age 30, native of Marracune, province of Maputo, grew up under the care of his grandparents. The family's financial situation created few opportunities for him to study. Since the year 2000, he has taken on the management of the family business completely and has a commercial establishment. Since 2003, through referrals by friends and neighbors, he learned of Hluvuku-Adsema, and approached them to request a loan to expand his business.

Since then, his work has become much more active, and he has requested various other loans. Currently, his business is going at a good pace, and it provides a job to 3 workers (two women and one man). With the income from the business, he meets his family's needs, and school expenses, since he has enrolled them in a private school.

With a loan of 40,900 meticais, he plans to increase the volume of the business in order to prevent problems during the holiday season, since the demand has been greater, but on the other hand, he will bring in 2 (two) more people in order to be able to respond to the customer demand.

His work has a greater impact on the community because, in addition to providing a job for himself plus four other people, he brings goods closer to the customers, particularly for the nearly 1,700 students of the neighboring school for whom he provides snacks.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Guachene, Catembe, Maputo, Moçambique Cliente: Vieira José Manuel A. Sector de Actividade: Comércio Valor de Empréstimo: 40.930,00 Mtn (1,574.00 US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Inicio: 13/11/2006 Fim: 12/11/2007 Vieira José Manuel A. de 30 anos de idade, natural de Marracune, província de Maputo, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos avos, a situação financeira da família lhe criou poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde o ano 2000 vem assumindo na íntegra a gestão do negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial. A partir do ano 2003, por indicação de amigos e vizinhos teve conhecimento da existência Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo se aproximado e solicitado um empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio Desde então, a sua actividade conheceu outra dinâmica tendo solicitado vários outros empréstimo. Actualmente o seu negocio está num bom ritmo e providencia emprego a 3 trabalhadores (duas mulheres e um homem), com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, as despesas escolares uma vez que matriculou –se numa escola privada.

Com o empréstimo de 40.900,00 mtn, pretende aumentar o volume do negocio de forma a evitar ruptura durante quadra festiva pois a procura tem sido maior, por outro lado irá admitir mais 2(duas) pessoas de forma a responder positivamente com as exigência dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para além de providenciar emprego para ele próprio mais outras quatro pessoas, coloca o produto mais perto do cliente, com particular destaque para cerca dos 1,700 alunos da escola vizinha que lhes providencia lanches.

loans.use: Selling Food

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine A. is 44 years old and a trained patient medicine dealer in a suburb of Edo State, Nigeria. She request for the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sales

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Mrs. Isoken I. a 26 years trained hairdresser. She believes in self-reliance and optimists that her business will expand to the extent of employing workers to help her manage it. She is anxiously waiting for the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more driers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: According to Mrs. Mary Erhunmwunse, she started this business 14 years ago and her family has benefited a lot from it. Although she is 50 years old, her business acumen paves way for her. She is interested in the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen A. a 49 years old woman, full of life to carry out her business activities all days through. As a result, she maintains her 100% repayment of LAPO loan. Helen is in need of the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy Chickens and Turkeys in large quantity

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: A young dynamic Mrs. Edna I. speaks with zealousness when talking about the impact of LAPO loan on her business. According to her, ‘money is business’ she knew this from the changes she had when she got her first loan from LAPO. She disclosed her desired to have the above amount for her business.

loans.use: To purchase deep freezer, Beverages and Drinks

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Miss. Isoken O.’s interest for beauty, motivated her to venture into hair beauty business. She had three (3) years hair dressing training in a reputable Beauty Saloon institute in Nigeria. She is eager to expand her business. As a result she need the sum of $400.

loans.use: To buy more hair driers

loans.name: Filipe

texts.en:
Felipe, age 26, married and father of 2 children, is a native of Boane. He describes life as a challenge but also full of opportunities. He had to interrupt his studies due to financial circumstances and, like others, he was born to a poor family. He was obligated to go work for a craftsperson at age 8, where he acquired work experience and cultivated the entrepreneurial spirit, despite not having any training in business. From his monthly income, he managed to save an amount that helped him build a mini-store with conventional goods and start his own business. His wife is manager of the business and both work to survive. After some time, he heard of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, approached it and requested a loan in the amount of 10 thousand meticais (US$250) to expand his business which, as he tells it, performs well for him. With the income, he has been able to obtain land to build his own house. At this time, he lives in a room loaned to him and he plans to live a dignified life with his wife (his family). He says that he plans, at this time, to expand the business to be able to employ 2 more people, along with himself and his wife, to be able to improve service to customers and increase the family income for a good education of their children, as well as to help other family members. The same business benefits a population of around 3500 women in Boane who used to have to travel 30 km to the city of Maputo for hairdressing.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro 2, Boane,Maputo,Mozambique Cliente: Filipe Bernardo M. Sector de Actividade: Serviços – Salão de Cabelereiro Valor de Empréstimo: 30.000,00MTN (1,155.00 US$) Aplicação do Montante do Empréstimo: Compra e venda de produtos de beleza Início: 13/11/2006 Fim: 12/11/2007 Felipe, de 26 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos e natural de boane. Narra que a vida é um desafio mas também cheio de oportunidades.
