Teve que interromper os estudos devido a condição financeira e tal como outros nasceu de uma família pobre, viu se obrigado a trabalhar para um artesão a 8 anos passados onde adquiriu experiências do trabalho e cultivou o espírito empreendedor, apesar de não possuir uma formação sobre negócios. Dos rendimentos mensais conseguiu poupar um valor que lhe ajudou construir um mini estabelecimento de material convencional e iniciar o seu próprio negócio. A esposa é gestora do negócio e ambos trabalham para a sobrevivência. E, passado algum tempo, ouviu falar se da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, aproximou da mesma solicitou um empréstimo no valor de 10 mil (250 US$) mtn para ampliar o seu negócio que, segundo conta, lhe dá bons rendimentos dos quais conseguiu adquirir um terreno para construção de uma vivenda própria. Neste momento vive num quarto cedido e pretende levar uma vida digna com a sua esposa (família constituída). Diz que pretende, neste momento, ampliar o negócio para poder empregar mais 2 pessoas para junto com ele e esposa melhorarem o atendimento dos clientes e aumentar os rendimentos da familia para uma boa educação dos filhos, assim como ajudar os familiares do primeiro. O mesmo negócio beneficia uma população de cerca de 3.500 mulheres de boane que antes tinham de percorrer 30 Kms até a cidade de Maputo para o tratamento do cabelo.

loans.use: Buying salon products

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Mrs. Eunice O., a 52 years old dynamic client of LAPO. She has proved her worth of experience in her line of business. She is maintaining her repayment schedule with LAPO without fail. She needs this money ($500) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: Sales of Clothes

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: To her, LAPO caused a break through in her life and family. She discovered that borrowing from a reliable source and making good use of it, is very profitable. As a 40 years old woman, I know what it is to get money when one is desperately in need of it to expand a business. I will appreciate if I can have access to the above amount through anyone.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: I am 50 years old says                Mrs. Modupe E..  Because of my deep love for children, I decided to invest in children’s clothes ten year ago. I need $400 to support my business.

loans.use: To buy more baby wears for sale

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
What else do I have to say than to say bravo to LAPO for supporting my business before now, says Mrs. Blessing A.. a 40 years old woman.

Hear more from Blessing: Initially I was afraid to borrow money but LAPO made it interesting for me to borrow. I need the above amount for my business expansion.

loans.use: To buy drums of cooking oil

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Miss. Rachael O., a 22 years old woman had 4 years training in sales of shoes and bags. She started her own business in 2003. She requests for $400 to boast her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags and shoes for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: I changed to this business six (6) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. Though I am 61 years old; my numerous customers always give me satisfactions, says Mrs. Esther I.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and drinks for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Mrs. Ruth O., a 35 years old woman sells food item to people in her environment in Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promise to effectively use the above amount to expand he business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safe guide my capital to ensure continuity in business.  All these are words of Mrs. Rosemary E.. She is requesting for $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: Sales of foodstuffs

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: A 56 years old, Mrs. Ruth I. is a specialist in sales of fruits and rice, a business she started thirteen (13) year ago. She is eager to expand her business with $500.

loans.use: To buy fruits and Rice for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Miss. Esther Asis is 23 years old. A hairdresser by profession and an optimistic young girl. She desires to see her business expand tremendously. As a result, she request for the above amount.

loans.use: To buy driers for dressing hair

loans.name: Osatohanmwen

texts.en: Mrs. Osatohanmwen U. is married with children. She sells beverages to people in her environment. She needs $500 to boost her business in order to meet her customer’s demands.

loans.use: To buy more beverages for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Miss. Juliet I. is 30 years old. She loves her profession so well that she is always at the services of her customers. She needs $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing material

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Mrs. Gladys E. is a 39 years old woman who specializes on sales of food items to people in her environment. She desires her five (5) years old business to expand tremendously. She is greatly in need of $400 to expand her business

loans.use: To buy foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Mr. C. has a dried meat sales business. He buys the meat in Monterey, Nuevo Leon. He provides it to small resturants and shops. He uses a van to conduct business in the region. \"I learned this business from my father when I was young. I still have the same business he started 35 years ago. I want to increase sales but lack merchandise that my customers want. For this reason, I need a loan of $1400. I plan to buy merchandise and repair my truck that is beginning to fail as I have used a great deal. I am convinced that this will help me continue in this business that helped my father and allows me to support my entire family. I think i will pay this loan back in 12 months.

Loan Use: Buy Supplies Español

El Sr. C. tiene un negocio de venta de carne seca empaquetada que compra en Monterrey, Nuevo. León. Y surte a pequeños restaurantes y abarrotes. Se desplaza en una Camioneta tipo Van y recorre los comercios de la región. “Este negocio lo aprendí de mi padre, él me enseñó desde niño como ser comerciante y ahora tengo a mi cargo el negocio que él inició hace 35 años. Quisiera aumentar mis ventas, pero me falta mercancías que me solicitan mis clientes, por lo que estoy necesitando un crédito de 1,400 dólares y planeo utilizarlos en comprar mercancías y en reparar mi camioneta que empieza a fallar por tanto uso que le he dado. Estoy convencido que este impulso me ayudará a seguir adelante en esta actividad que he realizado desde que le ayudaba a mi padre y a la vez me permitirá seguir apoyando a toda mi familia, pienso pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia O. is 40 years old, married with four (4) children. An industrious woman who uses every available opportunity to enhance her business. She is need of $500 for her business.

loans.use: To buy beverages for sale

loans.name: Sousa

texts.en:
Mr. Sousa, who was demobilized from the war, is a native of a province in the north of Mozambique. He was brought into the ranks of the armed forces when very young and was sent to the province of Maputo in the south of the country. He spent his whole youth in military service and was discharged in 1994. He is married and father of one daughter. He tells uf the difficulties he has faced in life due to life in the military, as well as in civilian life, since he had to begin to learn to live and feed his family completely on his own. He says it was hard to live for the first years after the army, until in 2001, he started working as a tailor, a profession he learned before his compulsory military service. He has his stand at the Market in the village of Boane, made from improvised material, where he makes school uniforms and other articles. He currently has two (2) permanent workers, including himself.

With this loan, he plans to buy cloth of various kinds and acquire another sewing machine with other technical specifications, and contract another worker to be able to meet the customer demand, the majority of which is for uniforms for school and for churches.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro 4, Boane,Maputo,Mozambique Nome do cliente Sousa Manuel Joao Sector de actividade: Alfataria Valor de empréstimo: 9.000,00mtn ( 346 USD) Aplicação do empréstimo: Confecção de roupa e uniforme escolar (compra de tecidos e máquina de costura) Data de início: 13/11/2006 Duração: 12 meses Sr. Sousa, é um desmobilizado de guerra, natural da província mais a norte de Moçambique e diz que incorporou nas fileiras das forças armadas ainda muito jovem e tendo sido afecto na província de Maputo no sul do pais. Passou toda a sua juventude no serviço militar e tendo passado a disponibilidade no ano de 1994. é casado e pai de uma filha.

Diz ter enfrentado várias dificuldades na vida tanto na vida militar assim como na vida civil porque tinha que começar aprender a viver e alimentar a família a custo próprio do seu esforço. Diz foi difícil viver os primeiros anos pós tropa até que no ano de 2001 iniciou a actividade de corte e costura, profissão que aprendeu antes de ao serviço militar obrigatório, e tem a sua banca no Mercado da vila de boane feito de material improvisado onde confecciona uniforme escolar e outros artigos. Actualmente Conta dois (2) trabalhadores efectivos contando com ele próprio.

Com este empréstimo pretende comprar tecidos de vários tipos e adquirir mais uma máquina de costura com outras especificações técnicas e contratar outro trabalhador para poder responder a demanda de clientes que na sua maioria solicitam uniformes tanto para escola assim como para igrejas.

loans.use: To buy tailor machine

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Mrs. Sandra O. a young woman of 25 years old. A dynamic client of LAPO who specializes in cooking delicious food for people in her environment. She bent on improving her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe has worked in her grocery store for 10 years, to help her husband with their houshold expenses. As her partner is much older than she, he cannot share in the labor.

\"Because my husband stopped working due to his old age, I decided to start my own business. This has allowed us to sustain a basic level of living for 10 years. Nevertheless, as times passes, needs increase, illnesses are more frequent, and this places us under higher medical bills.

Because of this, I would like to expand my business, expand my clientel and supply my business with more merchandise, to offer better service with higher return. To do this, it is fundamental that I obtain a loan for $1,500.00 dollars, which will help greatly to resolve our basic necesities. I this I will repay the loan in 12 months.

Español

La Sra. Guadalupe tiene 10 años dedicándose al negocio de abarrotes, cuya finalidad es apoyar en todo a su esposo en los gastos de ambos. Como su compañero es una persona de edad avanzada, no puede desempeñar una labor. “Desde que mi esposo dejó de trabajar debido a su edad avanzada decidí iniciar mi propio negocio. Esto nos permitió durante 10 años tener el sustento básico para vivir. Sin embargo a medida que pasa el tiempo las necesidades aumentan, las enfermedades son más frecuentes, y esto supone mayor gasto de medicamentos. Por esta razón, quisiera aumentar mi negocio, ampliar mi local y surtirla con más mercancía, para brindar un mejor servicio con mayor rendimiento. Para lograrlo, es fundamental obtener un apoyo de 1,500 dólares, que ayudaría en gran manera a resolver nuestras necesidades básicas. Pienso pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy more merchandise and repair my commercial location.

loans.name: Ezelina

texts.en:
Ezelina is a young, 29-year-old mother, married with 4 children, who was born like many others into a poor family. She did not have the opportunity to go beyond 7th grade in school. At age 17, she became pregnant for the first time by a boyfriend who did not want to take on the responsibility, and so Ezelina stayed in her parents' home. It was another start to difficulties in life and, as she tells it, she saw a world full of uncertainties. A few months later, she asked her father for support in the amount of 100 meticais (US$4) to start a business to be able to support the child she was eagerly expecting. At that point, business was not going well (yet another frustration) and she chose to look for a job at kiosks and, with the typical problems of a first pregnancy, she couldn't handle the work hours and had to return to the business that she had been doing. Conscious of the first failure, she contacted a group of women to hear about their experiences with the use of credit and to learn to save.

She currently has a business that performs well and operates in a precarious mini-store and plans to remodel as soon as she obtains a refrigerator to expand the business with a range of products.

She plans to enroll her older child in a secondary school, continue to bring a varied selection of essential products close to her customers and improve the conditions of the mini-establishment. This business is the only source of income for a family made up of six (6) people.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Gueguegue, Boane,Maputo,Mozambique Nome do cliente Ezelina cochissana B. Sector de actividade: Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 30.000,00mtn ( 1.155 USD) Aplicação do empréstimo: Construçao de mini loja com material convencional e compra de um congelador Data de início: 17/11/2006 Duração: 14 meses Ezelina é uma mãe jovem de 29 anos de idade, casada e com 4 filhos, que nasceu tal como as outras de uma família pobre. Não teve possibilidades de ir para além da 7 classe na escola. Aos 17 anos contraiu a primeira gravidez de um namorado que não quis assumir a responsabilidade, assim sendo, Ezelina permaneceu em casa dos pais e era mais um princípio de dificuldades na vida e, segundo conta, via um mundo cheio de incertezas. Poucos meses depois, solicitou ao pai um apoio no valor de 100,00mtn ( 4, usd) para iniciar um negocio para poder sustentar o filho que esperava com ansiedade. Nesse momento o negócio não correu bem ( foi mais uma frustração) e optou por pedir emprego em quiosques e, associado aos problemas típicos de uma primeira gravidez, a carga horária não conseguiu suportar tendo voltado aos negócios que fazia. Ciente do primeiro fracasso, contatou um grupo de mulheres para receber experiências sobre o uso de crédito e aprendeu a fazer a poupança.

Neste momento tem o negócio com bons rendimentos e opera num mini estabelecimento precário e pretende remodelar assim como adquirir um congelador para ampliar o negócio e produtos diversos. Pretende inscrever o filho mais velho num colégio, continuar a colocar variados produtos de primeira necessidade perto dos seus clientes e melhorar as condições do mini estabelecimento. Este negócio constitui a única fonte de rendimento para uma familia constituida por seis (6) pessoas.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator and products

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is from Oaxaca, in 2004 he arrived to Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, with his wife and children; he was looking a better opportunity and a better quality life. In the same year, Sergio saw the opportunity, as an entrepreneur to start a meat sale business, His experience like a military cooker made him learn so much. He found to finance his activity, while the family\\\'s support has been indispensable, because his wife and children help in the business.

Sergio achieves his objectives, offering a better quality of life to his family and an indispensable education to his children. He requires a loan of $475 USD to invest in meat purchase and increase his sales the next season. You can be part of his objectives, help him and his family to maintain the small business. They are going to appreciate your generosity.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Sergio es oaxaqueño, en el 2004 llega a la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, con su esposa e hijos, en busca de mejores oportunidades y de una mejor calidad de vida. Es en este mismo año, cuando Sergio ve la oportunidad de emprender un negocio de venta de barbacoa, su experiencia como militar encargado de cocina lo respaldaban. El encontró en el micro crédito la opción para financiar su actividad, mientras que el apoyo de su familia ha sido indispensable, pues su esposa e hijos son ayudantes activos en su negocio.

Sergio ha logrado su objetivo, brindándoles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y una indispensable educación a sus hijos. El requiere de un préstamo de $475 USD para invertir en la compra de carne e incrementar sus ventas. Sé parte de los logros de Sergio y su familia, ayúdalos a mantener lo que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha construido.

loans.use: Invest in meat purchase

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina lives in Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, she is a mother of two babies of one and three years old. Her husband is a worker with a small salary; he does not reach to cover all the family expenses. Karina has been worried to support her husband and babies, so, she began to save money with many sacrifices and with part of the family expenses, she started to invest in handmade jewelry to sell them between her family and friends, she obtained an excellent sales success. She continuous her small business and she has been to increase her family incomes and represents a big support to her husband.

To be an entrepreneur person is one of the main characteristics of Karina; she is looking to reach her goals and offer a better quality of life to her family. You can help Karina. She requires a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise and to improve her sales. She and her family thank your support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

En Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, vive la Sra. Karina, madre de dos pequeños de uno y tres años de edad. Su esposo es obrero y con su pequeño sueldo, no alcanza a cubrir con todas la necesidades de la familia. Karina preocupada por apoyar a su esposo y por el futuro de sus hijos comenzó a ahorrar con muchos sacrificios, con la parte del gasto familiar que su esposo le daba, comenzó a invertirlo en la compra de joyería artesanal para venderla entre algunos familiares y amigos, obtuvo una excelente respuesta. Ella continua con su pequeño negocio y ha logrado aumentar los ingresos familiares y representar un enorme apoyo para su esposo.

Ser una persona emprendedora es una de las principales características de Karina, quien ahora continúa con sus metas para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Tú puedes ayudar a Karina. Ella requiere un préstamo de $475 USD para la compra de mercancía y mejorar sus ventas. Ella y su familia agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and to improve her sales

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo lives in Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro; with 3 children and his wife, Alrnulfo works hard every day to cover his family expenses. He is a very lovely father and says that when he sees his children playing is one of the most beautiful satisfactions in his life. Since he was a kid, he worked as assistant of a carpentry, later he worked in a company, but his salary did not revenue to cover the education of his children, for that reason, Arnulfo decided to start his own business. With 6 years of experience, he has demonstrated to have capacity to manage his business and make it grow up.

He needs a loan of $475 USD to give credit to his clients without troubles of work capital and produce on his maximum capacity. Arnulfo and his family need your help to his business grows and they thank your love for them.

** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

Arnulfo vive en Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro; con 3 hijos de familia además de su esposa, Alrnulfo trabaja todos los días para cubrir los gastos familiares. El es una persona muy entregada a la familia, dice que el ver jugar a sus niños, es una de las satisfacciones más bonitas en su vida. Desde niño era ayudante de una carpintería, después trabajo en una empresa, pero su sueldo no alcanzaba a cubrir la educación de sus hijos, por lo que Arnulfo decidió emprender su propio negocio. Con 6 años de experiencia, ha demostrado tener capacidad para manejar su negocio y crecer.

El necesita un préstamo de $475 USD para poderle brindar crédito a sus clientes sin la necesidad de descapitalizarse y seguir produciendo a su máxima capacidad. Arnulfo y su familia necesitan de tu ayuda para que su negocio crezca y agradecen tu cariño.

loans.use: Give credit to his clients

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is father of 2 beautiful babys and together with his wife, they have a beautiful family. They live in Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro and Jose works in the party’s entertainer business, which started around 5 years ago. He began very young as a pastime, but this business, offer to him the opportunity to acquire his own capital and increase the number of his clients. At the moment Jose can covers his family expenses and the education of his children.

He needs a loan of $475 USD to purchase new audio and additions articles to make his business grow. In a term of 6 months Jose plans to return the loan and he requests for your help to continue covering his family expenses and over all, his small children receive an education. They appreciate your affection that you demonstrate for them.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

José es papa de 2 bebes muy hermosos y junto con su esposa, forman una hermosa familia. Viven en Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro y José trabaja en la amenización de fiestas, el cual empezó desde hace 5 años. Inició muy joven como un pasa tiempo, pero esto le fue dando la oportunidad de adquirir su propio capital y aumentar el número de sus clientes. Actualmente José cubre los gastos familiares por medio de este trabajo y la educación de sus hijos.

El necesita de un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar nuevo equipo y hacer crecer su negoció. En un plazo de 6 meses José planea retornar el préstamo y pide de tu ayuda para seguir sacando adelante a su familia y que sus pequeños hijos reciban una educación. Agradecen el cariño que tienes por ellos.

loans.use: Purchase new audio and additions articles

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Mr S. has had his business for 13 years, where he makes doors, windows and other home accessories. He also installs what he fabricates, and employs others as well. His business has become a point of support for other families as well.

My clients prefer me to other businesses because of my motivation to do jobs of the highest quality at low cost. I would like my workshop to offer a more complete service to my customers, but my welding equipment has grown outdated with the years. I need a loan for $1,500 dollars to buy metallurgy tools and equipment(to cut metal), also a much larger welder. This will allow my business to grow and to employ more people.

Loan Use: To purchase metallurgy equipment and tools

El Sr. S. tiene 13 años con un taller donde fabrica puertas, ventanas y muchos otros accesorios para viviendas. Como también instala lo que fabrica, les da empleo a otras personas más. Con lo que ha sido una fuente de apoyo para otras familias. “Mis clientes me prefieren porque me esfuerzo por hacer trabajos de calidad y a un bajo costo. Quisiera que mi taller ofreciera un servicio más completo a mis clientes, pero mi equipo de soldar se ha acabado con el paso de los años. Necesito de un crédito de 1,500 dólares para comprar herramientas y equipo para cortar metal, así como una maquina para soldar más grande. Esto me permitirá hacer crecer mi negocio y dar empleo a más personas”

loans.use: Comprar equipo y herramienta para cortar metal

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina has in her house a business of groceries. It has been her only source of income for 7 years. The business has grown and need more space. She is asking for a loan of $1.200, 00 dollars to make bigger her store, because they are sharing half of his house for the business; she and her family will obtain more privacy and can give better attention to her clients. \"My husband works in a factory but it is not enough, I support him with the in the expenses of the house. I would like to repay in 12 months.

Español

La Sra. Cristina tiene en su casa un negocio de abarrotes; es su única fuente de ingresos desde hace 7 años. Su negocio ha crecido y necesita ampliar su casa para dedicar un espacio más grande y específico a su negocio Ella solicita $1,200.00 dlls pues es muy incomodo para ellos el vivir en su domicilio ya que están ocupando la mitad de su casa para el negocio; logrará más privacidad en su familia y mejor atención a sus clientes. “Mi esposo trabaja en una fábrica pero no es suficiente, yo apoyo en los gastos de la casa”

loans.use: Tener un cuarto especificamente para su negocio

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs A. works in her own business in her home; she uses a living room as a stationery store since there is a school very close to her home.

She has been a widow for 7 years and decided to open her business because she has three children: \"Fortunately, with my earning from the stationery store, I can support my children and their education, and I believe this is the most important thing.\"

Mrs A. needs a loan for $1,100 dollars in order to improve the condition of her business and to also sell basic school items, school books, and some groceries, she says, \"In the near future, I want to open an Internet Cafe, where the students can so their homework.\"

Loan Use: To improve the condition of her business and to buy merchandise.

La Sra. A. cuenta con su propio negocio en su domicilio; el cual acondicionó en el área de la sala como papelería ya que está una escuela muy cerca de su casa. Hace 7 años quedó viuda y decidió poner este negocio pues tiene tres hijos: “Afortunadamente con las ganancias de la papelería he podido sostener los gastos de ellos y de su educación, que creo es lo más importante” La Sra. A. requiere apoyo $1,100 dlls. para acondicionar su local para vender además de artículos escolares básicos, libros escolares y venta de abarrotes, ella dice: “En un futuro próximo quiero establecer un -Internet Café- para que los estudiantes realicen sus tareas”

loans.use: Para acondicionar su negocio y compra de mercancia.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.en:
Mrs M. is a mother and her children are all of school age, because of which she started her business selling covers, bedsheets and new clothing, five years ago.

\"When I began to notice that my husband did not earn enough to pay for my childrens\' education, I decided to undertake opening this business with the small savings we had. Now I have many clients; they order comforters and I buy them for a good price. Now that winter is approaching, my sales could be more if I had more merchandise. For this, I need a loan for $1,400 dollars in order to buy enough winter clothing and bed-sheets to sell to my customers. I am sure that my business will grow and that I will be able to better afford the costs of my childrens\' education.\"

Loan Use: To buy winter clothing and blankets to sell.

La Sra. M. es madre de familia y sus hijos están todos en edad escolar, por lo que inició hace 5 años un negocio de venta de cobertores, sobrecamas, y ropa nueva. “Cuando empecé a notar que lo que ganaba mi esposo no era suficiente para pagar la educación de mis hijos, decidí emprender este negocio con un pequeño ahorro que teníamos. Ya tengo muchos clientes; me encargan los cobertores y los compro por mayoreo a buen precio. Como ya se acerca el invierno mis ventas podrían ser mayores si tuviera más mercancía. Por lo que necesito apoyo de un crédito de 1,400 dlls. para comprar ropa de invierno y suficientes cobijas para vender a mis clientes. Estoy segura de que mi negocio crecerá y podré costear mejor los gastos de educación de mis hijos.”

loans.use: Comprar ropa de invierno y cobijas para vender.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda lives in Pedro Escobedo, Queretaro, she is mother of two children. Many years ago she had a difficult divorce and she got her children and the familiar expenses alone. She needed to do something to confront the situation, Yolanda decided, together with a friend, begin a restaurant. However, in the little time, her partner left her with all the responsibility. She found support in micro-credits that she was looking for. Since 7 years ago she started her own business, and she has been to cover all the familiar expenses, with the support of her daughters, Yolanda try to give them studies and cover all their expenses, still without her husband.

Yolanda has demonstrated to have a capacity to confront all difficult situations and two of her mains qualities are dexterity and the enthusiasm. She needs a loan of $925 DLLS, to purchase merchandise as fresh food to increase her sales in her restaurant. In a term of 6 months she wants to return the loan, you can contribute to her small restaurant can grow up. Supporting her!!!!!

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Yolanda vive en la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, madre de dos hijas. Hace algunos años que afrentó un difícil divorcio y se quedó a cargo totalmente de la manutención de sus dos pequeñas. Para hacer frente a la situación, Yolanda decidió, junto con una conocida, poner un restaurante. Sin embargo, al poco tiempo, su socia le dejó toda la responsabilidad y es entonces cuando Yolanda encuentra en los micro créditos el financiamiento que estaba buscando. Ya son casi 7 años desde que inició, y ha logrado mantenerse con el apoyo de sus hijas, quienes gracias a la lucha y entrega de su madre han logrado crecer y salir adelante, aún sin su padre.

Yolanda ha demostrado ser capaz de enfrentar situaciones difíciles, por lo que dos de sus principales cualidades es destreza y el entusiasmo. Ella ahora necesita un préstamo de $925 DLLS, de esta forma podrá incrementar sus ventas y por ende el ingreso familiar. Contribuye a su crecimiento, comparte sus logros, apoyándola!!!!!

loans.use: Purchase merchandise as fresh food

loans.name: José Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Martinez has already 9 years working as a technician in refrigeration and air conditioner. Mainly he repairs the air conditioner of the cars and the electrical system. Mr. Martinez takes care of his son, his wife died recently; although his son helps him but just a little time because he studies. Mr. Martinez is asking for a loan of 2,000.dllrs to buy compressing equipment and a computer for fuel codes injection. \"It will help me to give service to all type of vehicle and I will have more clients”. My main objective is to support my son on college because he wants to be Automotive Engineer, like I sometime wanted it to be.

Español

El Sr. M. tiene ya 9 años prestando sus servicios como técnico en refrigeración y aire acondicionado. Principalmente repara aires acondicionados de autos y el sistema eléctrico. El Sr. M. quedó viudo hace poco tiempo teniendo a su cargo un hijo; aunque su hijo le ayuda por poco tiempo pues estudia. El solicita un crédito de 2.000 dlls. Para comprar un equipo de compresora y una computadora para códigos de fuel injection. “Me ayudará para dar servicio a toda clase de vehículos y así tendré más clientes. Mi principal objetivo es lograr que mi hijo sea un profesionista, quiere ser Ingeniero Automotriz, como yo alguna vez lo quise ser”

loans.use: Un equipo de compresora y una computadora para codigos de fuel injection.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Mr Vergar is a hard working person and head of the household. He began his iron-working workshop 6 years ago and has seen his business grow with time.

\"I have always believed that with true willingness to work, you can improve your station in life. In my workshop, I decorate doors, windows, handrails and many other items from metal. This workshop offers services in my community and contributes to home construction projects. I want to enlargen my workshop in order to supply my existing contracts and to work for others as well, but I lack the machinery and welding equipment, as well as prime materials. I am asking for a loan of $1, 500 dollars to buy the equipment and material that will allow me to grow and to raise my earnings.

Loan Use: To purchase machinery, equipment and prime materials.

El Sr. V. es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con su familia. Desde hace 6 años instaló un taller de herrería y ha visto como su negocio crece con el paso del tiempo. “Siempre he creído que con verdaderas ganas de trabajar puedes salir adelante. En mi taller elaboro puertas, ventanas, barandales, y muchos otros artículos de forja de metal. Este taller brinda un servicio a mi comunidad ya que contribuyo a proyectos de construcción de viviendas. Deseo que mi taller sea más grande para abastecer los pedidos que me hacen y para dar trabajo a otras personas, pero me falta maquinaria y equipo para soldar, así como materia prima. Solicito un crédito de 1,500 dólares para obtener tanto el equipo como el material que me permitan crecer y aumentar mis ganancias.”

loans.use: Maquinaria, equipo y materia prima

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Mrs. Petra has a business of sale of soda, purefied water and groceries. She is asking for a loan 1.200dlls to buy more merchandise in her small little store and to make it bigger because at the present time is inside her house, and she would like to separate her business and her house and the have more privacy. Also there is a school very close to her business and she want to sell school supplies that why she is asking for a loan. she lives with his husband, who also work in her business; he is a construction worker and has 70 years old. \"My business is our main source of income.\"

Español

La Sra. Petra tiene su negocio de venta de refrescos y agua destilada cuenta también con algo de abarrotes; solicita un préstamo de 1.200dlls.para surtir su pequeña tiendita y acondicionar su local ya que lo tiene en parte de su casa. Tiene muy cerca una escuela por lo que quiere vender útiles escolares; vive con su esposo el cual trabaja también eventualmente; pues es una persona de 70 años como albañil “Mi negocio es nuestra principal fuente de ingresos”

loans.use: Venta de abarrotes y ampliar el negocio

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Mrs. G. has 20 years of experience in the grocery store sector. She sells cans of food , dairy products and bread. This business was initiated for her parents at this time she is single and she take care of her parents they are older. \"My store is the only source of income, and I would like a loan to grow my business. I would like to buy a freezer for the chicken sale and to acquire shelves to place the merchandise\" I ´m Asking for a loan of 1.500.00 dlls and I will payback in 12 months.

Español

La Sra. G. cuenta ya con la experiencia de más de 20 años en el ramo de la tienda de abarrotes, vende lateria en general, refrescos, leche y pan. Este negocio lo iniciaron sus padres; es soltera y actualmente sus padres están bajo su cuidado; “Mi tienda es la única fuente de ingresos y quisiera un crédito para hacerla crecer, me gustaría comprar un congelador para la venta de pollo y adquirir anaqueles para colocar las mercancías” Solicita apoyo por 1.500.00 dlls. y paga en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: Ventas de abarrotes

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita L. has been in the bread business for 11 years. Her husband also worked in a bread factory for 11 years. When the two got married, they decided to open a small bakery and make fresh bread so that everyone could try their recipe. Felicita operated the business end of things and only a year ago left her job at the factory to start her own venture. However, the Lainezes lack capital to step up production. Running a bakery is perhaps one the most time-consuming businesses because you have to prepare bread for the next day the night before. Felicita and her husband open their doors at 6am every day, but their day starts well before that. This husband and wife team usually sells out by 10am, which is when they take their first break. Then, they start their second shift at 1pm selling bread to the afternoon crowd. By the time they sell out, clean the shop, prepare the dough for the next day, and leave the shop it is 10pm. Felicita does this every day with her partner. Ms. L. needs this loan so she can buy certain raw materials like flour, butter, cooking oil, yeast, raisins, nuts, and jelly for the sweet pastries. Felicita is already financing a refrigerator which she uses to keep milk and juices cold. 

This 26 year-old entrepreneur is married with 2 small children. Together with her husband she has worked hard to grow the business into a profitable enterprise. They currently rent an apartment in Guayaquil and hope that one day they can purchase their own home. The L. family dreams big, and they want to own the most successful bakery in town.

loans.use: Ms. Lainez needs this loan so she can buy certain raw materials like flour, butter, cooking oil, yeast, raisins, nuts, and jelly for the sweet pastries.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy O. sells cosmetics and perfume. She is a certified vendor of Yanbal products, which is a cosmetic line native to Ecuador. She has only been in business for four months, but she has years of experience selling perfumes and such because her mother did the same thing for years. After raising an initial $100 from her personal savings, Daisy she began selling to many of the other young girls whom she goes to college with.

Ms. O. needs this loan so that she can continue to replenish the supply she gets every week and meet the demand of the holiday season. Recently, Daisy started selling intimate women’s clothing which is becoming a hot item at her store. With this loan she intends to buy more shampoos, conditioners, lipsticks, eyeliners, blush, and a wider variety of perfumes.

Daisy is only 21 years old, but she is a hardworking woman who wants to succeed in the world. She is single and lives with her parents who are also small business owners. Their entrepreneurial spirit inspired Daisy to try something out on her own, and although she doesn’t sell Ecuadorian food like her dad or lunch meals like her mother, she plans ahead and invests her money on products that she knows will bring a decent return. Her goal is to become totally self-sufficient, pay for school, and no longer have to depend on her parents for financial support.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Ms. Orrala needs this loan so that she can continue to replenish the supply she gets every week and meet the demand of the holiday season. With this loan she intends to buy more shampoos, conditioners, lipsticks, eyeliners, blush, and a wider variety of perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sufficient stock to enable him  provide mobile agro-vet products supply to  small scale farmers in rural areas.

loans.name: Lúcia

texts.en:
Lúcia is married and the mother of two daughters. She has quite a bit of experience in managing small businesses and the correct use of credit, since she has been doing this since the year 2000. She started to work with credit from another microfinance institution that was operating in the area, and was successful in the business with the help of her husband who is a former soldier. Lúcia tells that before building this mini-store, she sold at another, which was precarious, and with the income she was able to grow the business. The first loan she had with HLUVUKU-ADSEMA was to expand the business.

With this financing, she plans to reinforce the business stock, which is short of meeting the needs of her customers in Bairro 3, in the Boane District, which is 35 km away from the capital of Mozambique, Maputo. This neighborhood is home to a population of 1300 people, the majority demobilized from the war.

She also plans to bring in a worker to help her with sales, since at this time, when she goes to make purchases, she closes the store, which has been very inconvenient for the customers.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro 3, Boane,Maputo,Mozambique Nome do cliente: Lúcia S. Sector de actividade: Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 25.000,00mtn (961.00 US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra e venda de produtos de 1 necessidades Data de início: 17/11/2006 Duração: 16/11/2007 Lúcia, é casada e mãe de duas filhas com bastante experiência em gestão de pequenos negócios e uso correto de crédito desde ano 2000 que vem exercendo a atividade. Começou a trabalhar com crédito de uma outra instituição micro financeira que operava na zona e tendo sido bem sucedida no negócio com ajuda do marido que é pensionista ex.- militar. Lúcia conta que antes de construir este mini estabelecimento, vendia num outro de material precário e com as receitas foi fazendo crescer o negócio. O primeiro empréstimo que teve com a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, foi para ampliar o negócio. Com este financiamento pretende reforçar o stock no negócio que está aquem das necessidades dos seus clientes no bairro 3, Distrito de Boane que dista 35 Kms da cidade de Maputo capital de Moçambique, este bairro alberga uma população de 1,300 pessoas, maioritariamente desmobilizados de guerra. Também pretende admitir uma trabalhadora para auxilar-lhe nas vendas, pois neste momente quando vai as compras encerra o estabelecimento, o que tem sido um grande constragimento para os clientes.

loans.use: To buy food products

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce and supply organic banana seeds to peasant farmers to grow bananas for export.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her business stock by purchasing shoes, lingerie and Soft furnishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy animal feeds and build a shed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eva wants to buy feeds and a build a cow shed

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
Tatiana A. is 36 years old. She is married and has two children - older boy and a girl. Her husband is unemployed and they both breed 5 cows in a farm near Vratza.

For the first years of their marriage Tatiana and her husband live with her parents in the town but because of the fact that they both do not have any special education it is hard for them to find a decent job.

So 3 years ago they decided to start cattle breeding and found their farm. All the milk that they produce is being sold to one of the biggest dairy in the region.

Now they breed 5 cows and want to buy 3 more. That will cost $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy three more cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy feeds for her daily cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy feeds, Insecticides and minerals for her animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would want to buy sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase computers for sell to Schools and computer accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rose wants to buy 50 trays of eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy plastic plates, bowls, cups, spoons and basins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy would like to buy candle wax, petroleum jelly, antiseptics, and a big metal basin for mixing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan wants to buy half-bale of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Millicent wants to buy sacks of maize, sugar, packs of soaps, salt and breads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Specie wants to buy varieties of African attire materials (vitenges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Terry wants to buy sweaters, trousers, shirts, blouses and skirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for sell to small scale at favorable prices.

loans.name: Kiril

texts.en:
Kiril R. is 58 years old man from the very small village Lessicheri, close to Pavlikeni town. He used to work as a director of the only one producing manufacture of carpets in the region, but after the changes in Bulgaria and the followed privatization from two years he is unemployed.

He has a strong experience of the carpet sector, that’s why he took the decision to continue doing this job, but in the private sector. With his own resources he managed to buy a machine for carpet and woolen yam production on very low price, but now to start the real business he needs additional funding of 2 000 USD to buy wool and to start to card it and after that to sell it.

The production of carded wool and carded woolen carpets is very typical for the region of Bulgaria. Starting working as a wool merchant and a producer of woolen carpets he will help his family to survive in this place, they are working in. He has a wife, who is unemployed, а sоn and a granddaughter.

loans.use: To buy wool and to start to  card it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production for sale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel C., 31 years old, a native of the City of Maputo, father of 2 children, is responsible for 4 (four) people. He studied until 9th grade, and had to interrupt his schooling due to financial difficulties. The son of a fisherman, he has longstanding experience in the area of fishing.

He began his fishing activity, using a small boat with oars and a sail, renting, employing two helpers. With loans of (20,000 meticais, 40,000 meticais, 30,000 meticais and 50,000 meticais respectively) at HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, he was able to acquire his own boat and outboard engine, sophisticated nets, and to increase the number of workers to 8 (eight).

He currently has a boat with an operational inboard engine, however it has problems due to the constant breakdown of the engine that began when an accident occurred one day while fishing, which created a crack at the bottom of the boat and caused it to sink, damaging the engine.

With a loan of 50,000 meticais, he plans to buy a new boat engine with 25 HP in order to resume the pace of his activity, which is extremely important for the community, given that it provides jobs for 8 people, as well as for resellers of the fishing product, as well as ensuring a continuous supply in quantity and quality of seafood for the population of Catembe and its surroundings.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Catembe, Maputo, Moçambique Cliente: Manuel C. Sector de actividade: Pesca (compra de motor) Valor de empréstimo: 52.000,00 MTN (2,000 US$) Início: 20/11/2006 Fim: 19/11/2007 Manuel C., jovem de 31 anos de idade, natural da Cidade de Maputo, pai de 2 filhos , tendo 4 (quatro) pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Estudou até 9ª classe e viu-se obrigado a interromper devido a dificuldades financeiras. Filho de um pescador, daí a larga experiência na área de pesca.

Iniciou a sua actividade de pesca, usando uma pequena embarcação a remo e vela, em regime de aluguer, empregando dois ajudantes. Recorrendo aos empréstimos de (20.000,00MTN, 40.000,00MTN 30.000,00MTN e 50.000,00MTN respectivamente) na HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, conseguiu adquirir um barco próprio e um motor fora de bordo, redes sofisticadas e aumentar o numero de trabalhadores para 8(oito).

Actualmente conta com um barco com motor a bordo operacional, embora com dificuldades devido ás constantes avarias do motor que tiveram como origem, o acidente ocorrido numa das jornadas de pesca, o qual criou uma fissura no fundo do barco e que culminou com o afogamento do mesmo e causando danos ao motor.

Com um empréstimo de 50.000,00MTN pretende comprar um novo motor de barco com 25 HP de modo a retomar ao ritmo da sua actividade que é extremamente importante para a comunidade visto garantir emprego para os 8 pessoas, assim como para os revendedores do produto da pesca, para além de garantir o abastecimento contínuo em quantidade e qualidade de mariscos a população de Catembe e arredores.

loans.use: To buy motor boat

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply quality fruits and vegetables to a local hospital.

loans.name: Bernadeta

texts.en: Bernadeta is married and has two children.She lives in Yombo area of Dar es Salaam.Bernadeta sells fried fish near her residence.She collects fresh fish from Indian Ocean shores,spice and fry them ready for sale.She want to make her  business attractive by improving sanitary conditions of her business premises.Te display cage and aluminium wrapping materials will even make her business attractive.This will anable her make more sale and thus more profit.Next year her first born will join secondary school.The increased income will enable her save for school fees.To implement her plan she needs USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en: Furaha lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with five children. Furaha keeps pigs.She supplies pork to various bars within her area.Pork has recently gain popularity in her area.It is used as a snack with beers.The demand has risen abruptly.In order to keep goodwill with her customers Furaha purchases some of the pork from other pig keepers.Furaha plans to increase the size of her pig flock. Pigs need a huge amount of working capital to raise.They demand a sufficient stock of feeds and medications.Furaha also plans to employ one assistant to take charge of the increased stock. To implement her plans she is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: INCREASE THE FLOCK OF PIGS AND WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Nassan

texts.en: Hassan is married and have four children. One of his sons is in Secondary school.  Hassan lives in Buza area of Dar es Salaam.  He runs a fruits and vegetable stall outside his house.  He has been in this business for more than six years now.   Hassan grows vegetable himself and sell them in his stall. Other supplies like fruits and coconuts are bought from wholesellers in nearby markets. In this coming rain season Hassan is worried about insects and other microorganisms attacking vegetable growing. He need a sufficient  stock of  insectisides and a spraying pump.  To facilitate this plan he is in need of USD 400.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Tandika , Temeke District in Dar es Salaam.She is married with four children. The elder daughter is in Secondary. Mariam runs a tailoring  business  in a verandah of her home. The business have not been good recently due to insufficient sewing materials and competition she faces from her neighbours.  She want to improve her business by having enough supply sewing materials and rented business premise. She is currently working on the varandah of her house which does not attract customers and does not provide her enough space. She also need to add two saving machines and one assistant. The strategy requires a capital injection of USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Maulid

texts.en:
Maulid lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children of which two are in primary school other two are in secondary school.
Maulid sells fresh fish in retail. He has to wake up very early in the morning everyday, go to the shores of Indian Ocean and buy fish from fishermen. He  resell these fish in Tandika  market .Maulid want to improve his business by having enough working capital to purchase a large amount of fish.Since the profit  margin for fish selling is thin. He can improve, it by having enough stock of fish . Since fish business is perishable. Maulid is planning to buy some equipments which together with Ice blocks can help keep the fish  fresh until evening.  Ice blocks are bought from Ice suppliers.Maulid is in need of USD 550 to make his plan work.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Mayunga

texts.en: Mayunga is married with three children. He lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He sells  vegetable  and fruits near his residence. He buys fresh produce of fruits and vegetables from nearby villages fro resale at a small profit. The business has been his main source of livelihood for the past six years. The bususiness has not grown because he has to make a balance between business and family needs. The proposed loan will assist Mayunga to expand his business through adding up new products. The amount need to expand his business is US$ 400. If his business is expanded, he will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for his child who is expected to start secondary education. The business provides a source of employment for her wife too

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema lives in Tandika ,Temeke District of Dar es Salaam.She is married with five children.Rehema sells charcoal in a store located in her family house.She has been in this business for eight years now.She is planning to open another store in the next street.The new store demands additional funding.She will need to add more stock of charcoal,pay for rental fees and employ an assistant.The expansion plan will help Rehema generate extra income as she has to pay school fees for her two sons who are in secondary school.Rehema is in need of USD 550 tofacilitate her plan.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: C. is married with three children.He lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.The area is well known for residents engaging themselves in animal keeping.C. sells animal feeds to these animal keepers.He buys by-products of maize,cotton,palm carnels,sunflowers and other cereals and packs them in bags of 5kgs and 10 kgs ready for resale.C. is planning to expand his business by adding to stock some other types of animal feeds.He also need a bicycle of which he will use to ferry  products purchased by his customers to their premises as an after sale service.C. also keeps layers of which his wife is in-charge.He is planning to add the flock of these layers to subsidize his income in order to meet family requirements as well as school fees for his children. To meet his expectation C. is in need of USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is married with four children.She lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.Her two sons are in secondary school.Rosemary is self employed and own a shop near her residence.The shop sells different consumable items.Mainly food items,which have high demand.The shop provides her with an opportunity to raise her children.She would like to expand her business so that she can meet costs of educating her children.The shop employs herself and her sister.To expand her business she needs USD 750.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said lives in Tandika in Temeke District of Dar es Salaam.He is married with four children.Said sells water storage drums of 100 litres to 200 litres.He buys them from Dar es Salaam Port after being emptied the materials they come with.In his area public water supplies are irregular.People uses drums as water storage equipments.Said has recently acquired another store to be used as a selling point.The new store demands more working capital.More drums will be stocked,carriage and storage cost will also increase.Said is in need of USD 950 to open his new store.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda is a divorcee with two twins.  She runs a beauty saloon . She runs a  beauty saloon  business in a busy area of Ilala district  in Dar es Salaam. She has employed one person in her business. In normal business days her saloon is usually flocked with customers. She need to buy  additional equipments in order to meet the needs of her customers. Such equipments are hair driers,steamers and hair dressing materials. Sitting chairs are also needed for customers to sit while in queue.Also she need a generator to facilitate her activities when the public power goes off.The whole country is now facing power rationing. In addition, the loan will help her increase her working capital. To facilitate her plan Sauda is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: PURCHASE OF ADDITIONAL EQUIPMENT AND WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine  lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with five children. She keeps broilers and layers.It is now a sixth year since she started this business.She recently managed to get a tender to supply eggs and chicken meat to various restaurants in Ilala district of Dar es Salaam.From the current business she can not have enough eggs and chicken to supply these restaurants.In order to keep her customers Valentine buys these items from other poultry keepers and resell them to these restaurants,she earns a small margin of profit. She is in need of USD 750 to expand the business to meet the demand from the restaurants.From the loan amount she will add a flock of chickens,expand chicken hut,add more trays and medicines for chickens especially in this rain season.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa has been a seamstress for over 35 years. When she was 13 she began studying at an arts and crafts school where she focused on sewing. Rosa already had her own workshop when she finished school thanks to her mother who provided her first sewing machine. When she got married Rosa took her small business to her new home but soon found work at the school she once attended. Three years ago she chose to restart her business as a part time operation. She has now quit her job and found a new business partner, her daughter.

She is requesting the loan in order to get buy sewing materials (threads, fabric etc.) and boost her production. Rosa is 50 years old and has two daughter’s who are grown up. She hopes that she can be successful in business with her daughter so she may fix up her home which is still only made out of wood.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Zaila

texts.en: Zaila lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam.She is married and has two sons.Zaila is in a food vending business.She has four years in this business.She wants to improve her business by adding dining tables and chairs,food serving dishes and stock of cold drinks.On usual working hours her busines is normally flocked with customers in need of services.Sometimes she looses some customers due to inadequate equipments.She also in need of a cupboard for keeping food serving dishes hygienically.To facilitate her plan Zaila needs USD 400.

loans.use: BUSINESS IMPROVEMENT

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Mr Francisco is the owner of a printing business, and his experience is in the area of 30 years \\\"A lifetime,\\\"says Mr Rodriquez.

He principally prints advertisement copies, business cards, calendars and at this time of year, Christmas cards. His business enables him to support his wife and 3 children. But he his currently faced with a difficult situation. One of his machines is broken and he cannot afford to stop production at this time. Because of this, he needs a loan for $2,000 dollars in order to buy another offset printer. This wil allow him to not delay his orders, to make higher earnings, and to maintain happy clients. But above all, to support his family.

Loan Use:To purchase another offset printer.

El Sr. Francisco es dueño de una imprenta su experiencia en esta área es de 30 años “Toda una vida” comenta el Sr. R.. Principalmente realiza impresiones publicitarias, tarjetas de presentación, calendarios y en esta época lo mas usual las tarjetas navideñas Esta fuente de trabajo le a proporcionado mantener a su esposa y 3 hijos El Esta pasando por una situación difícil. Una de sus maquinas se averió y no podrá sacar su producción en esta temporada. Por lo cual el necesita un préstamo de 2,000 dlls. Para comprar otra máquina impresora offset. Esto le permitirá no quedar mal con sus pedidos, obtener mejores ingresos y tener a sus clientes contentos. Pero sobre todo mantener a su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar otra máquina impresora offset

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.en:
Some years ago Msr. Ramiro had a little money problems because he had debts, for this reason, together with his wife decided to start a business. Thinking about that his wife cooks so good, he was talking to her and they decided to enter in the food sales business, Thinking about the kind of food, they decided working in the elaboration of flour tortillas, which are important part of people\\\'s nourish in the north of Mexico, because daily thousands of families consume them like part of their nutritious diet. Their tortillas had very good acceptance among their clients and every day their demand is increasing.

In these seasons when the cold comes, Ramiro needs support for work capital, to purchase the flour to make Tortillas and cover the increment of his demand this Christmas season; he is requesting for a loan of $600 USD which he wants to return in a term of 5-10 months. He is sure that he is going to satisfy his demand.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Hace algunos años Don Ramiro estaba sumergido en problemas, debido a que tenía deudas, fue por eso que junto con su esposa decidieron iniciar un negocio. Pensando en el buen sazón de su esposa, decidieron enfocarse en un negocio relacionado con el ramo de alimentos, fue así como decidieron dedicarse a la elaboración de tortillas de harina, las cuáles forman parte importante de la alimentación de la gente en el norte de México, ya que diariamente miles de familias las consumen como parte de su dieta alimenticia. Sus tortillas tuvieron muy buena aceptación entre sus clientes desde su inicio, lo que propició que la demanda por ellas fuera en aumento.

En estos momentos en que empieza a refrescar, ya que el clima es mas frío, Don Ramiro necesita apoyo para capital de trabajo, poder comprar la harina que requiere para enfrentar el incremento en la demanda que se presenta en esta próxima temporada, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por $600 USD el cual desea pagar en un plazo de 5-10 meses. Esta seguro que con ello podrá satisfacer la demanda de la temporada.

loans.use: Ramiro needs support for work capital

loans.name: Concepción

texts.en:
Concepcion and Genaro are an active, hard-working and a small enterprise managers couple, both are 48 years old and are married since many years ago. Concepcion and Genaro have a business of Elaboration of hanging pots (filled with candies, fruit, etc.). These are figures elaborated with reed and paper. These are too much demanded because are so popular in Mexican parties, the tradition is that this hanging pot used to put in a cord and people have a good time hitting it until breaking it. Concepcion began her business making paper figures like hobby, then she made the hanging pots to her parties’ children, she knew how she could elaborate them. Concepcion and Genaro were without employment and together they decided to start to making and selling hanging pots.

Now their business is growing and it requires of work capital for the quantity of $475 USD to purchase raw material and cover their demand for their products, because the Christmas Mexican celebrations is approaching and the sales are better than another seasons, for that reason, they are going to return the loan in 4-8 months.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Concepción y Genaro son una pareja de pequeños empresarios muy activos y trabajadores, ambos tienen 48 años y están casados desde hace algunos años. Ambos tienen un negocio de Elaboración de piñatas, estas son figuras elaboradas con carrizo y papel, la mayoría de las veces rellenas de dulces y frutas, que son muy demandadas ya que forma parte de la mayoría de las de las fiestas en México, la tradición es que cuelgan esas figuras en un cordón y la gente se divierte pegándole hasta romperlas y que salgan los dulces que recoge la gente como diversión. Hace tiempo Concepción empezó a realizar figurillas en papel como pasatiempo y después hizo las piñatas de sus hijos, fue ahí que se dio cuenta que podía elaborarlas. Tiempo después, Concepción y Genaro se quedaron sin empleo y esto los orilló a decidirse a iniciar el negocio de elaboración y venta de piñatas y complementos.

Ahora su negocio esta creciendo y requiere de capital de trabajo por la cantidad de $456 USD para poder hacer frente a la demanda por su producto, ya que se avecinan las tradicionales posadas (celebraciones típicas navideñas), época en que se incrementan sus ventas, es por eso que solicita un plazo de 4-8 meses para pagar.

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Gerónima

texts.en:
Mrs Perez has helped her husband for 4 years in their mechanic workshop, she supervises and manages the store when Mr Palacios has left to buy spare parts or to attend to a client outside of the workshop; he has been working for more than 20 years in this business.

\"Hope is the last thing to lose, we are not going to allow ourselves to be vanquished; we had part of the workshop roofed, but the wind has destroyed it, we have many customers because my husband is a good mechanic, it is only for the lack of resources that our business has not grown more, we lack equipment and tools, we are asking for $1, 500 dollars in order to continue to move forward.\"

Loan Use: To purchase equipment and tools.

La Sra. P. ha decidido apoyar desde hace 4 años directamente a su esposo en el taller mecánico, ella supervisa y cuida el taller cuando el Sr. Palacios va a comprar refacciones o a atender a algún cliente fuera del taller; él tiene mas de 20 años en este oficio. “La esperanza es lo ultimo que se pierde, no vamos a darnos por vencidos; teníamos parte de la cubierta del taller, pero el viento la derribo; tenemos muchos clientes ya que mi marido es muy buen mecánico solo que por la falta de recursos no hemos podido crecer nos hace falta equipo y herramienta; solicitamos $1,500 dlls. Para salir adelante.”

loans.use: Para adquirir equipo y herramienta

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
\"For years ago, I decided to turn my pickup truck into a mobile resturant. The city is growing and there are a lot of construction workers that don\'t have a place to eat. I prepare the food in my house and I bring it to their place of work.\" Senor R. asks for $1000 to buy a stove and to paint \"My Mobile Resturant.\" This has been reported by Senor R..

Loan Use: To purchase a stove and to paint \"My Mobile Restaurant

“Hace 4 años decidí convertir mi camioneta en un Restaurante, la ciudad está creciendo y muchos trabajadores de la construcción no tienen donde comer; yo preparo la comida en mi casa y la llevo hasta su lugar de trabajo” El Sr. R. solicita 1,000 dlls. para la compra de una estufa y pintar “Mi Restaurante Móvil” comenta el Sr. R..

loans.use: Para la compra de una estufa y pintar “Mi Restaurante Móvil”

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.en:
Herlinda sells cosmetics and perfume throughout her community. She usually travels door to door offering her products but also sells some from her home. She allows her clients to pay her for their purchases in weekly installments in order to maker her products much more accessible.

She is seeking this loan in order to invest in new merchandise. She hopes that with increased capital she will be able to buy wholesale and sell for much more profit. Herlinda has four kids, three of which are still in school. She hopes that by generating more income she can continue to pay for their educations and make improvements to their home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa A. started her business when she was a part-time student in beauty school. She started off by just selling cosmetics and when she graduated beauty school she opened a salon. She still sells cosmetics door-to-door from 9 AM – 1 PM and she then opens her salon from 2 PM – 8 PM. One of her hottest products is a weight loss supplements for women.

Rosa is seeking the loan in order to invest in complementary products for her business. She has noticed that she can make a great deal of profit from the sales of these products in the morning and also while her salon is open. With the extra money she makes she will continue to invest in her business and she will also invest in her home. She lives with her son in a house that was once made out of wood but has been slowly improving because of her savings and hard work.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in her beauty salon

loans.name: Maryorie

texts.en:
Maryorie owns a general store where she sells household products and toiletries. She began working as a manicurist out of her home and slowly saved up enough money to buy a display case and inventory. Her store is open from 9 in the morning until about 10 PM. The store is operated from the front part of her home, which is convenient because she can work and take care of her two kids at the same time. She is requesting this loan is order to invest in new products and buy in bulk. Her dream is to have her two kids receive a college level education.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new products to sell at her general store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small market and bakery. She started the bakery with the help of her husband who provided the oven and moral support. Later she expanded the business into a market where she sells all types of foods. She starts working at 5:30 a.m. and continues into the late evening. From the money she has made with her bakery she has added cement walls to her home which once were only made of flimsy wood.

She is seeking this loan in order to make her market and bakery larger. She receives a good amount of business and sees the need to expand her operation. She is a mother of three children who uses the majority of her income on her children’s well being.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in complementary products to sell from her bakery/store

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Gomez has been selling flowers and gifts for four years. This is the only source of income for her, her daughter and elderly father. I like my business because I work with people who want to express friendship to others and recipients have a nice smile. During the Christmas season, lots of people give gifts. I want more merchandise to cover flower and gift orders. For this reason, I want a loan of $1,500 to buy merchandise for this Christmas season. This will help me expand my business and generate income my family needs. This is very important because my father can no longer work.

Loan Use: To buy merchandise to sell for Christmas gifts

La Sra. G. tiene 4 años dedicándose a la venta de flores y regalos. Esta es su única fuente de ingresos para ella, su hija y su padre, quien es una persona de mayor edad. “Me gusta mi negocio porque acuden a el personas que desean expresar su amistad a otros llevándoles flores o regalos, por eso recibo a mis clientes con una sonrisa amable. En esta época Navideña en la que muchas personas acostumbran dar regalos, quisiera tener más mercancías a fin de cubrir los pedidos de flores y de regalos. Por ello quisiera un crédito de 1,500 dólares para comprar mercancías para esta temporada Navideña. Esto me permitirá aumentar mi negocio y generar los ingresos que mi familia necesita, en especial mi padre, que ya no puede trabajar.”

loans.use: Comprar mercancias de temporada Navideña para regalos.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of farming inputs in his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing and overlocking machine and more fabric to expand his tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his printing business.

loans.name: Kassandra

texts.en:
Kassandra has had a small diner for over 8 years. She and her husband started off by selling “empanadas” (beef and chicken turnovers) and they progressively grew from there. Kassandra’s husband worked as an electrician and a handy man but is now fully dedicated to the restaurant. He built the grill they use to cook their meats himself and has also made other physical improvements to the location on his own.

They run their operation out of their home and offer a variety of typical Ecuadorian foods including barbecued meats. They are seeking this loan in order to invest in raw ingredients and foods. Kassandra is 27 years old and does not have any children. She aspires to make improvements to her home and the business with the extra profits.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Kassandra wants to make improvements to her small restaurant

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid has a business where she raises and sells chickens. She started off a couple of months ago when her husband gave her $20 to invest in 60 chicks. With another $20 she had in savings she bought the chicken feed and set up her backyard as the raising grounds. The chickens have already been pre-sold to her clients and they will be ready for delivery in early December.

She is looking to take out a second loan in order to invest in 300 more chicks for her operation. She will also need to buy feed and prepare her backyard. Ingrid is a mother of 3 small children. Her husband is a handy man and helped her build the cages for the chicks.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
After being a maid her whole life Beatriz decided to start her own business a year ago. She learned how to make jewelry from a company who sells the materials for the production. Her daughter inspired her to take the course from the company and begin selling the jewelry herself. She now sells to the people in her local community and also to the people in the small town where she grew up.

She is seeking the loan in order to buy more materials and increase production before the Christmas season. This business has allowed Beatriz to be her own boss and provide sufficient income for her livelihood. She has been separated from her husband for 15 years and lives with her daughter.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Materials to make jewelry

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.en:
Rosalba started her first store over ten years ago selling all types of clothing. It was a stable source of income but had to be closed down after five years due to a very unfortunate circumstance. Rosalba’s son was diagnosed with a heart condition that required an operation that cost over $8,000. Rosalba and her husband had to sell their business and their home in order to save their son’s life. She, her husband and her three kids had to move into Rosalba’s mother’s home and they had to restart their business with only $200 in capital.

This has been a very tough experience for Rosalba but she hopes that she can improve her business in order to purchase a new home for her family. Her husband is a factory worker but hopes to one day also run the store with Rosalba. She needs the loan in order to invest in new clothing and improve the appearance of her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new clothes to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto sells and fixes kitchen stoves and other household appliances. He learned the family trade from his father over 25 years ago. He started off with a small stand in the fairs of Guayaquil but now has a larger spot in the markets. His son works with him at the location and his wife sells the products door to door.

He needs the loan in order to buy new and used merchandise. He feels that he can add new products to his business in order to increase sales. With the extra income he plans to improve his home which is now made of wood.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy replacement pieces and new merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional sewing machines and fabric for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a dairy farming business for his jobless wife.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair dressing equipment and materials for her hair saloon business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Purchase a deep Freezer for his dairy shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase kerosene for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy furniture and juice making equipment for his business.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en: The Piaza (outdoor market) in the southern Moldovan city of Cahul is a colorful and lively scene. Among the many vendors working in booths and kiosks is Tatiana, greeting customers with a warm smile and enthusiastic showing of her products. A mother of three and a natural salesperson, she began selling clothing and hats about one and a half years ago and now works with one employee to meet customer demand for the goods she imports from the Ukraine. Her business has been going so well that she wants to expand and open a separate small store on the fringe of the market to capture a new segment of the market. Tatiana has been noticing the recent trend in Moldova of increasing popularity of leather bags and purses, both for men and women, and wants to take advantage by stocking these items. She needs a loan to buy goods and to cover initial operating costs of her new venture.

loans.use: working capital.

loans.name: Svetlana
