texts.en: Many small stores and booths sell household and cosmetic supplies in the center of Cahul, but hardly any stock a full range of high-quality products. When Svetlana opened her store inside a small indoor shopping center, she wanted to stock not only soap and shampoo, but every other product her customers would need, ranging from detergent to brushes and beyond. Her place is bustling with customers and she indeed has a great variety of goods, but she sees potential in adding even more to her product line. She would like a loan to purchase a new line of beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products for her store along with working capitol.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Most Moldovan women love cosmetics and perfume, and those passing by Svetlana’s table in the open-air market are no exception. She began purchasing products from the Ukraine and selling them in her hometown over a year ago and has had loyal customers ever since. She keeps her stand open almost every day, together with friends who help her by staying at her table when she needs to leave, and most of that time a customer or two is also there. Svetlana now needs a loan to buy a bulk shipment of products at a favorable price 

*employee and customer pictured

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and perfume in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Right off of the central road coming into Balti is the number one location to get your car washed! For only 20Lei you can get the works, add an additional 10Lei and you can get your car vacuumed.  Ruslan G. currently employees four workers and receives about 30-40 clients a day. A vast majority of  his clients are regulars and return weekly, many opt for the full package and get their cars vacuumed along with their wash.
Ruslan’s vacuum is old and is in need of replacement. He needs an industrial vacuum, specific chemicals and soaps for his car wash.  

Ruslan is a great entrepreneur always thinking of additional ways to grow his business.  He has additional land around the car wash and wants to open a Russian Baia (Sauna) and possibly a covered pool in the spring.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial vacuum, specific chemicals and soaps for his car wash

loans.name: Ghenadie

texts.en: Walking through the hectic entranceway of the Balti market, you will always see a line outside of Ghenadie C.\'s electronic and cell phone repair store.  His store consists of a little booth, where he and his friend have been working for the last three years. They have established a solid reputation for high quality service in repairing cell phones throughout the city.  His knowledge on the products is vast, and his advice is valued by many local mobile phone users. Ghenadie is asking for a loan to purchase more cell phones and accessories for his store. He hopes that in the future he will be able to save or take out a larger loan to open up a store where he will be able to sell a wider range of products and offer more services.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget O. is 30 years old and a 4 years old dedicated LAPO client. She specializes on sales of clothes and tailoring materials to people in her environment.  She needs the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en: Dimitri I. is 22 years old and has been working for himself as a mechanic for the last 2 years.  After high school he attended a technical school for automobiles for 2 years. When he was 20 years old he borrowed money from his friends and relatives to purchase a spot within a garage. This location consisted of one lift.  He uses his personal tools but sometimes needs to borrow tools from the people who rent the lifts around him to make repairs. Business has been progressing at a steady rate and he would like to expand to another lift to increase his number of clients.

loans.use: To purchase another lift for repairing automobiles.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. a 30 years old started her foodstuffs business 8 years ago. She joined LAPO two years after she started her business with her little saving. According to her LAPO came to rescue her when her business was at the point of collapsing as a result of inadequate running capital. She is eager to get the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a food kiosk business.

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en:
The best translation for a frigarui is a barbeque. It\'s more then just preparing and grilling meats, it\'s the gathering, relaxing and general time away from all your worries or daily life to be with friends and family.   When a Moldovan invites you to a frigaruie it\'s an insult not to attend.  A perfect frigarui will entail drinking lots of home made wine and eating many kinds of BBQ meat. 

When Mihail C. is asked how business is going, he replies \"everyone loves Frigarui!\"  Mihail has been at his central location in the indoor food market for four years now, and everyone knows him for his huge smile and tasty meats.  He would like to take out a loan to increase his available supply of pork for when the holidays begin and people want to have a frigarui.

loans.use: To purchase additional meat for the winter time for re-sale

loans.name: Amélé

texts.en:
Madam Amélé D. was born at Aného in the prefecture of Lacs in 1962, a daughter of a family of sixteen (16) persons. She didn’t succeed to continue her secondary studies after her Primary School Leaving Certificate (PSLC). Very early, she came to live with her aunt, the cereals trader in the market of Hanoukopé. Wanting to follow the way of her aunt, she started to sell tomatoes and peppers. Married for already 18 years, she is a mother of three (03) children. Her husband, taxi motor driver, succeeds rarely to provide for the family needs. Retailer for 27 years, Madam D. has benefited from three respective credits of $300, $650, $850 which she has well repaid without any delay. The credit of $1200 that Madam D. requests will serve to supply in rice -sacks in order to satisfy the customary in those periods of end years feasts and bring out a profit margin liable to contribute to the improvement of family life conditions.

Madame D. Amélé est née dans la préfecture des Lacs à Aného en 1962, fille d’une famille de seize (16) personnes. Elle n’a pas pu continuer ses études secondaires après son certificat du premier cycle. Très tôt, elle est venue habitée avec sa tante commerçante de céréales au marché de Hanoukopé. Voulant suivre le chemin tracé par sa tante, elle a commencé par vendre des tomates et piments. Mariée depuis déjà 18 ans, elle a trois (03) enfants. Son mari, conducteur de taxi moto, arrive rarement à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Revendeuse depuis 27 ans, Madame D. a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits respectifs de $300, $650 et $850 qu’elle avait d’ailleurs bien remboursé sans aucun retard. Le crédit de $1200 que Madame D. sollicite servira à s’approvisionner en sacs de riz afin de satisfaire la clientèle en ses fêtes de fin d’année et de dégager une marge bénéficiaire susceptible de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy whole rice-sacks

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Married and mother of four (04) children, Madam Claire T. is a retailer for 15 years. After her primary studies, she has started the trading with her senior sister. Became married woman in a family where everything is at her charge due to the irresponsibility of her husband who has taken up residence in the night clubs and cabarets, she fights for the well-being of her children. Model and modest, she undertakes a good relation with the children whose future life constitutes her first preoccupation. Very enterprising and having the sense of a good management, she masteries well her commercial activities which provide for her a substantial incomes at the need of her family. Very model, she has always repaid on time her three credits granted. This fourth credit of $850 to be repaid in eight (08) months will allow him to supply in cans and rice -sacks to face the increasing request of the customary on the market in these periods of year-end. This project will allow her to make much profitable her activity for the development of her incomes in view to the improvement of her family living conditions.

Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame T. Claire est revendeuse depuis 15 ans. Après ses études primaires, elle a débuté le commerce avec sa grande sœur. Devenue femme mariée dans une famille où tout est à sa charge à cause de l’irresponsabilité de son mari qui a élu domicile dans les cabarets, elle se bat pour le bien-être de ses enfants. Femme modèle et modeste, elle entretient une bonne ambiance avec les enfants dont leur avenir constitue sa première préoccupation. Très entreprenante et ayant le sens d’une bonne gestion, elle maîtrise bien ses activités commerciales qui lui procurent un revenu substantiel au besoin de sa famille. Très exemplaire, elle a remboursé toujours à temps ses trois crédits obtenus. Ce quatrième crédit de $850 remboursable en huit (08) mois lui permettra de s’approvisionner en bidons d’huile et en sacs de riz pour faire face à la demande croissante de sa clientèle sur le marché en cette période de fin d’année. Ce projet lui permettra de rentabiliser au mieux son activité pour l’augmentation ses revenus en vue de l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy whole rice-sacks and oil can

loans.name: Rabie

texts.en:
Madam Rabie A. was born in 1963 at Danyi Konda in South-West of TOGO. She is married to a driver and is a mother of four (04) children. Her husband was early unemployed obliging thus Madam A. to face alone the family charges with her very derisory financial means. Despite the moral assistance of her unemployed husband and with all the desire of which she used to show the proof, Madam A. does not succeeding to provide for the family needs until the moment where she had benefited from a credit of $550 which she repaid without incident. This credit has allowed him to strengthen her activity and even to rent a shop in the big market of Hédzranawoé within the framework of her trade of foodstuffs. Equipped with a well appreciable attitude and aptitude, Madam A. was very early found as a good manager and very devoted for the success of her trade which she exercising very well. Currently, Madam A. is requesting a credit of $900 to constitute a sufficient storage of foodstuffs (pasta, rice, cans or tins of foods, oil, etc.) to respond to her customary needs for these coming year-end feasts. It goes without saying that this financial contribution would have a very positive impact on the trade profitability and will especially help Madam A. to face more and more her family charges.

Madame A. Rabie est née en 1963 à Danyi-Konda au Sud-Ouest du TOGO. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari s’est vite retrouvé sans emploi obligeant ainsi Madame A. à faire face seule aux charges familiales avec ses moyens financiers très dérisoires. Malgré le soutien moral de son mari chômeur et avec toute la volonté dont elle fait preuve, Madame A. n’arrivait pas à subvenir aux besoins familiaux jusqu’au moment où elle avait bénéficié d’un crédit de $550 qu’elle avait d’ailleurs bien remboursé sans incident. Ce crédit lui a permis de renforcer son activité et même de louer une boutique dans le grand marché de Hédzranawoé dans le cadre de son commerce des produits alimentaires. Dotée d’une attitude et d’une aptitude bien appréciables, Madame A. s’est vite révélée comme une bonne gestionnaire et très dévouée pour la réussite de son commerce qu’elle maîtrise bien. Madame A. demande actuellement un crédit de $900 pour se constituer un stock suffisant de produits alimentaires (pâtes alimentaires, riz, boîtes de conserve, huile, etc. pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle pour cette fêtes de fin d’année. Il va sans dire que cet apport financier aura un impact très positif sur la rentabilité du commerce et surtout aidera Madame A. à faire face davantage aux charges familiales.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (pasta, rice, cans or tins of foods, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Pauline Amélé

texts.en:
Miss Pauline Amélé K. was born in Abidjan this 10th May, 1980. She arrived in Lomé, (Togo) in 1996 after her primary studies. She has opted for the hairdressing apprenticeship after having failed to obtain her O’level diploma of secondary education. Hair dresser mistress for already 06 years, Miss Pauline is single without children but has her mother in dependency. Daughter of a deprived family, she called for a loan of $250 to open her hairdressing salon and equipped. Then she has benefited from 03 loans which have been all well repaid, what allowed her to improve the adjustment of her hairdressing salon and to increase her incomes to provide for her needs and those of her niece. To strengthen he activities at this end -year where almost all the women seek to make herself attractive, Pauline requests this loan of $950 to buy a new hair dresser, locks and beauty products to satisfy the needs of her customary on the one hand, and to draw a profit sensitive to improve her economic and social situation on the other hand.

Mlle K. Amélé Pauline est née à Abidjan le 10 Mai 1980. Elle est arrivée à Lomé au Togo en 1996 après ses études primaires. Elle a opté pour l’apprentissage de la coiffure après son échec au BEPC. Maîtresse de coiffure depuis déjà 6 ans, Mlle Pauline est célibataire sans enfant mais a sa nièce en charge. Fille d’une famille démunie, elle a eu recours à un prêt de $250 pour ouvrir son salon de coiffure mal équipé. Elle a ensuite bénéficié de 2 prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés, ce qui lui a permis d’améliorer l’aménagement de son salon de coiffure et d’augmenter ses revenus pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa nièce. Pour renforcer ses activités en cette fin d’année où presque toutes femmes cherchent à s’embellir, Pauline sollicite ce prêt de $950 pour acheter un nouveau séchoir, des mèches et des produits de beauté pour satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle d’une part, et de tirer un profit susceptible d’améliorer sa situation économique et sociale.

loans.use: to buy a new hair dresser, locks and beauty products

loans.name: François Ségbessi

texts.en:
Mr François Ségbessi A. is a young man of 31 years old, married and father of two (02) children, lack of support to follow his studies, he is quickly entered in the active life by the door-to-door trade to provide for her family needs. He succeeded thereafter to open a kiosk at Tokoin N’kafu from his own funds of $300 and from his first credit of $500 to sell spares for motors. Such commercial activity has taken the scope with the motor taxi transportation development in the town of Lomé. So, to face the growth of his trade, he has benefited from another credit of $850 which was well repaid. Today, he takes the total control of his trade which he manages well. He is requesting a new credit of $1200 to pay the new spares of the new motors from DUBAI and which are the most used for transportation in motor taxi. The perfect implementation of this project will help him to make more profitable his activity in order to increase his incomes to face his children education and as well as the family needs.

Monsieur A. Ségbessi François est un jeune de 31 ans, marié avec deux (02) enfants. Faute de support pour poursuivre ses études, il est rapidement entré dans la vie active par le commerce ambulant pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il est arrivé par la suite à ouvrir un kiosque à Tokoin N’Kafu à partir des ses fonds propres de $300 et de son premier crédit de $500 pour vendre des pièces détachées pour motos. Cette activité commerciale a pris de l’ampleur avec le développement du transport à taxi moto dans la ville de Lomé. Ainsi, pour faire face à la croissance de son commerce, il avait bénéficié d’un autre crédit de $850 qu’il avait très bien remboursé également. Aujourd’hui, il a la maîtrise totale de son commerce qu’il gère très bien. Il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1200 pour payer les pièces de rechange des nouvelles motos venues de DUBAÏ et qui sont les plus utilisées pour le transport en taxi moto. La réalisation parfaite de ce projet lui permettra de rentabiliser au mieux son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus pour faire face à l’éducation de ses enfants et aux besoins de sa famille

loans.use: to pay the new spares of the new motors from DUBAI

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Madam Beauty L., born on September 3, 1961 at Akoumapé in the prefecture of VO, is issued from a numerous and poor family. She is married and mother of one child with two (02) dependants. Her husband, a plumbing master without stable employment, exercises this activity from which he draws very difficultly income to help his wife to face the family expenditures. This Madam L. was launched in the small table trade, then progressively she succeeded to open a shop which she manages very well despite she is illiterate (neither read, nor write). Honest and full of trusty, she repaid promptly her two first credits without incident. She deserves to be backed financially to increase her trade and draw great profit to the family needs. So, this credit of $1000 she is requesting will serve to supply her shop of rice, sugar, milk, soap and other essential produces to resell them in this period of good businesses of end year feasts. This will strengthen the profitability of her activity and will enormously contribute to the family living conditions improvement.

Madame L. Beauty, née le 3 septembre 1961 à Akoumapé dans le Vo, est issue d’une famille nombreuse et très pauvre. Elle est mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant avec 2 personnes à sa charge. Son mari, un maître plombier sans emploi fixe, exerce cette activité dont il tire très difficilement un revenu pour aider sa femme à faire face aux dépenses de la famille. Madame L. s’est lancée alors dans le petit commerce de table, puis progressivement elle est arrivée à ouvrir une boutique qu’elle gère très bien malgré qu’elle soit analphabète (ne sait ni lire, ni écrire). Honnête et pleine de confiance, elle a su rembourser promptement ses deux premiers crédits sans incident. Elle mérite d’être appuyée financièrement pour accroître son commerce et en tirer grand profit aux besoins de famille. Ainsi donc, ce crédit de $ 1000 qu’elle sollicite servira à approvisionner sa boutique de riz, sucre, lait, savon et autres produits de première nécessité pour revendre en cette période de bonnes affaires des fêtes de fin d’année. Ceci renforcera la rentabilité de son activité et de facto, contribuera énormément l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, soap and other essential produces

loans.name: Angélica

texts.en:
Angélica, 33 years old, divorced and mother of 4 children, native of Namaacha (Maputo), grew up with rural parents. She studied through the sixth level and due to her family's circumstances, had to interrupt her studies when she was 17 years old. The following year she got married because she was pregnant. Since her husband went to the Republic of South Africa (South Africa), in search of employment but never came back, and now has another wife, she was compelled to find a way to support herself and her children.

She began to sell goods at a little stand in front of her home, and through conversations with other women, found out that HLUVUKU would grant credit to small business who approached them to benefit from their services. Currently, her business is going at a good pace, and she was able to open another stand to sell used clothes, also employing a young single mother.

And, with the profits from the sales of the used clothes, she has been able to pay the family's living expenses. She says that when there is an illness, she is able to bear the medical expenses for herself and her children.

Her work has a greater impact in the community because, in addition to providing a job for herself, she also employs a single mother and makes quality clothing at good prices available in the community.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro 1, Boane, Maputo - Moçambique Cliente: Angélica T. Sector de actividade: Comércio Montante: 25.000,00mtn (965.00US$) Aplicação: Compra e de fardos de roupa usada Início: 20/11/2006 Período de pagamento: 14 meses

Angélica, de 33 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 4 filhos, natural de Namaacha (Maputo) cresceu sob responsabilidade dos pais camponeses. Estudou até a sexta classe e por falta de condições teve que interromper os estudos quando tinha 17 anos e logo no ano seguinte casou se porque já estava grávida. Desde que o seu marido foi a República da Africa do Sul (R.S.A) a procura de emprego nunca mais voltou, tem outra mulher, viu-se obrigada a fazer algo para o seu auto-sustento e dos seus filhos.

Começou, então, por vender numa pequena banca em frete a sua casa e através de conversas com outras senhoras soube que a HLUVUKU concedia créditos para pequenos negócios tendo se aproximado para se beneficiar dos serviços. Actualmente o seu negócio está num bom ritmo e conseguiu abrir mais uma banca para venda de roupa usada empregando também uma jovem mãe solteira.

E, com os lucros da venda de roupa usada que obtém permiti-lhe pagar as despesas domesticas da família. Afirma que em casos de doença, consegue suportar as despesas médicas para ela e seus filhos.

A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar o emprego para ela, também emprega uma mãe solteira e coloca roupa de qualidade e a bons preços à disposição da comunidade.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Adjovi Epiphanie

texts.en:
Married and without children, but with two (02) dependants, Madam Adjo A., was born on January 2nd, 1978 at Ahépé in the prefecture of Yoto, she is a hair dresser who exercises, beside her hairdressing salon, the beauty products trading. Issued from a numerous family and very poor, she has the mishap to marry an unemployed husband and all the family charges remain on her. However, her husbands, an accountant by trade but jobless, train her in accountancy to allow her to better manage her businesses. From her cleverness and experience, she succeeded to manage and repaid without incident her three first credits. Today, she is requesting a credit of $1000 to acquire a modern hair drier to buy and resell beauty products. She is convinced that this project will strengthen the increasing and profitability of her activities, and will develop her incomes to improve her family living conditions.

Mariée et sans enfant, mais avec deux (02) personnes en charge, Madame A. Adjovi Epiphanie, née le 2 Janvier 1978 à Ahépé dans la préfecture de Yoto, est une coiffeuse qui exerce, à côté de son salon de coiffure, le commerce des produits cosmétiques. Issue d’une famille nombreuse et très pauvre, elle a eu la malchance d’épouser un mari sans emploi et toutes les charges familiales reposent sur elle. Toutefois, son mari, un comptable de formation en chômage, lui donne des cours sur la comptabilité pour lui permettre de mieux gérer ses affaires. De par sa spécialisation et son expérience, elle su gérer et rembourser sans incident ses trois premiers crédits. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $1000 pour acquérir un séchoir moderne et pour acheter des produits cosmétiques. Elle est convaincue que ce projet renforcera la croissance et la rentabilité de ses activités, et augmentera ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to acquire a modern hair drier to buy and resell beauty products

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.en:
Madam Kossiwa D. was born on 28th April 1968 in Lomé, eigth (08) of a family of twelve (12) children, she had to stop her secondary studies after her failure in o’level examinations due to the incapacity of her poor parents to pay the school fees. After few years spent to follow her mother in the market, she has opted for the cloth dressing. Today, married and mother of four (04) children, she manages herself her workshop with difficulties, for lack of financial means despite the support of her husband who does not succeeding himself to make (both) ends meets. Very dynamic and devoted with her experience in the domain for about 20 years, Madam D., has made proof of a trusty woman from her two first credits repaid without incident. She has a mastery of her businesses and deserve to be backed financially in order to allow him to enlarge her workshop and substitute the haberdashery. For that purpose, Madam D. requests a credit of $950 which will serve to enlarge her workshop, to acquire a new sewing machine to buy and resell the articles of haberdashery (buttons, zippers, linings, hairpin, etc.). Surely, this credit will give her a second breathe at the economic plan what would have without doubt positive consequences on her family life and on her children education which she wants by all means.

Madame D. Kossiwa est née le 28 Avril 1968 à Lomé, Huitième (8ème) d’une famille de douze (12) enfants, elle a dut arrêté ses études secondaires après son échec au BEPC à cause de l’incapacité de ces parents pauvres à lui payer les frais de scolarité. Après quelques années passées à suivre sa maman au marché, elle opta pour l’apprentissage de la couture. Aujourd’hui mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle gère elle-même son atelier de couture non sans difficultés, faute de moyens financiers malgré le soutien de son mari qui lui-même n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts. Très dynamisme et dévouée avec son expérience dans le domaine depuis presque 20 ans, Madame D., a fait preuve d’une femme de confiance à partir de ses deux premiers crédits remboursés sans incident. Elle a une maîtrise de ses affaires et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement afin de lui permettre d’agrandir son atelier et en substituer la mercerie. Pour ce faire, Madame D. Kossiwa sollicite un crédit de $950 qui servira à agrandir de son atelier de couture, à acquérir une nouvelle machine à coudre et acheter pour revendre des articles de mercerie (boutons, fils, fermetures, doublures, épingles, etc.). A coup sûr, ce crédit lui donnera un second souffle au plan économique. Ce qui aura sans doute des conséquences positives sur sa vie familiale et sur l’éducation de ses enfants qui lui tient vraiment à cœur.

loans.use: to acquire a new sewing machine, to buy and resell the articles of haberdashery

loans.name: Alex Komlan

texts.en:
Mr Alex Komlan N. is married and father of four (04) children, with two (02) dependants. Welder by trade, he engages in a second activity which is hardware selling in order to provide for his family needs. He has an entrepreneurial mind and has the capacity of small and mid enterprises. He has started his activities with $150 of capital. He is well appreciated and his workshop is well attended due to the quality of his work. As a good manager, he has succeeded in managing and repaying at the maturity date the two respective credits of $300 and $500 granted. For the needs of his services, he requests today $850 to buy a compressor, corrugated iron and bars, etc. This will help him to increase his incomes to better take care of his family.

Monsieur N. Komlan Alex est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Il a deux (02) personnes à sa charge. Soudeur de formation, il exerce une seconde activité qui est la vente de la quincaillerie pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il a un esprit d’entreprenariat, et a une capacité de gestion des petites et moyennes entreprises. Il avait pu démarrer ses activités à partir ses fonds propres de $150. Il est bien aimé et son atelier est très bien fréquenté à cause de la qualité de son travail et de son tempérament. En bon gestionnaire, il a pu gérer et rembourser à l’échéance les deux crédits respectifs de $300 et $500 obtenus. Pour les besoins de son service, il sollicite aujourd’hui $850 pour acheter un compresseur, des tôles, des barres de fer, etc. lui permettant de fabriquer des portes, des grilles métalliques, des moules, etc. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour mieux s’occuper des besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, corrugated iron and bars

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
Madam Ablavi T. is married and mother of three (03) children and one dependant. She was living with her senior sister who was exercising the toothpick selling of which she got the taste. This trade, which exercises today with love and proud, helps her somehow to provide for her needs and to bring a touch to her husband efforts for the household expenditures. She is at her fourth credit of which she has succeeded to well managed and repaid promptly. She is a woman of trusty who deserves to be backed financially. Currently, with this credit of $650 requesting, she will go and buy the toothpicks in whole in Ghana and resell them to retailers at place. She could also expand her activities to small trade of essential products (soap, milk, sugar, etc.). This will allow her to increase her incomes to provide for the family needs.

Madame T. Ablavi est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants en plus d’une personne à sa charge. Elle était restée chez sa grande sœur qui faisait ce commerce de vente de cure dent dont elle a eu le goût. Ce commerce qu’elle exerce aujourd’hui avec amour et fierté, lui permet tant que mal de subvenir à ses besoins et d’apporter un coup de main à son mari pour les dépenses du ménage. Elle est à son quatrième crédit dont elle a su bien gérer et rembourser avec promptitude. Elle est une femme de confiance qui mérite d’être soutenue financièrement. Actuellement, avec ce crédit de $650 sollicité, elle ira acheter les cures dent en gros au Ghana pour les revendre aux détaillants sur place. Elle pourra étendre également ses activités au petit commerce de première nécessité (savon, lait, sucre, etc.). Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour subvenir au besoin de la famille.

loans.use: To buy the toothpicks in whole in Ghana

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Madam Yawa V. was born toward 1970 at Fidokpui in the canton of Toglé. She is married and mother of five (05) children and has another dependant. She is living at Fidokpui with all her family where she has as main activity the planting and selling of vegetables (Adémé, Gboma, and okro) the only source of income of the family. This garden market product is becoming more and more difficult to find otherwise impossible already from the month of November where starts the dry season and water became very rare. During that period, life in this couple became pitiful. The husband does not have any other job than the small subsistence agriculture and leave almost all the family charge between the hands of the woman. Although she is illiterate, Madam V. has always showed the proof of a rigorous management and good morality. That is a lot noticed in her first three credits obtained which were repaid without incident. Today, she is requesting a credit of $850 to buy a motor-pump in order to mastery the water and to continue to progress in her activities especially those of the counter season (dry season). This project will be very profitable, not only for her alone, but for the other women of her locality.

Madame V. Yawa née vers 1970 à Fidokpui dans le canton de Togblé. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants et a un autre enfant à sa charge. Elle vit à Fidokpui avec toute sa famille où elle a comme activité principale la culture et la vente de légumes (Adémé, Gboma, et Gombo) seule source de revenu de la famille. Cette culture maraîchère devient difficile sinon impossible déjà à partir du mois de Novembre où commence la saison sèche et l’eau de vient très rare. Au cours de cette période, la vie dans ce foyer devient plus pitoyable. Le mari n’a pas autre emploi que la petite agriculture de subsistance et laisse presque toute la charge du foyer entre les mains de la femme. Bien qu’analphabète, Madame V. Yawa a toujours fait preuve d’une gestion rigoureuse et d’une bonne moralité. Cela s’est beaucoup ressenti dans ses trois premiers obtenus et remboursés sans incident. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $ 850 pour s’acheter une moto pompe afin de maîtriser l’eau et de pouvoir évoluer dans ses activités surtout de contre saison. Ce projet sera très bénéfique, non seulement pour elle seule, mais à d’autres femmes de sa localité.

loans.use: to buy a motor-pump and fertilizers

loans.name: Jeannette Abla

texts.en:
Madam Jeannette Abla A.,a widower remarried to a benevolent teacher without salary for six months, Madam A. is about 40 years old. All the charges of the family are let on her. She is living at Alinka, a village of the canton of Togblé where she has as main activity, the peppers planting. She has at her dependence her two (02) orphans plus the two (02) others children of the new husband and the husband himself. Her senior daughter of the level of form 4 become house girl for lack of support and the second a boy is actually at home with the level of form 2 due also to the lack of support. She does only living from that activity which could bring her back if she has benefited from a more consistent financial support. Very courageous and despite her very misery situation, she has the respect of the other’s property and has succeeded to manage clearly her first credit of $850 without incident. Though she is illiterate, she has always showed the proof of her serious and rigour in her management. She is requesting a credit of $850 to buy a motor-pump in order to be in the safety of the climate ups and downs to enlarge her cultivable surface for a greater production. Backing Madam A., is not only a support to her economic activities, but and especially a humanitarian gesture as the incomes draw from that activity will serve to provide for the needs of those orphans children.

Madame A. Abla Jeannette, veuve remariée à un enseignant volontaire sans salaires depuis six mois, Madame A. a environ 40 ans d’âge. Toute la charge de la famille repose sur elle. Elle vit à Alinka, un village du canton de Togblé où elle a comme activité principale, la culture des piments. Elle a à sa charge ses deux (02) orphelins plus des deux (02) autres du nouveau mari et le mari lui-même. Sa fille aînée de niveau classe de 3ème est devenue domestique faute de soutien et le second, garçon est aujourd’hui à la maison avec le niveau 5ème faute de support également. Elle ne vit que cette activité qui pourrait lui rapporter si elle avait bénéficié d’un appui financier plus consistant. Très courageuse et malgré sa situation de misère très criarde, elle a le respect des biens d’autrui et a su gérer sainement son premier crédit de $350 sans incident. Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a toujours fait preuve de son sérieux et de sa rigueur dans sa gestion Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’acheter une moto pompe afin de se mettre à l’abris des aléas climatiques et d’agrandir sa surface cultivable pour une production plus grande. Soutenir Madame A. Abla Jeannette, est non seulement un soutien à ses activités économiques, mais et surtout un geste humanitaire, car les revenus tirés de cette activités serviront à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins.

loans.use: to buy a motor-pump and fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 40 years old, native of Boane, province of Maputo, lives with her second husband, and has six (6) children, five (5) from a previous marriage and one (1) from the current marriage. She didn't have the opportunity to study because it was not important to her parents at that point.

She got married very early and, by necessity, with the help of her ex-husband, she started her business in 1986 in a precarious construction shack at the edge of the road that ran by her home. She gained experience as the years went by, and today, she has been able to build a stall out of conventional materials.

Through some women friends, she found out about HLUVUKU-ADSEMA and approached them and requested a loan to expand her business.

Her activity has seen growth, in terms of volume of business and customers, since she diversified the products that existed before she obtained the loan. She confirmed that with the profits, she supports her family's living expenses and the expenses for her developmentally disabled child who frequently needs medical assistance.

Her work has a greater impact on the community because, in addition to self-employment, it also provides a job for her daughter, as well as bring diverse food products near to her clientele, reducing the time and cost of travel that women in her community had before she brought this service to the community.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro 3, Boane, Maputo - Mozambique Cliente: Maria de Fátima João V. Sector de actividade: Comércio Montante: 25.000,00MTN (965.00US$) Aplicação: Compra e venda de produtos de primeira necessidade Início: 20/11/2006 Período de pagamento: 12 Meses Maria, de 40 anos de idade, natural de Boane, província de Maputo, vive com o seu segundo esposo, tem seis (6) filhos, cinco (5) do casamento anterior e um (1) no actual, não teve oportunidade de estudar porque não constituía importância para os seus pais na altura. Casou muito cedo e por necessidade e com ajuda do ex-marido iniciou o seu negócio em 1986 numa barraca de construção precária a beira da rua que passa em frente a sua casa, foi ganhando experiência com o passar dos anos, hoje em dia conseguiu construir uma barraca de material convencional.

Através de amigas teve a informação sobre a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA e aproximou-se e solicitou um empréstimos para ampliar o seu negócio. A sua actividade conhece um crescimento em termos de volume de negócio e clientes pois diversificou os produtos existiam na altura antes do empréstimo. Confirmou que com os lucros suporta as despesas domesticas da sua família e do seu filho doente mental que frequentemente precisa de uma assistência médica.

A sua actividade tem maior impacto na comunidade porque para alem de auto-emprego providencia também emprego para a sua filha assim como colocação de diversos produtos alimentares perto da clientela, reduzindo assim o tempo e custos de viagem que as mulheres da sua comunidade levavam antes de terem o serviço por ela prestado naquela comunidade.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Jeannette Abla

texts.en:
Madam Jeannette Abla A.,a widower remarried to a benevolent teacher without salary for six months, Madam A. is about 40 years old. All the charges of the family are let on her. She is living at Alinka, a village of the canton of Togblé where she has as main activity, the peppers planting. She has at her dependence her two (02) orphans plus the two (02) others children of the new husband and the husband himself. Her senior daughter of the level of form 4 become house girl for lack of support and the second a boy is actually at home with the level of form 2 due also to the lack of support. She does only living from that activity which could bring her back if she has benefited from a more consistent financial support. Very courageous and despite her very misery situation, she has the respect of the other’s property and has succeeded to manage clearly her first credit of $850 without incident. Though she is illiterate, she has always showed the proof of her serious and rigour in her management. She is requesting a credit of $850 to buy a motor-pump in order to be in the safety of the climate ups and downs to enlarge her cultivable surface for a greater production. Backing Madam A., is not only a support to her economic activities, but and especially a humanitarian gesture as the incomes draw from that activity will serve to provide for the needs of those orphans children.

Madame A. Abla Jeannette, veuve remariée à un enseignant volontaire sans salaires depuis six mois, Madame A. a environ 40 ans d’âge. Toute la charge de la famille repose sur elle. Elle vit à Alinka, un village du canton de Togblé où elle a comme activité principale, la culture des piments. Elle a à sa charge ses deux (02) orphelins plus des deux (02) autres du nouveau mari et le mari lui-même. Sa fille aînée de niveau classe de 3ème est devenue domestique faute de soutien et le second, garçon est aujourd’hui à la maison avec le niveau 5ème faute de support également. Elle ne vit que cette activité qui pourrait lui rapporter si elle avait bénéficié d’un appui financier plus consistant. Très courageuse et malgré sa situation de misère très criarde, elle a le respect des biens d’autrui et a su gérer sainement son premier crédit de $350 sans incident. Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a toujours fait preuve de son sérieux et de sa rigueur dans sa gestion Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’acheter une moto pompe afin de se mettre à l’abris des aléas climatiques et d’agrandir sa surface cultivable pour une production plus grande. Soutenir Madame A. Abla Jeannette, est non seulement un soutien à ses activités économiques, mais et surtout un geste humanitaire, car les revenus tirés de cette activités serviront à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins.

loans.use: To buy a motor-pump and fertilizers

loans.name: Yawa Rebecca

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Yawa Rebecca, 42 was born in Alinka. She is married and mother of four (04) children. She is in charge of two (02) additional children. She has very little support from her husband who is a volunteering school teacher with a very low but regular income. All charges of the family are therefore on Mrs A.’s shoulders. She is illiterate but her dynamism and her determination allow her to be successful in all that she does. Her local improved poultry raising business helps provide her somehow substantial revenue. The rigor with which she managed her earlier credits made her a trustworthy woman that is deserving of financial support to increase her activities, boost her income and improve her living conditions. Madam AZIAJA Yawa Rebecca applied for a new credit of $1,000 to put up a hen house, purchase chickens, fodder, and veterinary products.

Madame A. Yawa Rebecca est née à Alinka il y a 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle à sa charge deux (02) autres enfants. Elle bénéficie de très peu d’aide venant de son mari enseignant volontaire avec un salaire dérisoire mais encore irrégulier, et toute les charges de la famille se reposent sur elle. Elle est analphabète mais son dynamisme et sa détermination font que tout qu’elle entreprend lui réussit merveilleusement. Son élevage de volailles, race locale améliorée, lui procure, tant que mal, un revenu substantiel. La rigueur dont elle a fait preuve dans la gestion de ses premiers crédits, font d’elle, une femme de confiance qui mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour accroître ses activités et de facto, augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie. Madame A. Yawa Rebecca sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $1000 pour construire un autre poulailler, acheter des poussins, des provendes et des produits vétérinaires.

loans.use: to put up a hen house, purchase chickens, fodder, and veterinary products

loans.name: Yao Adjété

texts.en:
Mr. N. Yao Adjété was bon in 1954, he is father of four (04) children born to different mothers and is in charge of eleven (11), other children. As a volunteer school teacher, he earns a miserable and irregular salary, and as a result, his life is miserable. After his marital mishaps, he pulled himself together and currently shares his life with only one woman in his village “Alinka”. The village currently suffers from lack of clean water chiefly during the dry season where water becomes a scarce commodity. Women and children go a long way to buy water. He is very dynamic and sociable, and as the president of the village development committee (CVD), he had the idea of initiating a drilling to help the population find potable water in the village. The ever growing density of the local population fostered the profitability of the project. The rigorous sense of management shown by Mr. N. with his (03) credits which he promptly reimbursed allowed us to believe in his abilities to succeeded in this ambitious and humanitarian project. On that purpose, he applied for a credit of $2,000 that will allow realising the drilling from which the water will be sold to the population. Note that in Togo, water is not free of charge. It is sold and at a high price in places where it is scarce.

Monsieur N. Yao Adjété, né en 1954, il est père de quatre (04) enfants de mère différente et a à sa charge onze (11) autres personnes. Enseignant volontaire avec un salaire minable et irrégulier, il mène une vie de misère. Après ses mésaventures conjugales, il s’est ressaisi et vit aujourd’hui avec une seule femme dans son village natal « Alinka ». Ledit village souffre terriblement de problèmes d’eau potable, surtout pendant la saison sèche où l’eau devient une denrée très rare et très cher. Les bonnes femmes et les enfants parcourent de longue distance pour aller payer de l’eau. Très dynamique et sociable, et en sa qualité de président du comité villageois de développement (CVD), il eut l’idée d’initier un forage pour aider la population à trouver de l’eau potable sur place dans le village. La densité de la population sans cesse croissante dans cette localité favorise la rentabilité de ce projet. La gestion rigoureuse dont Monsieur N. a toujours fait preuve à travers ses trois (03) crédits reçus et remboursés promptement permet de croire à la réussite de ce projet ambitieux et humanitaire. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $2000 qui servira à faire le forage dont l’eau sera vendue à la population. Il faut préciser qu’au Togo, l’eau n’est pas gratuite. Elle se vend, et encore très chère dans les localités où il en manque cruellement.

loans.use: To buld the drilling

loans.name: Kafui

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Kafui was born on 24th September 1976 in Lomé, she is married and mother of three (03) children and has three (03) additional children to care for. She lives with her husband in Atakpamé Kondji in the canton of Togblé. Her core business is petty trade and the marketing of fetched rain water in a village where potable water is scarce. As the village grew and its density raised, an imperative need for potable water developed and it became a very expensive commodity. The government of the country has no means to provide drinkable water to the population of this village; the population therefore suffers a lot from the situation. Knowing that the rain water as fetched and unprocessed is not without danger, she carried out a little feasibility study that allowed her to launch a drilling project that will provide her with additional income. On that purpose, she applied for a $ 2000 loan to realise the drilling. Despite her low level of education, (primary school class 6), she showed rigor in the management of her activities. Financing this project will not only be an economic action but also an humanitarian deed that will save many human lives.

Madame A. Kafui, née le 24 Septembre 1976 à Lomé, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants avec trois (03) autres personnes à sa charge. Elle vit avec son mari à Atakpamé Kondji dans le canton de Togblé. Elle a comme activité principale le petit commerce et la vente d’eau de pluie recueillie, car le village manque cruellement d’eau potable. Avec le développement du village et la densité de la population, il y un impérieux besoin d’eau potable et celle-ci se vend très chère. L’Etat n’a pas les moyens de doter la localité d’eau potable et la population en souffre mortellement. Ainsi se développent, entre autres, les maladies diarrhéiques surtout chez les enfants. Consciente que l’eau de pluie telle que recueillie et non traitée, n’est pas de bonne qualité pour la vie, elle a mené une petite étude de faisabilité qui lui a permis pouvoir se lancer dans le projet de forage qui va lui rapporter des revenus complémentaires. A cet effet, elle sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour faire un forage. Malgré son niveau d’étude très limité, (CMII), elle a fait preuve de rigueur dans la gestion de ses activités. Financer ce projet serait un geste non seulement économique mais humanitaire qui sauvera beaucoup de vies humaines.

loans.use: to realise the drilling

loans.name: Novisssi

texts.en:
N. from Ahonkpè is a solidarity fellowship comprising twelve (12) women and created four (04) years ago. Its target is improving the living conditions of its members through economic activities, education, cultural and social activities, the creation of solidarity within the fellowship and mutual assistance to members. The members are in the 26-52 age group. All members are illiterate except the secretary that manages administrative and bookkeeping documents. The fellowship already received three credits of $400;$1000, and $1500 that were all reimbursed smoothly. Just like the entire Ahonkpè village, this group of women is confronted with a serious problem of potable water. The consequences are very dramatic in a village where child mortality rate is very high. The main drinking water source is a stagnant water pool exposed to all sort of water born diseases. So they had the interesting humanitarian idea of realising a drilling with views to providing the village with potable water to guarantee the health of the population chiefly the children. On that purpose, the female fellowship “NOVISSI of Ahonkpè” applied for a credit of $ 2000 to achieve its project of water drilling in order to sell water to the entire population of the village. Financing this project is not only an economic action but also a humanitarian one: it will help contribute to the reduction of the child mortality rate in the village of Ahonkpè, in the suburban area of Lomé.

NOVISSI de Ahonkpè est un groupe de solidarité constitué de douze (12) femmes créé il y a quatre (04) ans. Il a pour objectif, améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres par l’exercice des activités économiques, éducatrices, culturelles et sociales, créer une solidarité en son sein et faire des entraides mutuelles entre les membres. L’âge des membres varie entre 26 ans et 52 ans. Tous les membres sont analphabètes à l’exception de la secrétaire qui tient les documents administratifs et comptables. Le groupement a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits respectivement de $400, $1000 et $1500 qui sont tous bien remboursés sans incident. Ce groupe de femme tout comme le village de Ahonkpè est confronté au problème sérieux d’eau potable. Les conséquences sont très dramatiques dans ce village où le mortalité enfantine est très élevé. La principale eau de consommation est un point d’eau stagnante exposé à toute sorte de maladie hydrique. Alors, elles ont eu cette idée géniale et humanitaire de faire un forage afin de doter le village d’eau potable pour garantir la bonne santé de la population surtout celle des enfants. A cet effet, le groupement féminin « NOVISSI de Ahonkpè » sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour réaliser son projet de forage dont l’eau sera vendue à la population. Financer ce projet, est un acte non seulement économique mais plutôt humanitaire : contribuer à la réduction du taux de mortalité enfantine dans le village de Ahonkpè, banlieue de Lomé.

loans.use: to realise the drilling

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akouvi was born about 35 years ago, she is married with one (01) daughter and is in charge of four (04) other children. She lives in the village of Ahonkpè. Her husband is a polygamous farmer lives with another woman and does not care for Akouvi. Akouvi therefore struggles to feed the children and paradoxically to take care of her husband in order to win his favour and protection. Mrs. A. Akouvi’s main activity his catering services to students during brake time. As she has limited financial resources, she is not able to build up a security stock and has to buy input on a daily basis. This increases her costs and reduces her profit margin. But thanks to the quality of her food and the hygienic conditions in which she serves, her kiosk receives the visit of very numerous students and even teachers. Though she is illiterate, she has always shown a sense of good management et good morality. She applied for a new credit of $800 to build up stocks of rice, oil, pasta in order to reduce supply costs. She will therefore be able to make good business to increase her revenues for and provide a better care to her family.

Madame A. Akouvi, née il y a environ 35 ans, est mariée et mère d’une (01) fille et a quatre (04) autres personnes à sa charge. Elle vit dans le village de Ahonkpé. Le mari paysan et polygame vit chez la femme de son choix et ne s’occupe pas d’elle. La femme se débrouille seule, non seulement pour nourrir ses enfants, mais paradoxalement pour entretenir l’homme pour attirer sa faveur et sa protection. Madame A. Akouvi a pour activité principale, la restauration des élèves pendant leurs récréations. Limitée par les moyens financiers, elle n’arrive pas faire un stock de sécurité de vivres et s’approvisionne quotidiennement. Ce qui augmente ses coûts et réduit ses marges bénéficiaires. Or de par la qualité de ses repas et l’hygiène qui l’entoure, son kiosque est beaucoup plus fréquenté par la plupart des élèves voire des enseignants. Bien qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a toujours fait preuve d’une bonne gestion et d’une bonne moralité. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle aujourd’hui, un crédit de $800 pour faire des stocks de riz, d’huile, de pâte alimentaires afin d’amoindrir ses coûts d’approvisionnement. Elle pourra faire alors de bonnes affaires pour augmenter ses revenus pour un meilleur entretien de sa famille.

loans.use: to build up stocks of rice, oil, pasta

loans.name: Séli

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Séli was born in 1973 in Danyi. Her level of education is primary school class 6 and has four (04) children. She lives with her monogamous husband in Ahoukpé where she deals in general foodstuff. She meets 75% of household needs for the little income of her mechanic husband cannot support the family. She started business with her own capital fund of $150. Her first credits were reimbursed with no problem and she is trustworthy in our view point and deserves financial support to grow activities. She therefore applied for a $850 credit to buy supply for her shop where she sells rice, sugar, milk, oil etc. during the festive end of year period.

Madame A. Séli, née en 1973 à Danyi. Elle a le niveau CM2 et a quatre (04) enfants. Elle vit avec son mari monogame à Ahoukpé où elle fait l’alimentation générale. Elle subvient à plus de 75% des besoins de son foyer car le peu de revenus qu’apporte le mari mécanicien n’arrive pas à couvrir les besoins de la famille. Elle a débuté ses affaires avec ses fonds propres de $150. Ses premiers crédits obtenus et remboursés sans aucun retard fait d’elle, une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour accroître ses activités Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit de $850 pour ravitailler sa boutique de riz, sucre, lait, huile, etc. pour ces fêtes de fin d’année.

loans.use: To buy supply for her shop (markets rice,milk, oil, sugar)

loans.name: Sodoayé

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Sodoayé, a mother and father orphan from child hood, early got married as she was 15 and the marriage failed. The child yielded by that marriage was however abandoned to her. Her second marriage was broken as her husband died and her third marriage was also a failure. Today, she lives alone with her three live children. Note that some of her children died. She is now 25 and lives a miserable life in Légbassito where her core business is the marketing of various products with grinding services to catering providers as secondary activity. Despite her difficulties, the young woman twice demonstrated good management and a smooth reimbursement of her credits. This very serious and honest woman is pitiful and deserves to be supported financially in order to increase the volume of her activities and therefore significantly improve her revenue to take a better care of her children. Mrs. A. Sodoayé requires a credit of $750 to buy a small pepper mill to reduce the difficult nature of her work and buy a supply of basic commodities.

Madame A. Sodoayé, orpheline de père et de mère dès son jeune âge, s’était très tôt abandonnée à un premier mariage à 15 ans sans succès. L’enfant sorti de ce mariage est laissé à elle. Le second mariage s’est soldé par le décès du mari et le troisième mariage non plus n’a pas été un succès. Aujourd’hui, elle vit seule avec ses trois enfants vivants car elle a connu aussi des décès d’enfants. A 25 ans, elle vit pitoyablement à Légbassito où elle exerce comme activité principale la vente des produits divers et comme deuxième activité la mouture aux restaurateurs. Malgré ses difficultés, cette jeune femme analphabète, deux fois déjà, a fait preuve d’une bonne gestion et d’un bon remboursement des crédits obtenus. Cette femme, très sérieuse et honnête fait pitié et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour accroître ses activités et de facto améliorer sensiblement ses revenus pour mieux entretenir ses enfants. Madame A. Sodoayé sollicite un crédit de $750 pour s’acheter un petit moulin à piment pour réduire la pénibilité de son travail et pour s’approvisionner en produits de première nécessité.

loans.use: to buy a small pepper mill and a supply of basic commodities

loans.name: Amivi

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Amivi was born in Tsévié in 1969; she is an illiterate woman that staggers under the weight of household needs. She is in charge of eight (08) children including a grandson. Her husband who has almost become a constant drunkard, never remains home and does not care about her anymore. This situation of acute poverty has very serious consequences on the education and future of the children. Despite her dynamism and her sense of business, Mrs. A. who is filled with initiatives, has no financial resource to increase her activities that she started with $50. Having shown her efficacy through two credits of $150 and $350 reimbursed without incident, Mrs. A. is a woman of trust respecting the belongings of others and deserves financial support to well develop her activities. She applied for a credit of $800 that will help purchase charcoal in the production zones.

Née à Tsévié en 1969, Madame A. Amivi est une femme analphabète qui croupit sous le poids des charges familiales. Elle a à sa charge huit (08) enfants dont un petit fils. Le mari, aujourd’hui devenu presque ivrogne, ne reste pratiquement plus à la maison et ne se soucie pas d’elle. Cette situation de pauvreté aiguë a des répercussions très graves sur l’éducation et l’avenir des enfants. Malgré son dynamisme et son sens d’affaires, Madame A., pleine d’initiatives, manque de fonds de crédit pour augmenter ses activités qu’elle avait débuté avec $50. Ayant fait ses preuves à travers deux crédits successifs de $150 et $350 obtenus et remboursés sans incident, Madame A. est une femme de confiance ayant le respect du bien d’autrui et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour bien développer ses activités. Elle sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 qui servira à aller acheter du charbon dans les zones de production.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and taxi motor

loans.name: Koami Simon

texts.en:
Mr. A. Koami Simon was born in 1972 in Dékpo. He is married and has two (02) children with four (04) other people he cares for. With an elementary level of education, he has worked as a taxi driver for ten years. His car is currently too old and the repeated repair fees it generates do not allow him anymore to meet the needs of his household therefore, there is a very bad ambiance in the house. Finally, he dropped the car in order not to spend the little savings he made on a car he will no longer be able to use. In the past, Mr A. Koami proved to be a very good head of family and took a very good care of his family. He is a trustworthy man deserving of financial support to restart business and improve the living conditions of his family. M. A. Koami Simon today has saved $1,200 and needs a credit of $2,000 to purchase a new car that he will use as a taxi.

Monsieur A. Koami Simon, est né en 1972 à Dékpo. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants avec quatre (04) autres personnes à sa charge. D’un niveau d’études élémentaires, il exerce le métier de chauffeur de taxi depuis 10 ans. Sa voiture actuelle est trop vielle et les frais de réparations répétés qu’elle occasionne, ne lui permettent plus de subvenir au besoin de son foyer, d’où une très mauvaise ambiance à la maison. En fin de compte, il a du définitivement garer le taxi pour ne pas dépenser le peu d’économie réalisée dans une voiture qu’il ne pourra plus récupérer. Par le passé, Monsieur A. Koami Simon a fait preuve d’un bon père de famille et a su bien gérer son foyer et son affaire. Il est un homme de confiance qui mérite d’être appuyé financièrement pour retrouvé son emploi et améliorer les condition de vie de sa famille. Monsieur A. Koami Simon dispose aujourd’hui, d’une économie de $1200 et sollicite un crédit de $2000 en complément pour acheter une nouvelle voiture pour faire le taxi.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for a taxi.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Claudine was born on 7th November 1968 in Lomé, she is married and has four (04) children. She takes care of three (03) additional people including her widowed father whom she lives with in Wougomé Dékpo. She was obliged to divorce because of violence and mistreatment from her vagabond and irresponsible husband, she now faces alone, all the household expenses. She is very dynamic and courageous and started petty trade, marketing various products including canned food, soap, drinks etc. That business may yield a better income if she has access to wholesalers. With her elementary level of education, Mrs. A. Claudine is a very honest and respectful woman who showed her capacity in terms of business management and we acknowledge her efficacious handling of the $300 and $550 credits which she promptly paid back. She applied for a new loan of $850 that will help her purchase at wholesalers, rice-sacks, sugar, oil cans, packets of milk etc. This will enable her to make enough profit in order to face the ever growing needs of her family and strengthen her business in the area.

Madame A. Claudine, née le 07 novembre 1968 à Lomé, est une femme mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle à charge trois (03) autres personnes dont son père veuf chez qui elle vit aujourd’hui à Wougomé Dékpo. Obligée de divorcer à cause de la violence, de la maltraitance de son mari vagabond et irresponsable, elle se retrouve seule aujourd’hui face à toutes ces charges familiales. Très dynamique et courageuse, elle a entrepris le petit commerce de produits divers (les boîtes de conserve, les savons, les boissons etc.). Ce commerce pourrait lui rapporter mieux si elle avait accès aux grossistes. D’un niveau d’études élémentaires, Madame A. Claudine, est une femme honnête, respectueuse qui a fait preuve de sa capacité à bien gérer ses activités et les crédits respectifs de $300 et $550 obtenus et promptement remboursés. Elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à acheter en gros des sacs de riz, de sucre, des bidons d’huile, des cartons de lait, etc. Ceci lui permettra de faire assez de profit afin de faire face aux besoins sans cesse croissant de sa famille et d’asseoir dignement son commerce dans sa localité.

loans.use: To purchase at wholesalers, rice-sacks, sugar, oil cans

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akossiwa was born in 1976 in Zapomare in the canton of Sanguéra. She has two (02) children and two (02) orphans at her charge. Despite her very low level of education, she has a very open mind in terms business techniques and rigorous management. Her main activity is the marketing of loincloth and beauty products. This allows her to contribute at least 75% of the needs of the home as her husband has no specific revenue. She proved to be a good family mother and a trustworthy woman through the credits she obtained rising from $75 to $650 at the third credit. She reimbursed all credits without incident. She requested a credit of $ 1,000 that will be invested in the purchasing of loincloth and beauty products with views to enlarging her business. This will give her the necessary resources to meet the needs of her children and those two orphans.

Née en 1976 à Zapomare dans le canton de Sanguéra, Madame A. Akossiwa est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et deux (02) autres orphelins à sa charge. Malgré son niveau d’études élémentaires, elle a un esprit très ouvert en technique de commerce et en matière de gestion rigoureuse. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de pagnes et des produits de beauté. Ce qui lui permet de contribuer à au moins 75% des besoins de foyer car son mari est sans revenus fixés. Elle a fait preuve d’une bonne mère de famille et une femme de confiance à travers ses crédits obtenus passant de $75 à $650 au troisième crédit, tous remboursés sans incident Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui servira à acheter des pagnes et des produits de beauté pour accroître son commerce. Ceci lui donnera plus de moyens pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et ceux des orphelins qu’elle a à sa charge.

loans.use: To purchase loincloth and beauty products

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Mrs. A. Akossiwa is 41 years old, she was born in Dékpo and has five (05) children to care for. The entire load of the family is on her shoulders. He husband, a qualified driver has been jobless for two (02) years. The education of the children is a problem, health care is another one. Thus this very dynamic but illiterate woman is fighting to meet the needs of her family. Very early in the morning, she prepares porridge to go and sell to students and after 9H30, she starts selling various other products. She already received four (04) credits which she reimbursed. Today, she applied for a credit of $650 to purchase a stock of canned food, soap, oil, insecticide etc. in order to restart her general business. The project will certainly help Mrs. A. improve the living conditions of her family while her husband is looking for a stable job.

Née il y a 41 ans à Dekpo, Madame A. Akossiwa a cinq (05) enfants à charge. Tout le poids de la famille repose sur elle, le mari chauffeur de formation est en chômage depuis plus de 2 ans déjà. La scolarité des enfants est un problème, les soins médicaux en sont d’autres. Ainsi, cette femme, très dynamique mais analphabète, se bat pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Très tôt le matin, elle fait la bouillie pour aller la vendre aux élèves et après à 9h 30, elle se lance dans la vente des produits divers. Elle a déjà bénéficié de quatre (04) qu’elle avait bien remboursé. Aujourd’hui elle sollicité un crédit de $650 pour acheter des boîte de conserve, savon, huile, insecticides etc. en vue de relancer son commerce générale. Ce projet sans doute aidera Madame A. à remonter le niveau de vie de sa famille en attendant que le mari ne trouve un emploi fixe pour la soutenir.

loans.use: To buy essential basic products

loans.name: Améwossina

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Améwossina was born in 1959 in Assiama. After her primary studies, she was adopted by an aunt in Lomé who needed an assistant in her business activities. When she went back to Tsévié in 1986, she started marketing millet, maize and other agricultural products.

She is married to a man temporarily employed in a local company and has five (05) children to care for (including three of her own). The insufficient salary of her husband cannot cover the household needs, therefore she provides 65% of the necessary resources. Mrs. S. Améwossina\'s experience has allowed her to correctly manage her business. She was able to easily reimburse the two credits that she obtained, which demonstrates her trustworthiness and her good sense of management.

Mrs. S. Améwossina has applied for a credit of $700 that will help her build up a stock of cereal to reinforce her activities and make significant profit to meet the needs of the family.

Madame S. Améwossina est née en 1959 à Assiama. Après ses études primaires, elle fut adoptée par une tante à Lomé pour l’aider dans ses activités commerciales. Revenue à Tsévié en 1986, elle se lance dans le commerce de mil, de maïs et autres produits agricoles. Mariée à un homme, temporairement engagé dans une société de la place, elle a à sa charge cinq (05) personnes dont ses trois (03) enfants. Le salaire de son mari, insuffisant pour couvrir toutes les dépenses de la maison, elle contribue aujourd’hui à plus de 65% des besoins du foyer. L’expérience acquise depuis lui a permis de bien gérer son activité. Elle a pu sans difficulté rembourser les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenu ce qui démontre sa bonne foi et son bon sens de gestion. Elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $700 qui servira faire un stock de céréales pour renforcer son activité et dégager une marge conséquente pour améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To build up a stock of cereals

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.en:
Madam Akouvi A. was born on 22th January, 1968 at Adétikopé. She abandoned her studies at the level of form 4 for lack of support. Unable to learn a career for lack of means, she was early launched into small trade along streets and roads.

Married with a man of a few means, Akouvi is actively contributiing to the needs of the couple in the education of their three (03) children. With her dynamism and determination, she has acquired a great experience which helps her to master her commercial activities. As a good manager, she has succeeded in managing the first two credits she obtained and she repaid promptly. She is a woman of good morality and trust who deserves to be backed financially to growth her activities and increase her incomes for the family well-being.

Madam Akouvi A. requests a credit of $800 which will serve to strengthen her clothing trade and will allow her to add to her shoes and bags for ladies inventory. The implementation of this project in those periods of end years feasts will provide for her an important profit margin allowing her to improve her family living condition.

Madame A. Akouvi est née le 22 Janvier 1968 à Adétikopé. Elle a abandonné ses études en classe de 3ème manque de support. Ne pouvant non plus apprendre un métier faute de moyens, elle s’est alors lancé très tôt dans de petit commerce de rue. Marié à un homme de peu de revenus, elle participe activement au besoin de son foyer dans l’éducation de ses trois (03) enfants. De par son dynamisme et sa détermination, elle acquis une grande expérience qui lui permet de maîtriser son activité commerciales. En bonne gestionnaire, elle su bien gérer ses deux premiers crédits obtenus et promptement remboursés. Elle est une femme exemplaire et de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus pour le bien-être de sa famille. Madame A. Akouvi sollicite actuellement un crédit de $800 qui va servir à renforcer son commerce de pagnes et lui associer les chaussures et sacs pour dames. La réalisation de ce projet en cette période des fêtes de fin d’année lui procurera une marge bénéficiaire importante lui permettant d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy cloths and shoes for ladies

loans.name: Dédé

texts.en:
Madam Dédé A. was born in 1970 at Tsévié. After the o’level, she was launched in the ladies shoes and bags selling in the city of Tsévié. Widowed for 5 years, she got two (02) children who are actually at her dependency. Having attended the class of form 3, she has succeeded to manage her businesses thanks to the training acquired from the management of activity and credit. The two credits obtained have been totally repaid. She is a woman of character and having the sense of respect of the other properties. This has been shown through the good management made from her three first credits repaid without incident and increases her credibility. Madam Dédé A. requests today a credit of $850 which will help her to supply ladies shoes and bags to the wholesalers in Lomé to resell them at Tsévié and its suburbs. The implementation of this project will allow her to increase her activities, incomes to improve her children living conditions.

Madame A. Dédé est née en 1970 à Tsévié. Après le BEPC, elle s’est lancée dans la vente des chaussure et sacs pour dame dans la ville de Tsévié. Divorcée depuis 5 ans, elle a eu deux (02) enfants qui sont actuellement à sa charge. Ayant fait la classe de 4ème, elle a su gérer ses affaires grâce à la formation reçue sur la gestion de l’activité et du crédit. Les deux crédits obtenus ont été totalement remboursés. Elle est une femme de caractère et ayant le sens du respect du bien d’autrui. Ceci s’est illustré par la bonne gestion faite de ses trois premiers crédits remboursés sans incident et augmente sa crédibilité. Madame A. sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre d’aller s’approvisionner des chaussure et sacs pour dame chez les grossistes à Lomé pour les revendre à Tsévié et ses environs. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’accroître ses activités et de facto, ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use: to supply ladies shoes and bags

loans.name: André Kossi

texts.en:
Mr André Kossi G. was born on this 10th November 1969 at Bolou. Actually, he is a taxi motor driver at Tsévié. He is married and is a father of three (03) children who he can support easily due to his meagre incomes. He has abandoned the studies for lack of support. Having no more the means to learn a career, he was launched in the taxi motor driving for somebody became he is unable to buy a motor by himself. Noticing that he is only exploiting by his master, he wish to have his own taxi motor which allow him to have a financial stability at the need of his family. For that purpose, Mr André Kossi G. requests a credit of $1000 to acquire a motor Yamaha to make the service of motor taxi generally called “Oléhia” in Togo. This project will allow him to growth his incomes to improve the living conditions of his wife and children

Monsieur G. Kossi André est né le 10 Novembre 1969 à Bolou. Actuellement, il est conducteur de taxi moto à Tsévié. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants qu’il arrivent difficilement à supporter à cause de maigres revenus. Il a abandonné les études par manque de support. N’ayant non plus de moyens pour apprendre un métier, il s’est lancé dans le taxi moto qu’il conduit pour quelqu’un car ne pouvant pas en à acquérir procurer. S’apercevant que son parton ne fait que l’exploiter, il souhaite avoir lui-même sa propre moto qui lui permettra d’avoir une stabilité financière au besoin de sa famille. Pour ce faire, Monsieur G. Kossi André sollicite un crédit de $1000 F pour acquérir une moto Yamaha pour faire le service de taxi moto communément appelé « Oléhia » au Togo. Ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa femme et de ses enfants.

loans.use: to acquire a motor Yamaha for taxi

loans.name: Abla

texts.en:
Madam A. Abla was born in 1960 at Tsévié. She is married and is a mother of four (04) children. She contributes at least 75% of the family expenditures as her husband, a teacher in a private school at Tsévié with meagre and unstable salaries, does not have a consequent income to provide for the elementary needs of the family, despite her good will. Illiterate, she has as main activity the fabrication of the maze bread (Ablo), a traditional meal well appreciated and consumed in Togo. Being one of the rare women of the suburb to do such an activity, she has a very enough important customary which she does not succeeding to cover. Faithful and model woman in good management, she has nothing less than those who are educated. She has succeeded to well managed her two first credits respectively $100 and $300 obtained and promptly repaid. Madam A. requests actually a credit of $850 to make the whole purchase of maze and wood fire. With this project, she could strengthen her activities and increase her incomes to better take care of her children and help her husband and in house expenditures.

Madame A. est née en 1960 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle contribue à moins 75% des charges familiales car son époux, un enseignant dans une école privée à Tsévié aux maigres et irréguliers salaires, n’a pas réellement un revenu conséquent pour subvenir aux besoins élémentaires de la famille, malgré sa bonne volonté. Analphabète, elle a comme pour activité principale la fabrication de pain de maïs (Ablo), un mets traditionnel bien apprécié et consommé au Togo. Etant l’une des rares femmes du milieu à faire ce genre d’activité, elle a une clientèle assez importante qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire. Femme fidèle et exemplaire en bonne gestion, elle n’a rien à envier aux lettrés. Elle a su bien gérer deux premiers respectifs de $100 et $300 obtenus et promptement remboursés. Madame A. Abla sollicite actuellement un crédit de $850 pour faire des achats en gros de maïs et du bois de chauffage. Avec ce projet, elle pourra renforcer ses activités et augmenter ses revenus pour mieux s’occuper de ses enfants et aider son mari dans les dépenses de la maison.

loans.use: to make the whole purchase of maze and wood fire

loans.name: Sampè Bella

texts.en:
Mother of two (02) children, Madam Bella Sampè M. is a door-to-door macacon reseller. She is very submitted to her husband who makes profit from her condition of poverty to abuse from her. Determine to leave that situation of her husband permanent dependency, she has started a small trade of table which is she managing very well. A credit of $150 obtained and well repaid allowed her to launch definitively in the essential products trading. She possesses a management ability which does not make any doubt of her business profitability. Currently, Madam Bella Sampè M. is requesting a credit of $500 to rent small shop and to buy rice, sugar, milk, tomatoes, etc. to growth her activities. She will increase her incomes allowing to provide for her own needs and those of her children and to draw out from her husband dependence and illtreating.

Mère de deux (02) enfants, Madame M. Sampè Bella est revendeuse de maroquineries qu’elle vend de porte à porte. Elle est très soumise à son mari qui profite de son état de pauvreté pour abuser sur elle. Déterminée à sortir de cet état de dépendance permanent de son mari, elle a débuté un petit commerce de table qu’elle gère assez bien. Un crédit de $150 obtenu et bien remboursé lui a permis de se lancé définitivement dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité. Elle possède une capacité de gestion qui ne fait pas douter de la rentabilité de ses affaires. Actuellement, Madame M. Sampè Bella, sollicite un crédit de $500 pour louer un petit magasin et acheter du riz, sucre, lait, tomate, etc. pour accroître ses activités. Elle augmenterait ses revenus lui permettant de subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants et de se soustraire de la dépendance et la maltraitance de son mari.
