loans.use: To rent small a shop and buy essential basic products

loans.name: Akuwa

texts.en:
Born on the 23rd June 1974 at Kpalimé (P/Kloto) from a poor family, Miss A. D. is a dactylograph by trade. Before a full time jobless, she is converted in foodstuffs trader.single without children, she has at her dependance a girl and her parents (of old age) and for whom she is expending too much. With the coming soon of the end-year feasts, she ha made the project to growth her trade which needs an important fund that she doesn’t have. For that purpose, Miss A. D. request a credit of $550 to buy rice, sugar, soap, sweets, etc. in view to increase her trade and to make out a suitable margin profit to improve their living conditions.

Née le 23 Juin 1974 à Kpalimé (P/Kloto) d’une famille pauvre, Mlle D. A. a une formation en dactylographie. Face à un chômage en plein temps, elle s’est convertie en commerçante de denrées alimentaires. Célibataire sans enfant, elle a à sa charge une fille et ses parents qui sont d’âge avancé et pour qui elle se dépense énormément. Avec l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle a fait le projet d’augmenter son commerce qui nécessite un fonds aussi important qu’elle ne dispose pas. Pour ce faire, Mlle D. A. sollicite un crédit de $550 pour acheter du riz, de sucre, du savon, bonbons, etc. en vue d’accroître son commerce et de dégager une marge bénéficiaire adéquate pour améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy essential basic products

loans.name: Reine Béniwoa

texts.en:
Madam Reine Béniwoa J. was born on this 10th September 1977 at Tsévié (P/Zio). Office secretary by trade, she is married and is a mother of two (02) children. As the incomes of her unemployed husband does not covering the household charges, while she has her mother sicked and blocked on bed. Madam Reine Béniwoa J. had to launched in the trading which is bringing to her better incomes than her job of secretary which is not more paying. With her first credit of $250 well repaid, she has meeting a little by little the two ends. Madam Reine Béniwoa J. requests today a new credit of $500 to buy ladies shoes and bags. The implementation of this project will allow her to increase her incomes and the impact will be the improvement of her family living conditions and the normal progress in the studies of her brothers at dependence.

Madame J. Béniwoa Reine est née le 10 Septembre 1977 à Tsévié (P/Zio). Secrétaire bureautique de formation, elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Comme les revenus de son mari sans emploi, ne suffisent pour les besoins du foyer alors qu’elle a sa mère malade et alitée, Madame J. Béniwoa, a dû laisser se lancer dans le commerce qui lui rapporte mieux que son emploi de secrétaire qui ne se paie même pas. Avec son premier crédit de $250 bien remboursé, elle pu tirer son épingle de jeu. Madame J. Béniwoa sollicite aujourd’hui un nouveau crédit de $500 pour acheter des chaussures et des sacs de femmes. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et l’impact sera l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille et l’évolution normale dans les études de ses frères à sa charge.

loans.use: To buy ladies shoes and bags

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Dress maker by trade, Madam Afi H. was born on 19th April 1968 at Aného. Her husband retired for 2 years, can only benefit from a meagre pension, again irregular and insufficient for the needs of the household while they are five (05) children under their control. So Madam Afi H. was launched since 4 years in the basic essential products and with the profit made, she succeeds as best as possible to contribute to the family needs. She has already benefited from two credits well repaid and deserves to be backed again. Madam Afi H. requests a third credit of $650 to enlarge her shop by the dishable products and to open a new ray of religious articles selling.

Couturière de formation, Madame H. Afi est née le 19 Avril 1968 à Aného. Son mari, retraité depuis 2 ans, ne touche qu’une maigre pension, encore irrégulière et insuffisante pour les besoins du foyer alors qu’ils ont cinq (05) enfants à encore supporter. Alors, Madame H. Afi s’est-elle lancée depuis 4 ans dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité et avec les profits réalisés, elle arrive tant que mal à contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits bien remboursés et mérite d’être encore soutenue Madame H. sollicite un troisième crédit de $650 pour agrandir sa boutique par des produits de vaisselle et ouvrir un nouveau rayon de vente d’articles religieux.

loans.use: To buy the dishable products and to open a new ray of religious articles selling.

loans.name: Atsoé

texts.en:
Born from a modest family, Mr Atsoé J. is handicapped from the feet since his birth. This complexed him very early from school which he had abandoned already at the primary school at the age of 12 years. Then, he opted for the cobblery which he exercises well for 25 years. He his the owner of his private workshop and has six (06) apprentices who are training actually. Father of two (02) children, Mr Atsoé J. has at his dependence in additional to his own children, three (03) nephews of whom he is assuring the education. He has shown the proof of a good management of his workshop of which customary continues to growth. Wish the quality of his products and services. Mr J. is well appreciated in his area and is enjoying from a good credibility. Today, he is requesting a credit of $550 to buy in whole the necessary raw materials to the shoes fabrication in order to increase his incomes especially at these years-end feasts where he receives much demands. Financing this project, it is to encourage the handicapped to their self taking into charge in order not to be considered as the rejected persons of the society.

Né d’une famille modeste, Monsieur J. Atsoè est handicapé des deux jambes dès sa naissance. Ceci le complexa très tôt à l’école qu’il avait du abandonner déjà au cours primaire à l’âge de 12 ans. Il opta alors pour la cordonnerie qu’il exerce en maître depuis 25 ans. Il est propriétaire de son propre atelier et a 6 apprenties qu’il forme actuellement. Père de deux (02) enfants, Monsieur J. Atsoè a à sa charge en plus de ses enfants, 3 neveux dont il assure la scolarisation. Il a fait preuve de la bonne gestion de son atelier dont la clientèle ne fait que s’accroître. De par la qualité de produits et services, J. Atsoè est bien apprécié dans son quartier et jouit d’une bonne crédibilité. Il sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $550 pour acheter en gros les matières premières nécessaires à la fabrication des chaussures augmenter ses revenus surtout en ces fêtes de fin d’années où il accumule beaucoup de commandes. Financer ce projet, c’est encourager les handicapés à leur auto prise en charge pour ne pas se considérer comme des exclus de la société.

loans.use: to buy in whole the necessary raw materials to the shoes fabrication

loans.name: Félicienne Dédé

texts.en:
Madam Félicienne Dédé H. is 43 years old and a mother of four (04) children. Her husband was compressed in an enterprise and jobless for 5 years. All the expenses relay on her what give her much pains. But, thanks to her trade of smoked fish, flour, maze and beans, she manages to provide for the household basic needs. However her fund is not enough to growth her trade and increase her incomes. Very serious in her businesses, she enjoys from a good morality and deserves to be backed financially. Madam Félicienne Dédé H. requests a credit of $850 which will serve to make a storage of smocked fish, flour and beans. The implementation of this project will increase her incomes to improve the family living conditions.

Madame H. Dédé Félicienne est âgée de 43 ans et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Son mari fut compressé dans une entreprise et est sans emploi depuis 5 ans. Toutes charges de la famille lui reviennent en grande parte. Ce qui lui donne beaucoup de peine. Mais, grâce à son commerce de poisons fumés, de farine, de maïs et du haricot, elle se débrouille pour subvenir aux besoins essentiels de son foyer. Or, son capital est insuffisant pour accroître son commerce et augmenter ses revenus. Très sérieuse dans ses affaires, elle jouit d’une bonne moralité et mérite d’être soutenus financièrement Madame H. Dédé Félicienne sollicite un crédit de $ 850 qui servira à faire un stock de poisons fumés, de farine, de maïs et du haricot. La réalisation de projet augmentera ses revenus pour améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.

loans.use: to make a storage of smocked fish, flour and beans

loans.name: Anoko

texts.en:
Madam Anoko L. is a widowed woman for 9 years because her husband has found another women who he considered more beautiful and who has a very comfortable situation. As this was not enough for him to humiliate Anoko as “ugly woman”. The man has rather at the dependence of her, putting then Anoko is a very miserable situation. Before this very pitiful situation, she has collected back the haberdashery of her mother which she manage with vigour and determination for 8 years. With her secondary education level and her large experiences, Anoko has shown the proof of a good manager through her three respective credits of $200, $350 and $550 obtained and regularly repaid without incident. So, by the actual project, Anoko is requesting a credit of $1000 to buy in whole the articles of haberdashery to growth her businesses. This will help her to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her children. She could then be happy and deserve entirely all the respect that needs the struggling woman.

Madame L. Anoko est une femme divorcée depuis bientôt 9 ans parce que son époux a trouvé une autre femme qu’il a jugé plus belle et ayant une situation très confortable. Comme cela ne lui suffisait d’humilier Anoko de vilaine, l’homme a de surcroît abandonné tous les quatre (04) enfants à sa charge, mettant ainsi Anonko dans une misère totale. Face à cette situation très pitoyable, elle a récupéré la mercerie de sa mère qu’elle gère avec vigueur et détermination il y a 8 ans. Avec son niveau d’études secondaires et ses larges expériences, Anonko a fait preuve de bonne gestionnaire à travers ses trois crédits respectifs de $200, $350 et $550 obtenus et régulièrement remboursés sans incident. Ainsi, par le présent projet, Anonko sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter en gros les articles de mercerie pour accroître ses affaires. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de facto améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle pourra désormais s’affirmer et mériter pleinement tout le respect qu’à droit une femme combattante.

loans.use: To buy in whole the articles of haberdashery

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en:
Reyna is 47 years old, she is an intelligent, capable and so creative person, she always says that has an excellent ability as a sales person. She wanted to built her own house because loves so much to her family, for that reason, she always thinks about the future. Her husband is a mechanic since 10 years ago, with the lowest salary, Reyna knows that is so difficult to cover all the family expenses, so, she started a business. In 1997 in her house, she sold handmade products like dolls and adornments. To day, she wants to built her business in her house’s porch. She hopes to have her business bigger than before and increase the sales, she wants to surpass like woman, loves the life and wants the better for her family.

Reyna is requesting a loan of $475 DLLS to purchases of materials and increase the production, she is waiting for an excellent sales this season. She hopes your help to improve her business and supports her family.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Reyna tiene 47 años, se considera una persona con mucha creatividad, emprendedora y muy buena para las ventas, reside en Tampico Tamaulipas. Casada con un mecánico con 10 años de experiencia, Reyna quiere construir una casa para su familia debido a que su esposo no gana lo suficiente para los gastos esenciales del hogar, por lo que se vio motivada ayudar a su esposo y sacar adelante a su familia. En Julio de 1997 comenzó su negocio en la elaboración de manualidades y muñecos de peluche, los cuales son de gran valor artesanal y de mano de obra.

Reyna requiere de $475 DLLS para comprar la materia prima de su negocio y poder seguir produciendo sus manualidades y monos de peluche que son muy demandados por muchas personas, además dice que la demanda esta aumentando debido a estas fechas navideñas y por lo que necesita el dinero para aumentar su capacidad de producción y ventas.

loans.use: Purchases of materials

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita has been working in the baking business for more than a decade. She owns a bakery with her husband who worked at an industrial bakery for 11 years. When he quit his job a year ago they started this business. They are a hardworking couple that is fully dedicated to the business. They begin to bake at 6 AM every morning to make the morning the products. They bake again at 1 PM in order to make enough bread for the sales in the afternoon.

They are in need for a loan in order to buy the baking ingredients necessary for their operation. They have also bought a refrigerator that they need to finishing paying off. Thanks to the new refrigerator they have been able to sell refreshments. They rent their home and they have young children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy ingredients and help finish paying off her refrigerator

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a young student that is studying engineering. She sells make-up to her community and her fellow students in order to finance her education. Her parents are also microentrepreneurs but they have very modest businesses and they do not make enough to cover all of Daisy’s costs. She started this business with only $100 of her own savings. After a year she has done well and has also begun to sell women’s clothing.

She is seeking a loan because she wants to further invest in her business. She is a good saleswoman and sees that she could sell more if she could afford to buy larger quantities of her product. Her goal is to be self sufficient and attain her college degree.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and women\\\'s clothing in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Asher would like to buy packs of salt, laundry detergents, sacks of cereals, sugar, bales of flour, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane wants to buy more ginger, spinach, carrots, godgets, cauliflower, lettuce and garlic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Perris wants to buy a dairy goat and animal feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy new ladies clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Faith wants to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Frashier wants to buy packs of matchbox, soft drinks, sacks of sugar, maize, beans, boxes of flour, and cans of cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane wants to pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy wants to pay schools for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beth wants to buy 2 dairy goats, fertilizers, seeds and pay the laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy brow driers, hair weaves, extensions, clips, and braids.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy 4 sacks of potatoes, 5 packs of onions, 5 crates of tomatoes and varieties of fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy 5 steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Matiko would like to buy 5 steers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to buy 300 layers chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Peninah would like to buy animal feeds for her dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresiah would like to build a permanent cowshed and buy animal feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to construct 3 rental rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nelius want to build 3 rental rooms

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina V. is 33 years old. She is married and has a kid. Her husband works as a driver.

Evelina has worked as an expert in the Bureau of Labour in Vratza for 6 years but because of reduce of establishment she has lost her job. Evelina V. borrowed some money and opened a little shop for washing materials. At the beginning she used her profit to reinvest and to have a wide range of goods.

Now she wants to supply some cosmetics and needs an $ 850 loan.

loans.use: To supply some cosmetics

loans.name: Katia

texts.en:
Katia K. keeps a small grocery on the ground floor of the block she lives in. She is 54 years old and is divorced from 20 years. She has a son who lives in the capital city - Sofia.

Katia runs her business for 15 years. The grocery is very good supplied and has many regular customers. Katia’s son sometimes helps her in her business and makes some delivery when he is in Vratza.

Katia K. needs to buy a special refrigerator to keep milk products in it so she applies for a $2 000 loan.

loans.use: To buy a special refrigerator for milk products

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra is a fruit distributor and vendor in Guayaquil. She has been in this type of business for about 17 years because she helped her parents when they were in the same line of work. For a while she worked as a nanny but she did not make enough to make ends meet at her home. About 8 years ago she started working with about $200 in capital and sold at a stand on the street. She now was a spot in a market and is much better off.

She needs this loan in order to buy very large quantities of fruits. Alexandra has started distributing to other fruit vendors in her area and has been very successful. In order to continue she needs to have access capital to buy at wholesale prices. She has 3 children of which one is already independent. She hopes to one day open a business out of her home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fruits in bulk for her stand and to distribute to others

loans.name: Flérida

texts.en:
Flerida has a stand where she sells fruit in a local market. She started off with a very small amount of investment capital and with her husband’s help learned the trade quickly. She has been doing this type of work for about 10 years along with her husband. The most difficult part of this business is offering competitive prices to the customer. In order to do this Flerida has requested a loan so that she may purchase her fruits at wholesale quantities and prices. She and her husband have three children together including one who they are currently putting through college. Her dream is to have all her kids attain a college degree.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy large amounts of fruits for her market

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina opened her store with only $60 of start-up capital. She sells basic foods including fruits and vegetables along with other snacks. She learned the trade from her husband who worked as a distributor in markets for a long time. 2 years ago he fell ill and is now paralyzed from the waist down. He tries to help Martina as much as he can in the market, but it is very difficult because he cannot even afford a wheel chair.

Martina is hoping to use this loan to make significant investments in new products. She wants to begin selling meats and eggs. Her home is in very poor conditions as it still made of wood and does not even have a concrete floor. She also has two children who she must provide for.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in chicken, beef and eggs to sell from her store

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina sells cosmetics and perfumes. She has been working in this type of activity for several years but needed to stop after having two you children. Two months ago she restarted her business by buying her products on 15 days credit. The problem with this is that she cannot afford to buy a large amount of products and she loses a significant amount of potential profit. She is seeking the loan in order to avoid this and buy in bulk.

Sabina is 40 years old and has 2 kids. Her husband is a construction worker and always contributes to the family. They are from rural Ecuador and have been able to fix up their home through hard work and savings.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She will buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been running this store out of her home for about 2 years. Prior to running this business she worked as a seamstress but she did not generate enough income to support her family. She and her husband decided to open it when he was fired from his job. With their savings they invested in products and they have been slowly growing these past years.

Seeing as this is their main source of income they have decided to expand their business. Her husband just finished a baking course and is very optimistic about starting a bakery. They have been making bread for a short time period and they have just invested in a display case. They need the loan for the raw materials necessary to start producing large amounts of baked goods.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Turn their small store into a bakery

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has been running this business for about 20 years. She started with the help of a family member that was living abroad who sent her $2 (50,000 sucres), which at the time went a very long way in Ecuador. Her husband passed away 32 years ago and she was left to raise her 6 children on her own. For a long time she was a seamstress and often worked all night in order to support her family. Today her children are all grown and two still live with her.

She runs this business because her children do not generate sufficient income to support her. She feels proud to be able to be independent and to be able to help her children. She is seeking the loan in order to continue diversifying her product line and to make some improvements to the shop. She currently sells a large variety of products for the home and also cosmetics for women.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new products to sell from her store

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.en:
Joaquin has a store where he sells snacks and other foods. He was a butcher for a very long time and had a stand at a local market but he had to move the business to his home when the market was shut down. Joaquin suffered a very unfortunate accident where he lost a leg and since then has not been able to continue working as a butcher. Despite this situation he has persisted and has opened a small store with the support of his family. He has three children, two of which are already independent. They have been great for their father and helped him set up two rooms in his home that he rents out for a complimentary source of income.

Joaquin is seeking the loan in order to continue to invest in his business. He will buy products in bulk and also make improvements to the store. This business keeps him motivated and with a high self esteem. His wife is a seamstress who also helps him at the store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy products in bulk and make improvements to the store

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia sells clothes in her local community and other areas in Ecuador. She buys the clothing in bulk from a friend who allows her to buy at wholesale prices and quantities. She travels to rural sectors in Ecuador on the weekend in order to sell much of her merchandise. She sees this as a great market because few people travel out there to sell and she has a loyal customer base.

She is seeking the loan in order to invest in children’s clothing, shirts and men’s pants. She wants to open a store out of her home in the near future in order to facilitate sales. She is a widow with 5 kids who are already grown up, one of them helps her with the business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in clothing for children and men

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos makes furniture in a shop that he runs out of his home. He started off as an assistant for another furniture maker and learned the trade quickly. With the help of his father and with the money he saved from his job he decided to open up his own business. He rented a location where he could work and sell and he also invested in a couple of tools necessary. He soon realized that the costs of renting were too much and he moved the business into his home.

He is seeking this loan specifically to buy the tools necessary to work more efficiently and make better products. Currently he rents most of the machinery necessary for the work which is getting expensive and inefficient. This business provides for him, his wife and his three children. He uses his earnings to put his kids through school and dreams of them having college degrees.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy tools for his furniture making operation

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Anyone working at an outdoor market in Moldova likely values the breaks they take at a drink and snack vendor’s booth. Most sellers arrive before 6:00 a.m. to set up and start their day, so for the past 3 years Natalia has opened early too. She owns her mobile building and rents the lot from the market, keeping her costs and prices low. Natalia is requesting a loan to try purchasing from a new distributor in the Ukraine, where prices will be more reasonable. Buyers are loyal already, but this entrepreneur feels connected to her customers and wants to serve them even better.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir runs small business importing clothing from Istanbul and selling it from a little building in the center of his town. He takes care to arrange everything into attractive displays. The business is going well, but Vladimir has decided to move his operation to a nearby town where he could use a building owned by his mother and thus save on rent costs. There he hopes to also offer a greater variety of items, but first he says he will see how things go with what he sells now. He needs a loan to make the move and re-stock his inventory.

loans.use: Moving business to a new location

payments.comment:
The loan has been largely reimbursed ahead of schedule due to the fact that the entrepreneur has nearly ceased operation in this particular business. He experienced difficulties based in part in his lack of experience in the sector, including lower than anticipated profitability. He also had family problems which took precedence in his time and effort and thus decided to close the business for now. 

Creditul a fost în mare parte rambursat anticipat datorită faptului că antreprenorul a închis afacerea. În activitatea sa sa confruntat cu mai multe probleme antreprenoriale, dar ca factori decisivi în închiderea afacerii au fost rentabilitatea mică şi unele probleme de familie.

loans.name: Elizaveta

texts.en: Elizaveta owns a small store that sells clothing and accessories to a young and fashion-conscious Moldovan clientele. Together with one employee she awaits customers who come to see her array of women’s and unisex clothes. Her business has been working for over a year now, during which time she has been figuring out the seasonality of demand and adjusting as much as possible. Elizaveta would like to take a loan as working capital and to purchase new types of products.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
The village of Pruteni is scenic and beautiful, with a population of 1000 people. Situated on the border with Romania, which will become part of the European Union in 2007, there is no running water, gas or regular public transportation (m  ost villagers do not have cars and must rely on horses and wagons for transportation). It is 45 min by car down a dirt and gravel road from the closest regional center. The majority of residents have small family farms ( Gospodarie in Romanian), relying on subsistence farming and generating an income only from selling surplus produce at market.

Lilia C. and her husband Vladimir just recently had a child.  Naturally she is a very busy lady with her baby boy, but she still finds time to take care of her two pigs.  They would like a loan to purchase additional animals to grow the family farm.

loans.use: Animal Purchases

payments.comment: Lillia's husband has retuned home from working abroad in Moscow.  20% of Moldovan's work abroad throughout Europe and Russia. Lillia's husband brought back enough money to pay off her debt to Microinvest/kiva.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en:
The village of Pruteni is scenic and beautiful, with a population of 1000 people. Situated on the border with Romania, which will become part of the European Union in 2007, there is no running water, gas or regular public transportation (m  ost villagers do not have cars and must rely on horses and wagons for transportation). It is 45 min by car down a dirt and gravel road from the closest regional center. The majority of residents have small family farms (Gospodarie in Romanian), relying on subsistence farming and generating an income only from selling surplus produce at market.

Tatiana S. is 27 years old with a large family. She is asking for a loan for working capital for her family farm. This past year was a
difficult year. The price of animals fell at the farmer\\\'s market and many small-scale farmers\\\' profits were affected. Meanwhile, the price of machine services (hiring someone to transport her corn harvest from the fields) rose due to the increase of gas prices. Tatiana now needs a loan to fund planting the crops she is planning for sale next year.

loans.use: Seed and supply purchases

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is 47 years old and has always been a dedicated farmer. She has ducks, chickens and geese on her land. One day per week she travels to the local market by her horse drawn carriage to sell her birds. She usually takes them alive in case no one buys them that day. She is a little bit nervous about taking out a loan due to the time frame of returning the loan within one year, but she understands the risks and is eager to succeed. Maria will work hard and travel to
the market more often to sell more birds. She is asking for a loan to purchase some more ducks and the supplies she needs to grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase of poultry

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en: The last house on the only road in the village of Pruteni (leading to the Romanian border) is Raisa\'s homestead. Her house overlooks a massive field leading into a forest where the sun seams to linger during the sunset. Raisa is 45 years old and operates her family farm together with her two girls and hard working husband. She believes that wild pigs roaming freely instead of locked up in a cage will make more plump and juicy meat which will sell for a higher price in the market. She would like a loan to purchase an additional two pigs and expand her fence around her property.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 pigs and related expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shaving equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows and construct a cow shade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a potatoes growing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a dairy farming business.

loans.name: Veselina

texts.en:
Veselina I. is 58 years old. She has two daughters who after their graduation were not able to get a job in Bulgaria and live abroad at the moment.

Veselina I. has been a teacher for 24 years but after but 6 years ago the school staff was reduced and she lost her job. Then she decided to start small business – yarn trade. She rented a small stall in one of city trade centers. The business improved and a year ago she rented another stall in the same center.

Some people say knitted clothes have been replaced by modern stuff but Veselina I. does not share this opinion. She is happy with what she does as long as she is able to pay off with her suppliers. Veselina I. needs this $ 1 500 loan to supply some extra yarn.

loans.use: To supply some extra yarn

loans.name: Krasimir

texts.en: Krasimir V. is 45 years old and lives in Vratza. In 2001 he decided to start a small manufacture of furniture in a rented workshop. He produces home equipment – bedroom suites, kitchen equipment, wardrobes and others. His customers are people of the city and the region. Krasimir V. needs $ 2 000 to supply wooden material for his manufacture.

loans.use: To supply wooden material for his manufacture

loans.name: Rumen

texts.en:
Rumen T. is 34 years old. He was born in Vratza but until the last year has been lived in the capital city of Bulgaria – Sofia.

A year ago he decided to start an own business so he moved back to his native town Vratza and found a carpentry workshop. То start this business he needed some machines so he borrowed some money and bought them.

Rumen mainly produces front and interior doors. His customers say the doors are of very good quality and prices. Rumen T. needs this $ 2 000 loan to buy an edge-cutting machine.

loans.use: To buy an edge-cutting machine

loans.name: Irena

texts.en:
Irena S. ia s young woman who lives in Vratza. She is married and has a kid. Her parents are in retail business for many years and her husband is has a rich experience in cultivating and selling of fresh meat.

So Irena and her husband decided that they both are trained enough to start an own business and found a small grocery in the neighborhood they live. At the beginning they supplied only meat and meat products in the grocery and later some other food staff.

Now Irina S. and her husband need some money to buy a professional refrigerator for meat. Such refrigerators cost $ 1 700.

loans.use: To buy a professional refrigerator for meat

loans.name: Janeta

texts.en:
Janeta D. is 44 years old. She was born in the town of Vidin but her childhood passed in Vratza whrere she graduated her education. Janeta D. is married and has two sons.

For over ten years he has lived and worked in the capital city Sofia in the field of advertisement and PR consultancy. Three years ago she had to go back to Vratza because her parents were very old ad she had to look after them.

Then Janeta decided to establish an advertising agency in her native town. Janeta D. needs $ 1 000 for a mechanic knife for paper cutting and formatting.

loans.use: To buy a mechanic knife for paper cutting and formatting

loans.name: Galia

texts.en:
Galia M. is 44 years old. She is single and lives with her old mother and looks after her. Galia is an invalid from birth. One of her legs is shorter than the other. She receives a disablement pension but it is too small and three years ago she has decided to open a stall for coffee, soft drinks and refreshments.

She has the experience because she has worked as a store seller for more then fifteen years. The money she earns of this stall helps her to look after her mother.

Now Galia M. needs $ 500 to supply coffee, soft drinks, mineral water, candies.

loans.use: To supply coffee, soft drinks, mineral water, candies

loans.name: Grisha

texts.en:
Grisha B. is 46 years old. He has graduated economy and has more than 10 years experience as an insurance expert. He is married and has a small daughter. Twenty years ago he lost his son in an accident while he was at the army.

Grisha B. started his own business 13 years ago. At the beginning he traded scrap iron. Two years ago he survived in a severe car accident and left this trade. Then he started agriculture.

Grisha owns about 5 000 decares land on which he grows spinach, lettuce and fruit trees – plums and cherries. Grisha B. needs $ 2000 to buy fertilizer for the new season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the new season

loans.name: Miroslav

texts.en:
Miroslav G. has more than ten years working experience as a computer engineer in a state company.

In 1995 he decided o find his own business and started with a clothes trade at first, then sartorial business and now he keeps a computer club for games and internet services.

Miroslav is 44 years old economist by education and has a daughter. His wife is a school teacher.

Miroslav G. applies for an $ 800 loan to buy a new hardware.

loans.use: To buy a new hardware

loans.name: Hristina

texts.en:
Hristina I. is 45 years old and runs her business for 6 years. He keeps a shop for cosmetics and perfumery. She works alone in her shop but sometimes her daughter who is a third year student in economics gives her some help. The shop is on one of the main streets of the town and has many customers. Hristina’s husband also has a business – he is an auto driving trainer.

Hristina I. needs this $ 2 000 loan for working capital – to supply perfumery and cosmetics for her shop.

loans.use: To supply perfumery and cosmetics

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en:
Jordan D. (his last name means “a carpenter” in Bulgarian) is 44 years old. More then twenty years he has been a police officer but now he is retired. Jordan is divorced and has two daughters who are students at the moment.

Jordan D. succeeded to his grandfather’s craft. His grandfather had been a carpenter. He set his own workshop and started own business. He produces timber and boards mainly and sells them to construction companies. Soon he found a way to export his production to Macedonia and is highly motivated to increase and develop his business.

Jordan D. needs $ 2 000 to buy wooden material for his production.

loans.use: To buy wooden material

loans.name: Martha Virginia

texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working, venturesome and single woman, with 35 years old, these are the reasons by she decided to start her business two years ago. She is working in the elaboration of tortillas in order to increase her revenues and reach a better standard of life for her family.

The tortillas are a part of the Mexican diet and the quality of their elaboration is very important to determinate the acceptation from its consumers. In the Martha’s way, she needs to buy the flour in big quantities to cover all the demand and reach good prices in benefit of better utilities.

For that reason Martha requests a loan for $250 USD to buy her principal input: the corn Flour to assure the supply of this flour in a long time, the term that she requests to pay is of 3-6 months. She needs you help.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Martha es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es soltera, muy trabajadora y emprendedora y es precisamente por eso que hace dos años se decidió a iniciar un negocio de elaboración de tortillas, en busca de poder incrementar sus ingresos y alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida para ella y su familia.

Las tortillas son parte integral de la dieta del mexicano y en su elaboración es muy importante poder contar con materia prima de calidad, ya que esto determina la aceptación de las mismas por parte de los clientes. En el caso de Martha, ella necesita comprar la harina en grandes cantidades, para poder alcanzar buenos precios en beneficio de mejores utilidades.

Debido a lo anterior Martha solicita un préstamo por $250 USD para comprar su principal insumo que es la maseca (Harina de maíz) y tener asegurado el abasto de la misma, el plazo que solicita para pagar es de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: Puy her principal inputs

loans.name: Flor Del Roció

texts.en:
Flor del Rocio has a general store where she sells many different products. Her husband was the main reason she started the business as he provided the inspiration and the start up capital. She started with only $30 worth of products in stock but she has been growing progressively. Her husband also sells the chemical products he makes (mostly for cleaning) at their store. They have had to put railings around their home because there have been several robber attempts targeted at their business

Flor needs the loan so she can invest in toys for the upcoming Christmas season. She has had many clients approach her asking for these types of goods. She has 3 kids and is happily married.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has only had her ice cream shop open for 8 months. Her mother helped her setting up the store and often works with her. She sells ice cream and popsicles to children from a nearby school. She makes most of the ice cream from scratch. With the loan she will buy molds to make more popsicles. She will also invest in complimentary goods such as candies and snacks. She and her husband have one young child and they all live with Elena’s mother. They are trying to save money in order to buy their own home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy supplies to make ice cream and invest in complimentary products

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca started her business with a remittance she received from a family member in Italy. She sells cosmetics and jewelry to the people in her community. She often must sell her products on credit and she collects payments weekly. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for the upcoming holiday season when sales are higher.

This activity helps her provide for her young children who are still going to school. The biggest difficulty she has had is providing them with an education and adequate housing. She still lives in a house made of wood and her main goal is to make cement improvements.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy jewelery and cosmetics

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth owns a small shop where she sells many different products. Most of her sales are cosmetics but she also sells clothing, toys and even prepaid cell phone cards. She is only 22 years old but she is trying to establish her business so she will not have to depend on anyone. She does not have any children and is not married. She was raised by a single mom and she is proud that they have been able to make it as independent women. She will use the loan to invest in new products for the upcoming Christmas season.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new products that can be sold specifically for the Christams season

loans.name: Jesús

texts.en:
Mrs. Jesus is a 41 year-old man, married, works arduously to offer the better to his family. Six years ago he begun his stationery store in a small scale , little by little he has gone increasing his operations and his products, at the present he has a photocopier which gives service to his clients.

When he begun his business, his target was to generate bigger revenues to cover up the necessities of his family, as well as today he has his small business where his wife helps him.

He is needing a loan for $825 USD to buy merchandise, and be prepared for the new season when his clients increase the demand for his products, he thinks to payback his loan in a term of 6-12 months. Jesus thanks the support of the people who contribute to his loan, as well as the growth of his business.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Don Jesús es un hombre de 41 años de edad, casado, que trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a su familia. Hace aproximadamente 6 años que inicio su negocio de papelería de manera muy mínima, poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus operaciones y sus activos, en la actualidad ya tiene hasta una copiadora con la que da servicio a sus clientes.

Su objetivo al iniciar su negocio fue el de generar mayores ingresos para poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia, fue así como hoy en día tiene su pequeño negocio en donde le ayuda su esposa.

Él esta necesitando un crédito por $825 USD para destinarlo a la compra de mercancías, para de esa manera estar preparado para esta nueva temporada en que sus clientes incrementan la demanda por los productos que ofrece, piensa pagar su préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses. Jesús agradece el apoyo de las personas que quieran contribuir a su préstamo y de esa manera apoyar al crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Maria moved to Guayaquil from Cotopaxi in search of a better life. Although it was difficult to leave her family she felt that she could only provide a better future for her kids if she moved away. When she arrived to Guayaquil things were not too much better though. She lives in one of the worst sectors of the city but she is trying to move forward.

She runs a smalls shop where she sells snacks and other foods. She wants to invest in her store by buying new shelves and purchasing her products in bulk. With the extra profits she will improve her home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new shelves and products

loans.name: Aníbal

texts.en:
Anibal is a tailor who runs a shop out of his home. He makes men’s suits and formal clothing which he sells to the people in his community. He needs a loan in order to increase his production for the upcoming holiday season. He also wants to make investments to his shop that will allow him to sell to retailers. He wants to buy a couple more sewing machines so he can hire a staff. He is 50 years old but does not have a family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy new sewing machines and fabric

loans.name: Ceberiana

texts.en:
Two years ago Ceberiana began her miscellany business in her house when it had laminates ceiling. Today that house has changed and now the ceiling house is block and concrete. She is a married woman, with 58 years old, she has been characterized as a hard working woman to support to her family. Thanks to her decision about that she needed to earn an extra income, now she complements her miscellany business with food sales and flour tortillas sales.

She is requesting a credit for $750 USD to the purchase of her raw material and merchandise, she knows that the new season her clients will increase the demand for her products and for that reason she needs working capital to be prepared be able to supply the orders that her clients ask to her. The term that she requires to pay is 6-12 months and with the credit she will obtain better benefits for her business and her family.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Hace mas de dos años que Ceberiana inició su negocio de miscelánea en su casa cuando era de lámina, el día de hoy esa casa ha cambiado y ahora es de block y concreto. Ella es una mujer casada, de 58 años de edad que se ha caracterizado por trabajar duramente para salir adelante y apoyar a su familia. Gracias a su decisión de generar ingresos adicionales ahora complementa su negocio de miscelánea con venta de comidas y tortillas de harina.

Ella esta solicitando un crédito por $750 USD para la compra de sus materias primas, así como de mercancías, sabe que con la nueva temporada sus clientes incrementarán la demanda por sus productos y es por eso que necesita de capital de trabajo para estar preparada y poder afrontar y surtir los pedidos que le hagan. El plazo que requiere para pagar es de 6-12 meses, y con el crédito logrará beneficios para su negocio y su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of her raw material

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is father of five children and has 55 years old, he has been dedicate his life on sales, starting to work to an a pharmaceutical company, which had his services about 20 years, he was retired of this company without basic insure and no law recognizes as a saving funds and other in Mexico, so in this situation he had to support his family, at this moment he decided to used his abilities of salesman to star his own merchandise business with a little investment that he saving for his old job, with the pass of the years his progress was low but successful and fixed. Ricardo is convinced that while he always has a job, he could has the opportunity to grow and has success in the life.

Ricardo live in a free union with his woman, and also one of his sons helps him in the business, he has 15 years with his business and he is requesting for a loan of USD$750 to invest in merchandise for this Christmas season as a fireworks and little Christmas lights that have a lot of demand this time. He offers to repay this loan in a period of 4 to 8 months and thanks to you for your help and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Ricardo es padre de 5 niños y con 55 años de edad, el ha dedicado su vida a vender, empezando a trabajar para una compañía farmacéutica, a la cual le presto servicio durante 20 años, retirándose sin seguro y sin prestaciones de ley, se vio en la necesidad de proveer a su familia el sustento económico para una vida digna, fue entonces cuando decidió hacer uso de su habilidad como vendedor para emprender su propio negocio de mercería con un pequeño capital que contaba en ese momento, al paso de los años el progreso fue algo lento pero firme. Ricardo esta convencido que siempre que tenga trabajo tendrá la oportunidad de crecer y tener éxito en la vida.

Ricardo vive en unión libre con su mujer y uno de sus hijos le ayuda con el negocio, tiene con su negocio 15 años, el necesita de un crédito de USD$ 750 para invertir en la compra de juegos pirotécnicos y luces navideñas para esta temporada que tienen gran demanda, y esta dispuesto a pagar el crédito en un periodo de 4-8 meses, agradeciendo su ayuda para sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe was a mother and father of a kid of 6 years old, who in a moment was take care from his grandmother, time later his grandmother sickened and Maria had the necessity to change of job, looking for another kind of job she needed the way to obtain an income and support her family. This necessity made her to take the decision of start her own business and she decided in a general store business. Actually Maria has 40 years old and her son is 21 years and he is studding right now; the Maria’s business allows her to pay the son\'s studies and covers all the family expenses.

Maria has an established business, she try to has low cost and the beast service in her business to increment her sales and incomes, for this reason she is requesting for a loan of USD $ 1,825 to purchase and electric equipment (as a light generation with gas or diesel) to her business and from that way she will has a low light cost that is very high in Monterrey. Maria offers to repay this loan in a period of 6 to 12 months and thanks for your help and support.

** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

María Guadalupe era madre y padre al mismo tiempo de un niño de 6 años, el cual por algún tiempo fue cuidado por su abuela materna, al enfermar esta, María tuvo que dejar su trabajo y buscar otra forma de obtener el sustento para su familia y la necesidad la llevo a pensar en la apertura de un negocio, el cual decidió hacerlo en venta de abarrotes. Actualmente María tiene 40 años y su hijo tiene 21 años de edad y se encuentra estudiando; el negocio de Mary le ha permitido pagar los estudios de su hijo y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Actualmente María ya tiene su negocio establecido y ve la forma de ahorrar costos y hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su hijo necesita continuar estudiando y tiene que cubrir los gastos de su familia. Por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 1,825 para poder adquirir una sub-estación eléctrica que funciona como un generador de luz para su tienda lo que le abarata el costo de la luz que ella consume y es un costo muy caro en la ciudad de Monterrey. Ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un periodo de 6-12 meses y agradece su cooperación y ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase and electric equipment

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen lost her husband when her last and little baby had 1 year old, so with all her pain for her husband dead she had to work very hard to support her family and maintain her 5 sons. She knew that the life is not easy, she was a clear example of fight and constancy, so she started to sold used clothes and some bazaar articles, with the pass of the time she was increase her merchandise. Today she has 63 years old and has her business in a popular market and other store established in a fix place, she started her business 40 years ago, started low but with her effort Maria’s business grew slowly but sure and always go ahead with it.

Maria is requesting for a loan of USD$ 825 to purchase toys and Christmas merchandise that she is very sure that this season will sales all her merchandise, she offers to repay the loan in a term of 6 to 12 months.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

María del Carmen quedó viuda cuando su hijo el más pequeño apenas tenía 1 año de nacido, aún con la pena del fallecimiento de su esposo, ella tenía el deber de enfrentarse a la vida, ya que había que mantener a cinco niños. Como era conciente de que la vida no es fácil, ella se convirtió en claro ejemplo de lucha y superación, así comenzó vendiendo ropa usada y algunos artículos de bazar, al paso del tiempo fue incrementando su mercancía. Hoy ella tiene 63 años de edad y vende en un mercado ambulante y además tiene un puesto establecido, y lleva con este negocio 40 años, empezando muy lento pero con esfuerzo y superación lo esta sacando adelante.

Maria esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 825 para comprar juguetes y regalos navideños que ella esta segura se venderán muy bien en esta navidad, ofreciendo el pago del mismo en un periodo de 6 a 12 meses.

loans.use: Purchase toys and Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Ramos Parra

texts.en:
E. lives in San Juanito Chihuahua, she is working in the ice cream sales and she has a small place with video games. Her husband is a worker from a factory that produces wood and earns a minimum salary that is not enough to cover all the family necessities; E. with the necessity to have another income entrance, she started her own business; She began 2 years ago with the sale of products of ice with flavor and its presentation is in a bag, well-known in Mexico like \" bollo\". Then she bought a frozen and now she sells yokels, finally she acquired some video machine games.

E. has the enthusiasm to makes grow up her business and gives a better quality of life to her family, with 2 children to takes care, their are the force and the hope that E. needs to continue working as she is doing right now. She requires a loan of $1100 USD to enlarge her business and increase the quantity of video machine games, she hopes to increase her incomes with this loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

E. vive en San Juanito Chihuahua, se dedica a la venta de nieves, paletas y tiene en un pequeño espacio con juegos de video. Su esposo es un obrero en una fábrica que produce madera, por lo que gana un salario mínimo y no es suficiente para cubrir las necesidades de la familia; E. ante la necesidad de contar con otro ingreso inició su propio negocio. Comenzó hace 2 años con la venta de un producto de hielo de sabor y su presentación es en bolsa, conocido en México como “bollo”. Después compro un enfriador para la venta de sus paletas de hielo y finalmente unas maquinas de video juegos.

E. tiene el entusiasmo de hacer crecer su negocio y dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, con 2 pequeños por cuidar, de ellos nace la fuerza y la esperanza que tiene E. para seguir trabajando como lo hace hasta ahora. Requiere de un préstamo de $1100 USD para ampliar su negocio y aumentar la cantidad de juegos de video, ya que espera incrementar las ventas con este préstamo.

loans.use: Enlarge her business

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin is a mechanic since 16 years ago, he has 4 very young children and his family lives in San Juanito Chihuahua. He has a small mechanical factory, his pleasure for that area began since he was a boy, for that reason Fermin works so motivated and happiness. One of his worst worries is give a good education to his children and for that reason he works very hard every day.

The Fermin\'s biggest son is 16 years old and helps him in the factory in his free time, by this way the business has also become a place where the family is involved. He needs a loan of $1375 USD for the purchase of a forage machine, because is coursing the season of seeds gathering and Fermin is looking for a new business like he can rent the machine. He and his family expect your help and they thank your generosity. In a term of three month Fermin plans to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Fermin es un mecánico desde hace 16 años, tiene 4 hijos muy jóvenes y su familia vive en San Juanito Chihuahua. Tiene un pequeño taller mecánico, su gusto por la mecánica comenzó desde que era niño, por lo que Fermin desempaña su trabajo con mucho entusiasmó y alegría. Lo que más le preocupa, es darles una buena educación a sus hijos por lo que Fermin trabaja muy duro todos los días.

El hijo más grande de Fermin tiene 16 años y ayuda en el taller de su papá en sus tiempos libres, por lo que el negocio también se ha convertido en un lugar de convivencia familiar. El necesita un préstamo de $1375 USD para la compra de una maquina de forraje, ya que esta en curso la temporada de recolección de semillas y Fermin busca un nuevo negocio al rentar esta maquina. El y su familia esperan de tu ayuda y agradecen tu generosidad. En un término de tres meses Fermin planea regresar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of a forage machine

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.en:
Sandra was born 59 years ago and her husband died when she was very young and she had to take care her four children, for this reason she passed for a very hard situation and she had to maintain, educate and support her little children, so her uncle when he saw her situation and knowing her niece that she was a very entrepreneur and hard working girl, decided to help her given her a little place where she started selling hanging pots (piñatas in Mexico), bedroom clothes and clothes for children.

Today with 27 years of daily efforts, she produces and makes her owns merchandise with the support of her children, transforming her necessity in a example personal growing and also familiar success.

Sandra is requesting for a loan of USD $ 925 to purchase raw materials and some Christmas merchandise like Christmas images, lights, etc., to offers her clients this season, she promises to repay this loan in a term of 6 to 12 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Sandra nació hace 59 años, quedando viuda a muy temprana edad y quedo a cargo de sus cuatro hijos, por ello la necesidad que ella estaba atravesando era inminente en lo que respecta a criar, educar, alimentos y vestido para sus hijos pequeños, sus tíos al verla en esa situación y conociendo a su sobrina que era una persona emprendedora y muy trabajadora, decidieron apoyarla dándole un pequeño local en donde empezó revendiendo piñatas, sábanas, y vestidos de niño.

Hoy tras 27 años de esfuerzo diario, ella produce y fabrica sus propias mercancías con el apoyo de sus hijos, habiendo convertido su necesidad en un ejemplo de superación personal y familiar.

Sandra necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de USD $ 925 para comprar mercancía navideña como imágenes, misterios, luces, adornos, etc., para ofrecer a sus clientes en esta temporada, además frece pagar el crédito en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and some Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio has 32 years old and he used to work in a factory in which he earned the minimum salary and also he did not any law benefits as insurance, etc., and for this reason she was looking for the best for to work by himself so he decided to start his own business, he had a little money so he invested in merchandise like globes, sun glasses, little toys of different forms and uses, and other things, so now he has his own business and has 5 year with it, in general he sell things by season, it means, he look what season is coming and he buy things that could be useful this season.

Antonio lives in a free union with his woman and she helps him with the business, both have two kids and he is requesting for a loan of USD $ 475 to purchase merchandise for this season, in this case he wants to buy hats, gloves, scarf’s, etc that are very useful this cold season; he promises to repay the loan in a term of 5 to 10 months.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

Antonio tiene 32 años de edad, tenía un trabajo en una fabrica en la que ganaba el salario mínimo y sin prestaciones, por ello el estaba buscando la forma de independizarse y de obtener mejores ingresos así como calidad de vida, por lo que decidió abrir su propio negocio, con lo poco que tenía lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería como globos, lentes, muñequitas, entre otras cosas, y ahora ya tiene su negocio establecido, y lleva con el 5 años, por lo general vende cosas por temporadas, es decir, aprovecha la estación para surtirse de productos que tengan buena venta..

Antonio vive en unión libre con su mujer y ella le ayuda en el negocio y tienen dos hijos pequeños y necesita de un préstamo por USD $ 475 para comprar mercancía de temporada en este caso le interesa abastecerse de gorros, bufandas, guantes, etc que se usan mucho en la época de frío; espera pagar el crédito en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Mr G. owns a haircuttery, improvised in his own home, his aspiration is to be able to improve his home/business like his brothers in the center of the city.

\"For more than a decade,with my brothers, we have created a small haircuttery in the center of the city, now I have decided to become more independent and have connected a room in my house, I have dedicated my entire life to this, and now I need to have my own business, I am asking for $1,500.00 dollars to buy equipment and tools.\"

Español

El Sr. González cuenta con una peluquería improvisada en su casa, su deseo es poder acondicionarla en forma adecuada tal y como la tienen sus hermanos en el centro de la ciudad. “Hace ya mas de una década que en conjunto con mis hermanos echamos a andar una peluquería en el centro de la ciudad, hoy en día decidí independizarme y acople un cuarto de mi casa, toda mi vida me he dedicado a esto, hoy quiero tener mi propio negocio, solicito $1,500.00 dlls para comprar equipo y herramienta.”

loans.use: equipment for his Barbershop

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Español

La Sra. T. cuenta con un negocio pequeño ella vende abarrotes y papelería desde hace 13 años, lo tiene ubicado en su casa, vive con su única hija, es viuda. “Mi objetivo es seguir manteniendo mi negocio es por eso que ya cuento con artículos de papelería, desde que mi esposo falleció me he responsabilizado por sacar a adelante a mi hija, gracias a dios ella ya está grande y tarde o temprano formará una familia, anhelo agrandar mi negocio para asegurar mi futuro, solicito $1,000.00 dlls para comprar variedad de mercancía.”

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando Bendane N., married, 54 years old, native of Chelene, Province of Inhambane, father of 6 children. Given his parents' situation, as rural workers, he didn't have the opportunity to study beyond fifth grade, where he began to work very early on in a carpentry workshop in his home area (Inhambane). He continues this profession through the present time. Since the 1980's, he has been working on his own business. He opened a carpentry shop, the fruit of his own savings over years and years of work. Lately, his business has been doing well, and with good work from his two (2) assistants and his two (2) younger brothers, in addition to their three (3) children who are also carpenters, and through the profits from the carpentry and furniture-making shop, he pays the living expenses for the family and the school fees for the younger children.

With a loan of 40,000.00 meticais, he plans to buy good quality fabric and wood to maintain his stock and prevent him from having to make many separate trips to purchase raw materials, in addition to buying high quality fabric to meet demand and his customers' needs.

His work has a large impact, because it provides a service in building furniture at a low cost for the community, self-employment, as well as employing seven (7) other workers, who were trained in carpentry.

The original business description in Portuguese is below:

Localização: Bairro 7, Boane, Maputo - Mozambique Cliente: Armando Bendane N. Sector de actividade: Transformaçao - Carpintaria e estufaria Montante: 40.000,00mtn (1,540.00US$) Aplicação: Compra de madeira e artigos para estufaria Início: 20/11/2006 Período de pagamento: 14 meses Armando Bendane N., casado de 54 anos de idade, natural de chelene, província de Inhambane, casado e pai de 6 filhos. Nas de condições em que os seus pais se encontravam, sendo eles camponeses, não teve oportunidade de estudar para alem de quinta classe onde muito cedo teve que começar a trabalhar numa oficina de carpintaria na sua zona de origem ( Inhambane), profissão que tem na mão até aos dias de hoje. Desde os anos 80 vem assumindo um negócio pessoal, abriu a sua carpintaria própria fruto de valores poupados durante anos e anos de trabalho. Actualmente o seu negócio tem surtido bons resultados e bom desempenho dos seus dois (2) ajudantes e seus dois (2) irmão mais novos que, para alem dos seus três (3) filhos que também são carpinteiros, e através dos lucros da carpintaria e estufaria, paga as despesas domesticas da família e as escolaridade dos filhos mais novos.

Com empréstimo de 40.000,00MTN, pretende comprar madeira e tecido de boa qualidade para manter o “stock” e evitar efectuar muitas viagens para compra de matéria prima, para alem de que comprando tecido de qualidade satisfará a exigência e necessidades dos seus clientes. A sua actividade tem um grande impacto, porque providencia um serviço de fabrico de mobília a baixo custo para a comunidade, auto emprego, também emprega outros sete (7) trabalhadores, que foram formados naquela carpintaria.

loans.use: To buy wood for furniture manufacture
